And no other vegetable (although botanically a fruit) surpasses the annual production of tomatoes, now grown not only as a field crop but increasingly in plastic or glass greenhouses.

这些食物各有不同的营养价值（面包富含碳水化合物，鸡肉富含优质蛋白质，西红柿富含维生素C），但如果没有大量的化石燃料补贴，它们都无法如此丰富、稳定且经济地生产。最终，我们的粮食生产方式将会改变，但就目前而言，在可预见的未来，我们仍然无法在不依赖化石燃料的情况下养活世界。

Each of these foodstuffs has a different nutritional role (bread is eaten for its carbohydrates, chicken for its perfect protein, tomatoes for their vitamin C content) but none of them could be produced so abundantly, so reliably, and so affordably without considerable fossil fuel subsidies. Eventually, our food production will change, but for now, and for the foreseeable future, we cannot feed the world without relying on fossil fuels.

面包、鸡肉和西红柿的能源成本

The energy costs of bread, chicken, and tomatoes

鉴于面包种类繁多，我将只介绍几种西方饮食中常见的发酵面包，这些面包现在在从西非（法国长棍面包的故乡）到日本（几乎每家大型百货商店都有法式或德式面包店）等地都能买到。我们必须从小麦说起，值得庆幸的是，已有大量研究尝试量化所有燃料和电力投入，并比较不同谷物作物单位收获面积或单位产量的投入。[22]谷物种植在能源补贴体系中处于最低层，与我们选择的其他食物相比，所需的能源相对较少，但正如我们将看到的，它仍然需要相当多的能源。

Given the enormous variety of breads, I’m going to stick to just a few varieties of leavened breads common in Western diets and now available in places ranging from West Africa (outre-mer domain of the French baguette) to Japan (every major department store has a French or German bakery). We have to start with wheat, and helpfully there is no shortage of studies that have attempted to quantify all fuel and electricity inputs and to compare them per harvested area or per unit of yield for different kinds of grain crops.[22] Grain cultivation is at the bottom of the energy subsidy ladder, needing relatively little compared to our other chosen foodstuffs, but as we shall see, it still needs a surprisingly large amount of energy.

美国大平原大片农田高效生产雨养小麦，每公斤粮食仅需约 4 兆焦耳的能量。由于其中很大一部分能量是以原油提炼的柴油形式提供的，因此用当量来比较可能比用标准能量单位（焦耳）更直观。[23] 此外，以每单位可食用产品（无论是 1 公斤、一条面包还是一顿饭）的体积来表示柴油燃料的需求，可以更容易地想象出这种能源补贴。

Efficient American production of rain-fed wheat on the large fields of the Great Plains requires only about 4 megajoules per kilogram of grain. Because such a large share of this energy is in the form of diesel fuel refined from crude oil, the comparison might be more tangible in terms of equivalents rather than in standard energy units (joules).[23] Moreover, expressing the needs for diesel fuel in terms of volumes per unit of edible product (be it 1 kilogram, a loaf of bread, or a meal) makes such energy subsidies more readily imaginable.

柴油每升含有36.9兆焦耳的能量，因此，大平原小麦的典型能源成本几乎正好是每公斤100毫升（1分升或0.1升）柴油——略低于美制杯计量单位的一半。[24]我将使用柴油的特定体积当量来标注各种食品生产过程中所蕴含的能量。

With diesel fuel containing 36.9 megajoules per liter, the typical energy cost of wheat from the Great Plains is almost exactly 100 milliliters (1 deciliter or 0.1 liters) of diesel fuel per kilogram—just a bit less than half of the US cup measurement.[24] I will use specific volume equivalents of diesel fuel to label individual foodstuffs with the energy embedded in their production.

最基本的酸面包是发酵面包中最简单的一种，也是欧洲文明的主食：它只包含面包粉、水和盐，而发酵剂当然也是由面粉和水制成的。一公斤这种面包大约含有580克面粉、410克水和10克盐。[25]碾磨——也就是去除种子的麸皮（外层）——会使磨碎的谷物质量减少约25%（面粉提取率为72%至76%）。[26]这意味着，要获得580克面包粉，我们需要大约800克全麦，而生产这些全麦需要消耗相当于80毫升柴油的燃料。

Basic sourdough bread is the simplest kind of a leavened bread, the staple of European civilization: it contains just bread flour, water, and salt, and the leavening is made, of course, from flour and water. A kilogram of this bread will be about 580 grams of flour, 410 grams of water, and 10 grams of salt.[25] Milling—that is, removing the seed’s bran, the outer layer—reduces the mass of milled grains by about 25 percent (a flour extraction rate of 72–76 percent).[26] This means that to get 580 grams of bread flour, we have to start with about 800 grams of whole wheat, whose production requires 80 milliliters of diesel fuel equivalent.

将谷物磨成面粉生产白面包粉大约需要 50 毫升/公斤的燃料，而现代高效企业大规模烘焙（使用天然气和电力）的公开数据显示，燃料消耗量为 100-200 毫升/公斤。[27]因此，种植谷物、磨面粉并烘焙一个 1 公斤的酸面包所需的能量至少相当于 250 毫升柴油，这个体积略大于美式量杯。对于一个标准法棍面包（250 克），其能量消耗相当于约 2 汤匙柴油；对于一个大的德国农家面包（2 公斤），则相当于约 2 杯柴油（全麦面包的消耗量会更少）。

Milling the grain needs an equivalent of about 50 mL/kg to produce white bread flour, while published data for large-scale baking in modern efficient enterprises—consuming natural gas and electricity—indicate fuel equivalents of 100–200 mL/kg.[27] Growing the grain, milling it, and baking a 1-kilogram sourdough loaf thus requires an energy input equivalent of at least 250 milliliters of diesel fuel, a volume slightly larger than the American measuring cup. For a standard baguette (250 grams), the embedded energy equivalent is about 2 tablespoons of diesel fuel; for a large German Bauernbrot (2 kilograms), it would be about 2 cups of diesel fuel (less for a wholewheat loaf).

实际的化石能源成本更高，因为现在只有一小部分面包是在购买地烘焙的。即使在法国，社区面包店也正在消失，法棍面包由大型面包厂分销：工业规模效率带来的能源节约被运输成本的增加所抵消，总成本（从种植和磨面到大型面包厂烘焙和分销）仍然很高。运送到远方消费者的面包）的等效能量消耗可能高达 600 毫升/千克！

The real fossil energy cost is higher still, because only a small share of bread is now baked where it is bought. Even in France, neighborhood boulangeries have been disappearing and baguettes are distributed from large bakeries: energy savings from industrial-scale efficiency are negated by increased transportation costs, and the total cost (from growing and milling grain to baking in a large bakery and distributing bread to distant consumers) may have an equivalent energy consumption as high as 600 mL/kg!

但如果面包可食用质量与所含能量的典型比例（大约为5:1，即1公斤面包相当于约210克柴油）高得令人不安，请记住，我之前已经提到过，谷物——即使是经过加工转化成我们喜爱的食物——在我们食物能量来源的阶梯上也处于最底层。如果遵循这种可疑的饮食建议（现在一些推广者将其冠以误导性的“旧石器时代饮食”之名），即完全避免食用谷物，转而只食用肉类、鱼类、蔬菜和水果，将会带来怎样的后果？

But if the bread’s typical (roughly 5:1) ratio of edible mass to the mass of embedded energy (1 kilogram of bread compared to about 210 grams of diesel fuel) seems uncomfortably high, recall that I have already noted that grains—even grains after processing and conversion into our favorite foods—are at the bottom of our food energy subsidy ladder. What would be the consequences of following such a dubious dietary recommendation, now pushed by some promoters under the misleading label of the “Paleolithic diet,” as avoiding all cereals and switching instead to diets composed only of meat, fish, vegetables, and fruit?

与其追踪牛肉（一种早已饱受诟病的肉类）的能源成本，我更愿意量化生产效率最高的肉类——集中式动物饲养场（CAFO）中大型鸡舍饲养的肉鸡的能源消耗。就鸡肉而言，这意味着将成千上万只鸡饲养在狭长的矩形鸡舍中，它们拥挤在光线昏暗的空间里（相当于月光下的夜晚），饲养约七周后被送去屠宰。[28]美国农业部每年都会发布家畜饲料转化率的统计数据，在过去的五十年里，这些比率（以每单位活重的玉米粒饲料量表示）显示，牛肉和猪肉的饲料转化率没有下降趋势，而鸡肉的饲料转化率则显著提高。[29]

Rather than tracing the energy cost of beef (a meat that has already been much maligned), I will instead quantify the energy burdens of the most efficiently produced meat—that of broilers reared in large barns in what have become known as CAFOs, central animal feeding operations. In the case of chicken, this means housing and feeding tens of thousands of birds in long rectangular structures where they are crowded in dimly lit spaces (the equivalent of a moonlit night) and fed for about seven weeks before being taken away for slaughter.[28] The US Department of Agriculture publishes statistics on the annual feeding efficiency of domestic animals, and over the past five decades these ratios (units of feed expressed in terms of corn grain per unit of live weight) show no downward trends for either beef or pork, but impressive gains for chicken.[29]

1950年，每单位活重的肉鸡需要3单位饲料；如今，这一数字仅为1.82，约为猪饲料消耗量的三分之一，牛饲料消耗量的七分之一。[30]显然，整只鸡（包括羽毛和骨头）不会被食用，考虑到可食用重量（约占活重的60%），最低饲料与肉的比例为3:1。生产一只美国鸡（其平均可食用重量现在几乎正好是1公斤）需要3公斤玉米。[31]玉米高效的雨养种植方式产量高，能源成本相对较低——相当于每公斤玉米消耗约50毫升柴油——但灌溉玉米的能源成本可能是雨养饲料的两倍，而且典型的玉米产量和世界各地的饲料转化率都低于美国。因此，仅饲料成本一项就可能低至每公斤可食用肉类消耗150毫升柴油，也可能高达每公斤750毫升。

In 1950, 3 units of feed were needed per unit of live broiler weight; now that number is just 1.82, about a third of the rate for pigs and a seventh of the rate for cattle.[30] Obviously, the entire bird (including feathers and bones) is not eaten, and the adjustment for edible weight (about 60 percent of live weight) puts the lowest feed-to-meat ratio at 3:1. Producing one American chicken (whose average edible weight is now almost exactly 1 kilogram) needs 3 kilograms of grain corn.[31] Corn’s efficient, rain-fed cultivation has high yields and relatively low energy costs—equivalent to about 50 milliliters of diesel fuel per kilogram of grain—but the energy cost of irrigated corn may be twice as high as that of rain-fed feed, and typical corn yields and feeding efficiencies around the world are lower than in the US. As a result, feed costs alone can be as low as 150 milliliters of diesel fuel per kilogram of edible meat, and as high as 750 mL/kg.

饲料的大规模洲际贸易也带来了额外的能源成本：其中以美国玉米和大豆的运输以及巴西大豆的销售为主。巴西大豆的种植每公斤需要相当于100毫升柴油的燃料，但将大豆从产区用卡车运到港口再运往欧洲，能源成本就会翻倍。[32]肉鸡养殖至屠宰体重也需要能源用于鸡舍的供暖、空调和维护，以及供水、锯末供应和废物处理。这些需求因地域而异（主要是由于夏季空调和冬季供暖），因此，加上饲料运输的能源成本，每公斤可食用肉的能源消耗量差异很大——从50毫升到300毫升不等。[33]

Further energy costs arise from a large-scale intercontinental trade in feedstuffs: it is dominated by the shipment of American corn and soybeans and the sale of Brazilian soybeans. Brazilian soybean cultivation requires the equivalent of 100 milliliters of diesel fuel per kilogram of grain, but trucking the crop from producing areas to ports and shipping it to Europe doubles the energy cost.[32] Growing broilers to slaughter weight also requires energy for heating, air conditioning, and maintaining the poultry houses, for supplying water and sawdust, and for removing and composting waste. These requirements vary widely with location (above all, due to summer air conditioning and winter heating), and hence when combined with the energy cost of delivered feed a wide range of volumes is produced—from 50 to 300 milliliters per kilogram of edible meat.[33]

因此，饲养这些家禽最保守的综合能耗相当于每公斤肉消耗约200毫升柴油，但实际数值可能高达1升。再加上屠宰和加工家禽（如今鸡肉大多以分割部位而非整只肉鸡的形式销售）、零售、储存和家用冷藏以及最终烹饪所需的能量，将一公斤烤鸡端上餐桌所需的总能量至少达到300-350毫升原油：这相当于近半瓶葡萄酒的体积（对于效率最低的生产商而言，甚至超过一升）。

The most conservative combined rate for feeding and rearing the birds would be thus an equivalent of about 200 milliliters of diesel fuel per kilogram of meat, but the values can go as high as 1 liter. Adding the energy needed for slaughtering and processing the birds (chicken meat is now overwhelmingly marketed as parts, not as whole broilers), retailing, storing and home refrigeration, and eventual cooking raises the total energy requirement for putting a kilogram of roasted chicken on dinner plates to at least 300–350 milliliters of crude oil: a volume equal to almost half a bottle of wine (and for the least efficient producers, to more than a liter).

鸡肉的最低吸水率300–350毫升/公斤，与面包210–250毫升/公斤的吸水率相比，效率显著提高，这体现在鸡肉相对实惠的价格上：在美国城市，一公斤白面包的平均价格仅比一公斤整鸡的平均价格低约5%（而全麦面包的价格则高出35%！），而在法国，一公斤普通整鸡的价格仅比面包的平均价格高出约25%。[34]这有助于解释鸡肉为何迅速崛起，成为所有西方国家的主要肉类（在全球范围内，由于中国巨大的需求，猪肉仍然占据主导地位）。

The minima of 300–350 mL/kg is a remarkably efficient performance compared to the rates of 210–250 mL/kg for bread, and this is reflected in the comparably affordable prices of chicken: in US cities, the average price of a kilogram of white bread is only about 5 percent lower than the average price per kilogram of whole chicken (and wholewheat bread is 35 percent more expensive!), while in France a kilogram of standard whole chicken costs only about 25 percent more than the average price of bread.[34] This helps to explain the rapid rise of chicken to become the dominant meat in all Western countries (globally, pork still leads, thanks to China’s enormous demand).

鉴于素食主义者推崇植物性饮食，且媒体也广泛报道了肉类生产对环境造成的高昂成本，你或许会认为，鸡肉生产过程中能源消耗的减少，远不及蔬菜种植和销售过程中能源消耗的增加。然而，这种想法是错误的。事实上，情况恰恰相反。要说明这些令人惊讶的高能源消耗，没有什么比仔细观察番茄更合适的例子了。番茄拥有所有优点——诱人的色泽、多样的形状、光滑的表皮和多汁的果肉。从植物学角度来看，番茄是番茄（Lycopersicon esculentum）的果实。番茄是一种原产于中美洲和南美洲的小型植物，在欧洲人首次跨大西洋航行时期被引入世界其他地区，但它花了数代人的时间才获得全球认可。[35]无论是直接食用、加入汤中、填馅、烘烤、切碎、煮熟、打成泥状做成酱汁，还是添加到无数沙拉和熟食中，它现在都深受全球喜爱，从其原产地墨西哥和秘鲁到西班牙、意大利、印度和中国（现在是其最大的生产国）。

Given that vegans extol eating plants, and that the media have reported extensively on the high environmental cost of meat, you might think that gains in the energy cost of chicken have been surpassed by those in the cultivation and marketing of vegetables. You would be mistaken to think that. The opposite has been true, in fact, and there is no better example to illustrate these surprisingly high energy burdens than taking a close look at tomatoes. They have it all—an attractive color, a variety of shapes, smooth skin, and a juicy interior. Botanically, a tomato is the fruit of the Lycopersicon esculentum, a small plant native to Central and South America that was introduced to the rest of the world during the age of first European transatlantic sailings but which took generations to establish worldwide appeal.[35] Eaten out of hand, in soups, filled, baked, chopped, boiled, pureed into sauces, and added to countless salads and cooked dishes, it is now a global favorite embraced in countries ranging from its native Mexico and Peru to Spain, Italy, India, and China (now its largest producer).

营养学著作称赞番茄富含维生素C：事实上，一个大番茄（200克）就能提供成人每日推荐摄入量的三分之二。[36]但与所有新鲜多汁的水果一样，人们食用番茄并非为了获取能量；它本质上只是一个形状诱人的容器，里面装满了水，占其质量的95%。其余部分主要是碳水化合物、少量蛋白质和微量的脂肪。

Nutritional compendia praise its high vitamin C content: indeed, a large tomato (200 grams) can provide two-thirds of the daily recommended requirement for an adult.[36] But as with all fresh and juicy fruits, it is not eaten for its energy content; it is, overwhelmingly, just an appealingly shaped container of water, which comprises 95 percent of its mass. The remainder is mostly carbohydrate, a bit of protein, and a mere trace of fat.

只要气候温暖至少有90天，番茄几乎可以在任何地方种植，包括斯德哥尔摩附近海滨小屋的露台上，或者加拿大草原上的花园里（这两种情况下都需要从室内育苗开始）。然而，商业化种植则截然不同。与现代社会消费的绝大多数水果和蔬菜一样，番茄种植是一项高度专业化的产业，北美和欧洲超市里出售的大多数品种都产自少数几个地方。在美国，这些地方是加利福尼亚州；在欧洲，则是意大利和西班牙。为了提高产量、改善品质并降低能源投入，番茄越来越多地采用塑料薄膜覆盖的单层或多层隧道式温室或大棚种植——不仅在加拿大和荷兰，在墨西哥、中国、西班牙和意大利也是如此。

Tomatoes can be grown anywhere with at least 90 days of warm weather, including the deck of a seaside cottage near Stockholm or in a garden on the Canadian Prairies (in both cases, from plants started indoors). Commercial cultivation is a different matter, however. As with all but a small share of the fruits and vegetables that are consumed in modern societies, tomato cultivation is a highly specialized affair and most of the varieties available in North American and European supermarkets come from only a few places. In the US it is California; in Europe it is Italy and Spain. In order to increase their yield, improve their quality, and reduce the intensity of energy inputs, tomatoes are increasingly grown in plastic-covered single- or multi-tunnel enclosures or in greenhouses—not only in Canada and the Netherlands but also in Mexico, China, Spain, and Italy.

这又让我们回到了化石燃料和电力的话题。塑料是建造多层玻璃温室的一种更经济的选择，而且番茄的种植也需要塑料夹、楔子和排水槽等装置。在露天种植的情况下，会使用塑料薄膜覆盖土壤，以减少水分蒸发并防止杂草生长。塑料化合物的合成依赖于碳氢化合物（原油和天然气），它们既是原材料（原料），也是生产所需的能源。原料包括乙烷和其他天然气液体，以及原油炼制过程中产生的石脑油。天然气也用于塑料生产，并且（如前所述）是合成氨最重要的原料——氢的来源。其他碳氢化合物则用作生产保护性化合物（杀虫剂和杀菌剂）的原料，因为即使是玻璃或塑料温室内的植物也无法完全避免病虫害的侵袭。

This brings us back to fossil fuels and electricity. Plastics are a less expensive alternative to constructing multi-tunnel glass greenhouses, and the cultivation of tomatoes also requires plastic clips, wedges, and gutter arrangements. Where the plants are grown in the open, plastic sheets are used to cover the soil in order to reduce water evaporation and prevent weeds. The synthesis of plastic compounds relies on hydrocarbons (crude oil and natural gas), both for raw materials (feedstocks) and for the energy needed to produce them. Feedstocks include ethane and other natural gas liquids, and naphtha produced during the refining of crude oil. Natural gas is also used to fuel plastic production, and it is (as already noted) the most important feedstock—the source of hydrogen—for the synthesis of ammonia. Other hydrocarbons serve as feedstocks to produce protective compounds (insecticides and fungicides), because even plants inside glass or plastic greenhouses are not immune to pests and infections.

将番茄种植的年度运营成本用货币表示起来很简单，只需将幼苗、肥料、农药、水、供暖和人工等支出加总，再按比例分摊使用超过一年的原始结构和设备（例如金属支架、塑料罩、玻璃、管道、水槽和加热器）的成本即可。但要汇总一份全面的能源账单就没那么简单了。直接能源投入很容易根据电费和汽油或柴油购买量来量化，但计算生产过程中的间接能源消耗则需要一些专门的会计方法，而且通常还需要一些假设。

Expressing the annual operating costs of tomato cultivation in monies is done easily by adding up the expenditure on seedlings, fertilizers, agrochemicals, water, heating, and labor, and by prorating the costs of original structures and devices—metal supports, plastic covers, glass, pipes, troughs, heaters—that are in place for more than one year. But putting a comprehensive energy bill together is not that simple. Direct energy inputs are easy to quantify on the basis of electricity bills and gasoline or diesel fuel purchases, but calculating the indirect flows into the production of materials requires some specialized accounting, and usually some assumptions.

详细的研究量化了这些投入，并将其乘以典型的能源成本：例如，合成、配制和包装 1 公斤氮肥需要相当于近 1.5 升柴油的燃料。不出所料，这些研究得出的总量差异很大，但其中一项研究——或许是对西班牙阿尔梅里亚的加热和非加热多层隧道温室中番茄种植进行的最细致的研究——得出结论：净产量的累计能源需求，前者（加热）每公斤超过 500 毫升柴油（超过两杯），而后者每公斤仅需 150 毫升柴油。[37]

Detailed studies have quantified these inputs and multiplied them by their typical energy costs: for example, the synthesis, formulation, and packaging of 1 kilogram of nitrogenous fertilizer requires an equivalent of nearly 1.5 liters of diesel fuel. Not surprisingly, these studies show a wide range of totals, but one study—perhaps the most meticulous study of tomato cultivation in the heated and unheated multi-tunnel greenhouses of Almería in Spain—concluded that the cumulative energy demand of net production is more than 500 milliliters of diesel fuel (more than two cups) per kilogram for the former (heated) and only 150 mL/kg for the latter harvest.[37]

我们之所以面临如此高的能源成本，很大程度上是因为温室气体排放。番茄是世界上施肥量最大的作物之一：单位面积的番茄所施用的氮肥（以及磷肥）量是美国主要农作物玉米的10倍。[38]此外，番茄还会施用硫、镁和其他微量元素，以及用于防治病虫害的化学物质。温室种植中最主要的能源消耗是供暖：它延长了生长季，提高了作物质量，但不可避免地，在寒冷气候下，供暖会成为最大的能源消耗来源。

We get this high energy cost, in large part, because greenhouse tomatoes are among the world’s most heavily fertilized crops: per unit area they receive up to 10 times as much nitrogen (and also phosphorus) as is used to produce grain corn, America’s leading field crop.[38] Sulfur, magnesium, and other micronutrients are also used, as are chemicals protecting against insects and fungi. Heating is the most important direct use of energy in greenhouse cultivation: it extends the growing season and improves crop quality but, inevitably, when deployed in colder climates it becomes the single largest user of energy.

位于阿尔梅里亚省最南端的塑料大棚是世界上最大的商业化农产品种植区：面积约4万公顷（相当于20公里×20公里），在卫星图像上清晰可见——您可以在谷歌地球上亲自查看。您甚至可以体验谷歌街景，感受这些低矮的塑料覆盖建筑群带来的奇特景象。在这片塑料海洋下，西班牙种植户及其当地和非洲移民劳工每年（在超过40摄氏度的高温下）生产近300万吨早熟和非当季蔬菜（西红柿、辣椒、四季豆、西葫芦、茄子、甜瓜）以及一些水果，其中约80%出口到欧盟国家。[39]一辆卡车从阿尔梅里亚运送13吨西红柿到斯德哥尔摩，行程3745公里，消耗约1120升柴油。[40]这意味着每公斤西红柿大约需要 90 毫升水，而区域配送中心的运输、储存和包装以及向商店的配送又使这一数字上升到每公斤大约 130 毫升。

Plastic greenhouses located in the southernmost part of Almería province are the world’s largest covered area of commercial cultivation of produce: about 40,000 hectares (think of a 20 km × 20 km square) and easily identifiable on satellite images—look for yourself on Google Earth. You can even take a ride on Google Street View, which offers an otherworldly experience of these low-elevation, plastic-covered structures. Under this sea of plastic, the Spanish growers and their local and immigrant African laborers produce annually (in temperatures often surpassing 40°C) nearly 3 million tons of early and out-of-season vegetables (tomatoes, peppers, green beans, zucchini, eggplant, melons) and some fruit, and export about 80 percent of it to EU countries.[39] A truck transporting a 13-ton load of tomatoes from Almería to Stockholm covers 3,745 kilometers and consumes about 1,120 liters of diesel fuel.[40] That works out to nearly 90 milliliters per kilogram of tomatoes, and transport, storage, and packing at the regional distribution centers as well as deliveries to stores raises that to nearly 130 mL/kg.

这意味着，在斯堪的纳维亚超市购买的来自阿尔梅里亚温室大棚的番茄，其生产和运输过程中隐含的能源成本高得惊人。总计相当于每公斤约650毫升柴油，或者说，每个中等大小（125克）的番茄需要消耗超过五汤匙（每汤匙含14.8毫升）的柴油！您可以轻松且不浪费地在桌面上演示这种化石燃料补贴：切开一个125克大小的番茄，摊开在盘子上，淋上5-6汤匙深色食用油（芝麻油的颜色与之非常接近）。当您对这种简单食物所承载的化石燃料负担感到震惊时，您可以将盘子里的食物盛入碗中，再加入两三个番茄、一些酱油、盐、胡椒粉和芝麻，然后……享用一份美味的番茄沙拉吧。有多少素食主义者在享用沙拉时意识到，它背后蕴藏着大量的化石燃料？

This means that when bought in a Scandinavian supermarket, tomatoes from Almería’s heated plastic greenhouses have a stunningly high embedded production and transportation energy cost. Its total is equivalent to about 650 mL/kg, or more than five tablespoons (each containing 14.8 milliliters) of diesel fuel per medium-sized (125 gram) tomato! You can stage—easily and without any waste—a tabletop demonstration of this fossil fuel subsidy, by slicing a tomato of that size, spreading it out on a plate, and pouring over it 5–6 tablespoons of dark oil (sesame oil replicates the color well). When sufficiently impressed by the fossil fuel burden of this simple food, you can transfer the plate’s contents to a bowl, add two or three additional tomatoes, some soy sauce, salt, pepper, and sesame seeds, and enjoy a tasty tomato salad. How many vegans enjoying the salad are aware of its substantial fossil fuel pedigree?

海鲜背后的柴油

Diesel oil behind seafood

现代社会农业生产力的提高使得陆地狩猎（季节性猎杀某些野生哺乳动物和鸟类）在所有富裕社会中都成为次要的营养来源。野生动物肉（大多为非法猎杀）在撒哈拉以南非洲地区仍然较为常见，但即使在这些地区，随着人口的快速增长，野生动物肉也已不再是主要的动物蛋白来源。相比之下，海洋狩猎从未像今天这样广泛和密集，庞大的船队——从大型现代化海上工厂到破旧的小船——在世界各大洋中搜寻野生鱼类和甲壳类动物。[41]

High agricultural productivities of modern societies have made hunting on land (the seasonal shooting of some wild mammals and birds) a marginal source of nutrition in all affluent societies. Wild meat, mostly illegally hunted, is still more common throughout sub-Saharan Africa, but with rapidly growing populations even there it has ceased to be a major source of animal protein. By contrast, marine hunting has never been practiced more widely and more intensively than it is today, as huge fleets of ships—ranging from large modern floating factories to decrepit small boats—scour the world’s oceans for wild fish and crustaceans.[41]

事实证明，捕捞意大利人诗意地称为“海鲜”（frutti di mare）的海产品是食物供应中最耗能的过程。当然，并非所有海产品都难以捕捞，而且捕捞许多仍然数量丰富的物种并不需要远征南太平洋的偏远地区。捕捞凤尾鱼、沙丁鱼或鲭鱼等数量丰富的远洋（生活在水面附近）物种，所需的能源投入相对较小——间接的能源投入用于建造船只和制作大型渔网，直接的能源投入则用于船舶发动机使用的柴油燃料。据最佳记录显示，捕捞这些鱼类的能源消耗低至每公斤100毫升，相当于不到半杯柴油。[42]

As it turns out, capturing what the Italians so poetically call frutti di mare is the most energy-intensive process of food provision. Of course, not all seafood is difficult to catch, and harvesting many still-abundant species does not require long expeditions to the remote areas of the southern Pacific. Capturing such plentiful pelagic (living near the surface) species as anchovies and sardines or mackerel can be done with a relatively small energy investment—indirectly in constructing ships and making large nets, directly in the diesel fuel used for ship engines. The best accounts show energy expenditures as low as 100 mL/kg for their capture, an equivalent of less than half a cup of diesel fuel.[42]

如果你想吃化石燃料碳足迹最低的野生鱼类，那就选择沙丁鱼。所有海鲜的平均碳排放量都高得惊人——700毫升/公斤（几乎相当于一整瓶葡萄酒的柴油）——而某些野生虾和龙虾的最高碳排放量更是令人难以置信地超过10升/公斤（而且这其中还包括大量不可食用的虾壳！）。[43]这意味着，仅仅捕捞两串中等大小的野生虾（总重100克）就可能需要0.5-1升柴油——相当于2-4杯燃料。

If you want to eat wild fish with the lowest-possible fossil carbon footprint, stick to sardines. The mean for all seafood is stunningly high—700 mL/kg (nearly a full wine bottle of diesel fuel)—and the maxima for some wild shrimp and lobsters are, incredibly, more than 10 L/kg (and that includes a great deal of inedible shells!).[43] This means that just two skewers of medium-sized wild shrimp (total weight of 100 grams) may require 0.5–1 liters of diesel fuel to catch—the equivalent of 2–4 cups of fuel.

但你可能会反驳说，现在虾大多是人工养殖的​​，而这些大规模的工业化养殖难道没有享受到同样的待遇吗？我们成功地利用肉鸡的这些优势，在海产品上也能得到应用吗？可惜，不能，因为它们的代谢方式截然不同。肉鸡是草食性动物，在圈养环境下，它们用于活动的能量消耗有限。因此，喂食合适的植物性饲料——现在主要是玉米和大豆混合饲料——可以促进它们的快速生长。然而，人们更喜欢食用的海产品（鲑鱼、鲈鱼、金枪鱼）是肉食性动物，为了它们的正常生长，需要喂食富含蛋白质的鱼粉和鱼油，这些鱼粉和鱼油通常来自野生捕捞的鱼类，例如凤尾鱼、沙丁鱼、毛鳞鱼、鲱鱼和鲭鱼。

But, you will object, shrimp are now mostly aquacultured, and haven’t these large-scale, industrial-type operations enjoyed the same advantages that we have exploited so successfully with broilers? Alas, no, because of their fundamental metabolic difference. Broilers are herbivores, and when in confinement their energy expenditure on activity is limited. Therefore feeding them suitable plant matter—now mostly a combination of corn- and soybean-based mixtures—will make them grow fast. Unfortunately, the marine species that people prefer to eat (salmon, sea bass, tuna) are carnivorous, and for their proper growth they need to be fed protein-rich fish meals and fish oil derived from catches of wild species such as anchovies, pilchards, capelin, herring, and mackerel.

水产养殖业的扩张——其全球总产量（包括淡水和海水）目前已逼近全球野生捕捞量（2018年水产养殖产量为8200万吨，而野生捕捞量为9600万吨）——缓解了部分过度捕捞的肉食性鱼类野生种群的压力，但也加剧了对小型草食性鱼类的过度捕捞，因为不断增长的草食性鱼类捕捞量是水产养殖业扩张的必要原料。[44]因此，在网箱中养殖地中海鲈鱼（希腊和土耳其是其主要生产国）的能源成本通常相当于每公斤2-2.5升柴油（大约相当于三瓶葡萄酒的体积）——也就是说，与捕捞类似大小的野生鱼类的能源成本处于同一数量级。

Expanding aquaculture—whose total global output, freshwater and marine, is now closing in on the worldwide wild catch (in 2018 it was 82 million tons compared to 96 million tons of wild-caught species)—has eased the pressure on some overfished wild stocks of preferred carnivorous fishes, but it has intensified the exploitation of smaller herbivorous species whose growing harvests are needed to feed expanding aquaculture.[44] As a result, the energy costs of growing Mediterranean sea bass in cages (Greece and Turkey are its leading producers) are commonly equivalent to as much as 2–2.5 liters of diesel fuel per kilogram (a volume about the same as three bottles of wine)—that is, of the same order of magnitude as the energy costs of capturing similarly sized wild species.

正如预期的那样，只有那些以植物性饲料为主要食物、生长良好的养殖草食性鱼类——尤其是不同种类的中国鲤鱼（鲢鱼、鲢鱼、黑鲤和草鱼最为常见）——才具有较低的能量消耗，通常低于300毫升/公斤。然而，除了奥地利、捷克、德国和波兰传统的圣诞夜晚餐之外，鲤鱼在欧洲并不受欢迎，在北美也几乎无人食用。与此同时，由于寿司在全球范围内的迅速普及，金枪鱼的需求量却在飙升，而金枪鱼的某些品种如今已跻身最濒危的顶级海洋食肉动物之列。

As expected, only aquacultured herbivorous fish that grow well consuming plant-based feed—most notably, different species of Chinese carp (bighead, silver, black, and grass carp are the most common)—have a low energy cost, typically less than 300 mL/kg. But, traditional Christmas Eve dinners in Austria, Czech Republic, Germany, and Poland aside, carp is quite an unpopular culinary choice in Europe and it is barely eaten in North America, while demand for tuna, some species of which are now among the most endangered top marine carnivores, has been soaring thanks to the rapid worldwide adoption of sushi.

因此，证据确凿无疑：我们的食物供应——无论是主食谷物、鸣叫的鸟儿、喜爱的蔬菜，还是因其营养价值而备受赞誉的海鲜——都越来越依赖化石燃料。这一基本事实常常被那些……所忽视。不要试图理解我们世界的真实运作方式，也不要去质疑那些预测快速脱碳的人。这些人如果知道我们目前的状况无法轻易或迅速改变，一定会感到震惊：正如我们在前一章中所看到的，依赖的普遍性和规模都太大了，根本无法改变。

So, the evidence is inescapable: our food supply—be it staple grains, clucking birds, favorite vegetables, or seafood praised for its nutritious quality—has become increasingly dependent on fossil fuels. This fundamental reality is commonly ignored by those who do not try to understand how our world really works and who are now predicting rapid decarbonization. Those same people would be shocked to know that our present situation cannot be changed easily or rapidly: as we saw in the preceding chapter, the ubiquity and the scale of the dependence are too large for that.

燃料和食品

Fuel and food

多项研究追踪了粮食生产对现代能源（主要是化石能源）依赖程度的增长，从19世纪初的完全没有能源投入，到如今的高速增长（从谷物种植每公顷不到0.25吨原油，到温室大棚种植的10倍不等）。[45]或许，要了解这种全球依赖程度的增长和范围，最好的方法是将外部能源补贴的增长与耕地面积的扩张以及世界人口的增长进行比较。1900年至2000年间，全球人口增长不到四倍（确切地说是3.7倍），而耕地面积增长了约40%，但我的计算表明，农业领域人为能源补贴增长了90倍，其中大部分来自农用化学品和机械直接消耗的燃料。[46]

Several studies have traced the growth of food production’s dependence on modern—overwhelmingly fossil—energy inputs, from their absence in the early 19th century to recent rates (ranging from less than 0.25 tons of crude oil per hectare in grain farming to 10 times as much in heated greenhouse cultivation).[45] Perhaps the best way to realize the rise and the extent of this global dependence is to compare the increase of external energy subsidies to the expansion of cultivated land and to the growth of the world’s population. Between 1900 and the year 2000, the global population increased less than fourfold (3.7 times to be exact) while farmland grew by about 40 percent, but my calculations show that anthropogenic energy subsidies in agriculture increased 90-fold, led by energy embedded in agrochemicals and in fuels directly consumed by machinery.[46]

我还计算了这种依赖的相对全球负担。现代田间农业（包括所有运输）、渔业和水产养殖中人为能源投入加起来仅占近期全球年度能源消耗的约4%。这或许是一个出乎意料的低比例，但必须记住，太阳始终承担着粮食生长的大部分工作，而外部能源补贴的目标是那些通过减少或消除自然限制（例如施肥、灌溉、提供防虫、防真菌和防竞争植物的保护，或及时收割成熟作物）能够获得最大回报的粮食系统组成部分。这一低比例也可以被视为又一个令人信服的例子，说明少量投入会产生不成比例的巨大影响，这在复杂系统的运行中并非罕见现象：想想维生素和矿物质，我们每天只需要几毫克（例如维生素B6或铜）。或者微克（维生素 D、维生素 B12）来保持体重数十公斤的人的身体健康。

I have also calculated the relative global burden of this dependence. Anthropogenic energy inputs into modern field farming (including all transportation), fisheries, and aquaculture add up to only about 4 percent of recent annual global energy use. This may be a surprisingly small share, but it must be remembered that the Sun will always do most of the work of growing food, and that external energy subsidies target those components of the food system where the greatest returns can be expected by reducing or removing natural constraints—be it by fertilizing, irrigating, providing protection against insects, fungi and competing plants, or by promptly harvesting mature crops. The low share may also be seen as yet another convincing example of small inputs having disproportionately large consequences, not an uncommon finding in the behavior of complex systems: think of vitamins and minerals, needed daily in just milligrams (vitamin B6 or copper) or micrograms (vitamin D, vitamin B12) to keep bodies weighing tens of kilograms in good shape.

但食品生产（包括田间耕作、畜牧业和海产品生产）所需的能源只是食品相关燃料和电力总需求的一部分，如果估算整个食品系统的能源消耗，则占总供应量的比例要高得多。我们目前掌握的最佳数据来自美国。由于现代技术的普及和规模经济的广泛应用，美国食品生产的直接能源消耗目前约占全国总供应量的1%。[47]但加上食品加工和营销、包装、运输、批发和零售服务、家庭食品储存和准备以及外出就餐和营销服务的能源需求后，2007年美国食品生产能源消耗总量接近全国能源供应量的16%，而现在已接近20%。[48]推动能源需求增长的因素包括：生产进一步集中化（从而导致运输需求增加）、食品进口依赖性增强、外出就餐增多以及在家食用更多预制（方便）食品。[49]

But the energy required for food production—field farming, animal husbandry, and seafood—is only a part of the total food-related fuel and electricity needs, and estimating the use in the entire food system results in much higher shares of the total supply. Our best data are available for the US, where, thanks to the prevalence of modern techniques and widespread economies of scale, the direct energy use in food production is now on the order of 1 percent of the total national supply.[47] But after adding the energy requirements of food processing and marketing, packaging, transportation, wholesale and retail services, household food storage and preparation, and away-from-home food and marketing services, the grand total in the US reached nearly 16 percent of the nation’s energy supply in 2007 and now it is approaching 20 percent.[48] The factors driving these rising energy needs range from further consolidation of production—and hence growing transportation needs—and growing food import dependency, to more meals eaten away from home and more prepared (convenience) foods consumed at home.[49]

我们有很多理由不应该继续沿用当今许多食品生产方式。农业对温室气体排放的主要贡献如今已成为人们呼吁改变发展路径的最常用理由。但现代作物种植、畜牧业和水产养殖还会带来许多其他不良环境影响，例如生物多样性丧失和沿海水域死区的形成（详见第六章）——我们没有任何理由继续维持过度的食品生产及其带来的食物浪费。因此，许多变革显然是可取的，但这些变革究竟能以多快的速度发生？我们又能在现实中对现有方式进行多彻底的改革？

There are many reasons why we should not continue many of today’s food-producing practices. Agriculture’s major contribution to the generation of greenhouse gases is now the most-often cited justification for following a different path. But modern crop cultivation, animal husbandry, and aquaculture have many other undesirable environmental impacts, ranging from the loss of biodiversity to the creation of dead zones in coastal waters (for more on this see chapter 6)—and there are no good reasons for maintaining our excessive food production with its attendant food waste. So, many changes are clearly desirable, but how fast can they actually happen, and how radically can we reform our current ways in reality?

我们能回去吗？

Can we go back?

我们能否扭转至少部分趋势？即将拥有80亿人口的世界能否在保持作物多样性的同时，实现粮食自给自足？以及动物产品和现有饮食的质量——不使用合成肥料和其他农用化学品？我们能否回归纯粹的有机耕作方式，依靠回收的有机废弃物和天然的病虫害防治方法，并且通过重新引入役畜来摆脱机械灌溉和农田机械？我们当然可以，但纯粹的有机耕作方式将要求我们大多数人放弃城市生活，迁回村庄，拆除集中式动物饲养场，并将所有动物带回农场，用作劳动力和肥料来源。

Can we reverse at least some of these trends? Can the world of soon-to-be 8 billion people feed itself—while maintaining a variety of crop and animal products and the quality of prevailing diets—without synthetic fertilizers and without other agrochemicals? Could we return to purely organic cropping, relying on recycled organic wastes and natural pest controls, and could we do without engine-powered irrigation and without field machinery by bringing back draft animals? We could, but purely organic farming would require most of us to abandon cities, resettle villages, dismantle central animal feeding operations, and bring all animals back to farms to use them for labor and as sources of manure.

我们每天都要喂养牲畜，定期清理粪便，发酵后撒到田里，还要照料牧场上的牛羊。随着季节性劳动力需求的增减，男人们会驾驭马拉犁耕地；妇女和儿童会播种除草；到了收割和宰杀季节，每个人都会帮忙，捆扎麦捆，挖土豆，把刚宰杀的猪鹅变成食物。我不认为那些鼓吹有机绿色理念的网络评论员会很快接受这些做法。即使他们愿意离开城市，拥抱有机的田园生活，他们生产的粮食也只够养活当今全球不到一半的人口。

Every day we would have to feed and water our animals, regularly remove their manure, ferment it and then spread it on fields, and tend the herds and flocks on pasture. As seasonal labor demands rose and ebbed, men would guide the plows harnessed to teams of horses; women and children would plant and weed vegetable plots; and everybody would be pitching in during harvest and slaughter time, stooking sheaves of wheat, digging up potatoes, helping to turn freshly slaughtered pigs and geese into food. I do not foresee the organic green online commentariat embracing these options anytime soon. And even if they were willing to empty the cities and embrace organic earthiness, they could still produce only enough food to sustain less than half of today’s global population.

上述所有论点都易于收集数据佐证。本章前文概述的美国小麦生产所需人力的减少，恰好可以作为机械化和农用化学品对美国农业劳动力规模总体影响的一个极佳指标。1800年至2020年间，我们生产一公斤粮食所需的劳动力减少了98%以上，从事农业的人口比例也大幅下降。[50]这为我们理解农业机械化倒退和合成农用化学品使用量减少将带来的深刻经济变革提供了有益的参考。

The numbers to confirm all of the above are not difficult to marshal. The decline of human labor required to produce American wheat outlined earlier in this chapter is an excellent proxy for the overall impact that mechanization and agrochemicals have had on the size of the country’s agricultural labor force. Between 1800 and 2020, we reduced the labor needed to produce a kilogram of grain by more than 98 percent—and we reduced the share of the country’s population engaged in agriculture by the same large margin.[50] This provides a useful guide to the profound economic transformations that would have to take place with any retreat of agricultural mechanization and reduction in the use of synthetic agrochemicals.

化石燃料相关服务的减少越多，劳动力就越需要离开城市，以传统方式生产粮食。在1920年以前美国马匹和骡子数量的鼎盛时期，全国四分之一的农田都用于种植牲畜。当时，美国农场需要养活超过2500万匹役用马和骡子——而那时美国人口仅约1.05亿。显然，仅靠2500万匹马来养活如今超过3.3亿的人口是不可能的。而且，如果没有合成肥料，依赖有机物循环利用的粮食和饲料作物的产量将远不及今天的收成。玉米是美国种植面积最大的作物，1920年每公顷产量不足2吨，而到了2020年，每公顷产量也只有11吨。[51]要耕种几乎所有可用的农田，就需要数百万头额外的役畜，而且根本无法找到足够的可循环利用的有机物（以及像克劳德那样热衷于翻动粪便的人！），也无法种植足够大的绿肥（将谷物与苜蓿或三叶草轮作），以达到如今合成肥料施用所提供的养分水平。

The greater the reduction of these fossil fuel–based services, the greater the need for the labor force to leave the cities to produce food in the old ways. During the pre-1920 peak of US horse and mule numbers, one-quarter of the country’s farmland was dedicated to growing feed for the more than 25 million American working horses and mules—and at that time US farms had to feed only about 105 million people. Obviously, feeding today’s more than 330 million people by deploying “just” 25 million horses would be impossible. And without synthetic fertilizers, yields of food and feed crops dependent on the recycling of organic matter would be a fraction of today’s harvest. Corn, America’s largest crop, yielded less than 2 tons per hectare in 1920, and 11 tons per hectare in 2020.[51] Millions of additional draft animals would be needed to cultivate virtually all of the country’s available farmland, and it would be impossible to find enough recyclable organic matter (and eager Claude-like manure-liking tossers!) or cultivate sufficiently large areas of green manures (rotating grain with alfalfa or clover) to match the nutrients supplied by today’s applications of synthetic fertilizers.

这种不可能性可以通过几组简单的对比来更好地说明。有机物的循环利用始终是十分可取的，因为它能改善土壤结构，增加土壤有机质含量，并为无数土壤微生物和无脊椎动物提供能量。但是，有机物中氮含量极低，这意味着农民必须施用大量的秸秆或粪肥才能提供足够的这种必需植物营养素，从而获得高产。谷物秸秆（最常见的作物残茬）的氮含量总是很低，通常只有0.3%至0.6%；粪肥与动物垫料（通常是秸秆）混合后，氮含量仅为0.4%至0.6%；发酵的人类粪便（中国所谓的“夜粪”）的氮含量只有1%至3%；而施用于田间的粪肥，氮含量很少超过4%。

This impossibility is best illustrated by a few sets of simple comparisons. Recycling of organic matter is always highly desirable, as it improves the structure of soil, increases its organic content, and provides energy for myriad soil microbes and invertebrates. But the very low nitrogen content of organic matter means that farmers have to apply very large quantities of straw or manure in order to supply enough of this essential plant nutrient to produce high crop yields. The nitrogen content of cereal straws (the most abundant crop residue) is always low, usually 0.3–0.6 percent; manure mixed with animal bedding (usually straw) contains only 0.4–0.6 percent; fermented human waste (China’s so-called night soil) has just 1–3 percent; and manures applied to fields rarely contain more than 4 percent.

相比之下，尿素（目前全球最主要的固体氮肥）含氮量为46%，硝酸铵含氮量为33%，常用的液体肥料含氮量为28%至32%，其氮含量至少比可回收废弃物高一个数量级。[52]这意味着，为了向作物提供相同量的养分，农民需要施用10到40倍的粪便（按质量计）——而实际上，由于大量氮化合物会因挥发或溶解于水而被带走，因此实际需要的用量可能更多。在根部以下，有机物中氮的总体损失几乎总是高于合成液体或固体中的氮损失。

In contrast, urea, now the world’s dominant solid nitrogenous fertilizer, contains 46 percent nitrogen, ammonium nitrate has 33 percent, and commonly used liquid solutions contain 28–32 percent, at least an order of magnitude more nitrogen-dense than recyclable wastes.[52] This means that to supply the same amount of the nutrient to growing crops, a farmer would have to apply anywhere between 10 and 40 times as much manure by mass—and in reality even more of it would be needed, as significant shares of nitrogenous compounds are lost due to volatilization, or dissolved in water and carried below the root level, with the aggregate losses of nitrogen from organic matter being almost always higher than those from a synthetic liquid or solid.

此外，粪肥的处理、运输和撒播远比使用易于机械撒播的小颗粒肥料（例如亚洲小型稻田施用尿素时那样，只需手工播撒）困难得多，因此对劳动力的需求也更大。而且，无论人们在有机物回收利用方面投入多少精力，可回收材料的总量仍然太少，无法满足当今作物所需的氮肥量。

Moreover, there would be a more than commensurate claim on labor, as the handling, transporting, and spreading of manure is far more difficult than dealing with small, free-flowing granules that can be easily applied by mechanical spreaders or (as is done with urea in small Asian rice fields) simply by sowing it by hand. And regardless of the effort that might be put into organic recycling, the total mass of recyclable materials is simply too small to provide the nitrogen required by today’s harvests.

全球活性氮清单显示，有六大途径将这种元素带到世界各地的农田：大气沉降、灌溉水、耕作作物残茬、施用动物粪便、豆科作物留在土壤中的氮以及施用合成肥料。[53]

Global inventory of reactive nitrogen shows that six major flows bring the element to the world’s croplands: atmospheric deposition, irrigation water, plowing-under of crop residues, spreading of animal manures, nitrogen left in soil by leguminous crops, and application of synthetic fertilizers.[53]

大气沉降（主要以含溶解硝酸盐的雨雪形式）和作物残茬回收利用（未从田间移除用作动物饲料或就地焚烧的秸秆和植物茎秆）每年各自贡献约2000万吨氮。施用于田间的动物粪便（主要来自牛、猪和鸡）含有近3000万吨氮；豆科作物（绿肥覆盖作物以及大豆、菜豆、豌豆和鹰嘴豆）也贡献了类似的总量；灌溉水带来约500万吨氮——总计每年约1.05亿吨氮。合成肥料每年提供1.1亿吨氮，略高于总用量2.1亿至2.2亿吨的一半。这意味着，近期全球至少一半的农作物收成得益于合成氮肥的使用，如果没有这些合成氮肥，即使是当今近80亿人口中的一半，也无法维持现有的饮食结构。虽然我们可以通过减少肉类消费和减少食物浪费来降低对合成氨的依赖，但用有机氮源替代全球每年约1.1亿吨合成氮肥的投入，目前还只能停留在理论层面。

Atmospheric deposition—mainly as rain and snow containing dissolved nitrates—and recycled crop residues (straws and plant stalks that are not removed from fields to feed animals or burned onsite) each contribute about 20 megatons of nitrogen per year. Animal manures applied to fields, mainly from cattle, pigs, and chickens, contain almost 30 megatons; a similar total is introduced by leguminous crops (green manure cover crops, as well as soybeans, beans, peas, and chickpeas); and irrigation water brings about 5 megatons—for a total of about 105 megatons of nitrogen per year. Synthetic fertilizers supply 110 megatons of nitrogen per year, or slightly more than half of the 210–220 megatons used in total. This means that at least half of recent global crop harvests have been produced thanks to the application of synthetic nitrogenous compounds, and without them it would be impossible to produce the prevailing diets for even half of today’s nearly 8 billion people. While we could reduce our dependence on synthetic ammonia by eating less meat and wasting less food, replacing the global input of about 110 megatons of nitrogen in synthetic compounds by organic sources could be done only in theory.

多种限制因素制约了粪便的回收利用圈养动物。[54]在传统的混合农业中，数量相对较少的牛、猪和家禽的粪便可以直接循环利用到邻近的田地里。集中式动物饲养场生产肉类和蛋类减少了这种选择：这些企业产生的废弃物数量巨大，如果将其施用于田地，会在有利可图的范围内造成土壤养分过剩；重金属和药物残留（来自饲料添加剂）的存在是另一个问题。[55]现代人类污水处理厂产生的污水污泥（生物固体）的扩大利用也面临类似的限制。废弃物中的病原体必须通过发酵和高温灭菌来杀灭，但这些处理方法并不能杀死所有耐药菌，也不能去除所有重金属。

Multiple constraints limit the recycling of manure produced by animals in confinement.[54] In traditional mixed farming, cattle, pig, and poultry manure from relatively small numbers of animals was directly recycled on adjacent fields. Producing meat and eggs in central animal feeding operations reduced this option: these enterprises generate such large quantities of waste that its application to fields would overload soils with nutrients within the radius where it would be profitable to spread it; presence of heavy metals and drug residues (from feed additives) is another problem.[55] Similar constraints apply to the expanded use of sewage sludge (biosolids) from modern human waste treatment plants. Waste’s pathogens must be destroyed by fermentation and by high-heat sterilization, but such treatments do not kill all antibiotic-resistant bacteria and do not remove all heavy metals.

放牧动物产生的粪便量是圈养哺乳动物和鸟类的三倍：粮农组织估计，它们每年在粪便中留下约9000万吨氮——但利用这一巨大的氮源并不现实。[56]由于交通不便，收集动物尿液和粪便的范围仅限于数亿公顷牧场的一小部分，而这些牧场正是牛、羊和山羊排泄这些废物的地方。收集这些废物的成本与将其运送到处理点再到农田的成本一样高昂。此外，在氮素到达农田之前，氮素的流失会进一步降低这些废物中本已极低的氮含量。[57]

Grazing animals produce three times as much manure as do mammals and birds kept in confinement: the FAO estimates that they leave annually about 90 megatons of nitrogen in waste—but exploiting this large source is impractical.[56] Accessibility would limit any gathering of animal urine and excrement to a fraction of the hundreds of millions of hectares of pastures where these wastes are expelled by grazing cattle, sheep, and goats. Gathering it would be as prohibitively costly as its transportation to treatment points and then to crop fields. Moreover, intervening nitrogen losses would further reduce the already very low nitrogen content of such wastes before the nutrient could reach the fields.[57]

另一种选择是扩大豆类作物的种植面积，使其每年氮产量达到5000万至6000万吨，而不是目前的约3000万吨——但这需要付出相当大的机会成本。种植更多苜蓿和三叶草等豆类覆盖作物可以增加氮的供应，但也会降低一年两季耕种的能力，而这对于人口仍在增长的低收入国家来说至关重要。[58]种植更多豆类谷物（豆、扁豆、豌豆）会降低整体粮食能量产量，因为它们的产量远低于谷类作物，显然，这将减少单位耕地所能养活的人口数量。[59]此外，大豆作物留下的氮——通常为每公顷40至50公斤——将低于美国典型的施氮量。目前小麦氮肥用量约为每公顷 75 公斤氮，玉米氮肥用量约为每公顷 150 公斤氮。

Another choice is to expand the cultivation of leguminous crops to produce 50–60 megatons of nitrogen per year, rather than about 30 megatons as they currently do—but only at a considerable opportunity cost. Planting more leguminous cover crops such as alfalfa and clover would boost nitrogen supply but would also reduce the ability to use one field to produce two crops in a year, a vital option for the still-expanding populations of low-income countries.[58] Growing more leguminous grains (beans, lentils, peas) would lower the overall food energy yields, because they yield far less than cereal crops and, obviously, this would reduce the number of people that could be supported by a unit of cultivated land.[59] Moreover, the nitrogen left behind by a soybean crop—commonly 40–50 kilograms of nitrogen per hectare—would be less than the typical American applications of nitrogenous fertilizers, which are now about 75 kg N/ha for wheat and 150 kg N/ha for grain corn.

扩大豆科作物轮作的另一个明显缺点是，在气候寒冷、一年只能种植一季作物的地区，种植苜蓿或三叶草会妨碍每年种植粮食作物；而在气候温暖、实行一年两季种植的地区，则会降低粮食作物的收获频率。[60]虽然在人口少、耕地多的国家或许可行，但在所有实行一年两季种植的地区，包括欧洲大部分地区和华北平原（中国约一半的粮食产自该地区），扩大豆科作物轮作必然会降低粮食生产能力。

Another obvious drawback of expanded rotations with leguminous crops is that in colder climates, where only a single crop can be grown in a year, cultivation of alfalfa or clover would preclude the annual planting of a food crop, while in warmer regions with double-cropping it would reduce the frequency of harvesting food crops.[60] While it might be possible in countries with small populations and plentiful farmland, it would, inevitably, reduce food-producing capacity in all places where double-cropping is common, including large parts of Europe and the North China Plain, the region that produces about half of China’s grain.

目前，中国超过三分之一的耕地实行双季种植，而中国南方地区超过三分之一的水稻产自双季种植区。[61]因此，如果没有这种集约化耕作方式（这种方式也需要创纪录的氮肥施用量），中国将无法养活其超过14亿的人口。即使在以高有机物循环利用率和复杂的作物轮作而闻名的传统中国农业中，集约化程度最高的地区的农民每公顷的氮肥施用量也只能达到120-150公斤——而且这样做需要投入大量的劳动力，其中（如前所述）粪肥的收集和施用是最耗时的环节。

Double-cropping is now practiced on more than a third of China’s cultivated land, and more than a third of all rice comes from double-cropping in South China.[61] Consequently, the country would find it impossible to feed its now more than 1.4 billion people without this intensive cultivation that also requires record-level nitrogen applications. Even in traditional Chinese farming, famous for its high rate of organic recycling and for complex crop rotations, farmers in the most intensively cultivated regions could not supply more than 120–150 kg N/ha—and doing so required extraordinarily high labor inputs, with (as already stressed) manure collection and application being the most time-consuming.

即便如此，这样的农场每公顷也只能生产出足够10-11人食用的以素食为主的膳食。相比之下，中国产量最高的双季种植依赖于平均每公顷施用超过400公斤氮的合成氮肥，其产量足以养活20-22人，这些人的膳食中约40%为动物蛋白，60%为植物蛋白。[62]对于全球30亿以植物性食物为主的人口来说，仅依靠费力地回收有机废弃物和更常见的轮作方式来维持全球作物种植是可行的，但对于近80亿饮食混合的人口来说则不然：要知道，合成肥料提供的氮量是所有回收作物残茬和粪便的两倍多（考虑到有机肥料的损失更大，实际倍数接近三倍！）。

Even so, such farms could produce only overwhelmingly vegetarian diets for 10–11 people per hectare. In contrast, China’s most productive double-cropping depends on applications of synthetic nitrogenous fertilizers averaging more than 400 kg N/ha, and it can produce enough to feed 20–22 people whose diets contain about 40 percent animal and 60 percent plant protein.[62] Global crop cultivation supported solely by the laborious recycling of organic wastes and by more common rotations is conceivable for a global population of 3 billion people consuming largely plant-based diets, but not for nearly 8 billion people on mixed diets: recall that synthetic fertilizers now supply more than twice as much nitrogen as all recycled crop residues and manures (and given the higher losses from organic applications, the effective multiple is actually closer to three!).

减少资源消耗——以及放弃

Doing with less—and doing without

但这并不意味着我们无法大幅减少对化石燃料补贴在粮食生产方面的依赖。最显而易见的是，如果我们减少粮食浪费，就能降低农作物和畜牧业的生产规模，从而减少相关的能源补贴。在许多低收入国家，由于粮食储存条件差（谷物和块茎容易受到啮齿动物、昆虫和真菌的侵害）以及缺乏冷藏设备（加速乳制品、鱼类和肉类的腐败），大量粮食在到达市场之前就已经被浪费掉。而在富裕国家，食物链更长，每个环节都存在无意中造成粮食损失的可能性。

But none of this means that major shifts in our dependence on fossil fuel subsidies in food production are impossible. Most obviously, we could reduce our crop and animal production—and the attendant energy subsidies—if we wasted less food. In many low-income countries, poor crop storage (making grains and tubers vulnerable to rodents, insects, and fungi) and the absence of refrigeration (accelerating the spoilage of dairy products, fish, and meat) wastes too much food even before it reaches its markets. And in affluent countries, food chains are longer and opportunities for inadvertent food losses arise at every step.

即便如此，全球粮食损失量之高已是众所周知，主要原因是产量与实际需求之间存在着无法弥补的巨大差距：在以久坐为主的富裕人群中，成年人每日人均需求量不超过2000-2100千卡，远低于3200-4000千卡的实际供应量。[63]据联合国粮农组织（FAO）统计，全球损失了近一半的根茎类作物、水果和蔬菜，约三分之一的鱼类，30%的谷物，以及五分之一的油籽、肉类和乳制品——至少占总粮食供应量的三分之一。[64]英国的“废物与资源行动计划”（WRA）证实，不可食用的家庭食物垃圾（包括果蔬皮和骨头）仅占总量的30%，这意味着70%的浪费食物完全可以食用，只是因为变质或食用过量而被浪费掉。[65]减少食物浪费似乎比改革复杂的生产过程容易得多，然而，这颗唾手可得的果实却很难摘取。

Even so, the well-documented global food losses have been excessively high, mostly because of an indefensible difference between output and actual needs: daily average per capita requirements of adults in largely sedentary affluent populations are no more than 2,000–2,100 kilocalories, far below the actual supplies of 3,200–4,000 kilocalories.[63] According to the FAO, the world loses almost half of all root crops, fruits, and vegetables, about a third of all fish, 30 percent of cereals, and a fifth of all oilseeds, meat, and dairy products—or at least one-third of the overall food supply.[64] And the UK’s Waste and Resources Action Programme ascertained that inedible household food waste (including fruit and vegetable peelings, and bones) is only 30 percent of the total, meaning that 70 percent of wasted food was perfectly edible and was not consumed either because it spoiled or because too much of it was served.[65] Reducing food waste might seem to be much easier than reforming complex production processes, and yet this proverbial low-hanging fruit has been difficult to harvest.

消除从田间地头到餐桌，贯穿漫长而复杂的生产-加工-分销-批发-零售-消费链各个环节的浪费极具挑战性。美国的食物平衡数据显示，尽管人们不断呼吁改进，但过去40年来，全国食物浪费的比例一直保持稳定。[66]随着中国从营养不良的困境走向富裕，食物浪费也随之增加。20 世纪 80 年代初之前的粮食供应水平，如今的人均粮食供应水平已经高于日本。[67]

Eliminating waste that takes place all along the long and complex production-processing-distribution-wholesaling-retailing-consumption chain (from fields and barns to plates) is extremely challenging. American food balances show that the nationwide share of wasted food has remained stable during the past 40 years, despite perennial calls for improvements.[66] And higher food waste accompanied China’s improving nutrition as the country moved from the precarious food supply that prevailed until the early 1980s to averaging per capita rates that are now higher than in Japan.[67]

食品价格上涨应该会导致浪费减少，但这对于低收入国家来说并不是一个理想的解决方案——在这些国家，许多弱势家庭的食品获取仍然不稳定，食品仍然占据家庭总支出的很大一部分——而在食品相对便宜的富裕国家，这将需要大幅提高价格，而这项政策并没有积极的支持者。[68]

Higher food prices should lead to lower waste, but this is not a desirable way to fix the problem in low-income countries—where food access for many disadvantaged families remains precarious and where food still claims a large share of overall family spending—while in affluent nations, where food is relatively inexpensive, this would require substantial price hikes, a policy that has no eager promoters.[68]

在富裕社会中，减少农业对化石燃料补贴依赖的更好方法是呼吁人们采用健康且令人满意的替代饮食方式，以取代目前过度油腻和肉类过多的饮食——最简单的选择是适度食用肉类，并优先选择对环境影响较小的肉类生产方式。大规模推广素食主义注定会失败。食用肉类与我们发达的大脑（部分进化源于肉食）、双足行走和符号语言一样，都是我们进化遗产的重要组成部分。[69]我们所有的原始人类祖先都是杂食动物，两种黑猩猩（Pan troglodytes和Pan paniscus）也是如此，它们是基因构成上与我们最接近的原始人类；它们通过猎捕（并分享）小型猴子、野猪和乌龟来补充植物性饮食。[70]

In well-off societies, a better way to reduce agriculture’s dependence on fossil fuel subsidies is to make appeals for adopting healthy and satisfactory alternatives to today’s excessively rich and meaty diets—the easiest choices being moderate meat consumption, and favoring meat that can be grown with lower environmental impact. The quest for mass-scale veganism is doomed to fail. Eating meat has been as significant a component of our evolutionary heritage as our large brains (which evolved partly because of meat eating), bipedalism, and symbolic language.[69] All our hominin ancestors were omnivorous, as are both species of chimpanzees (Pan troglodytes and Pan paniscus), the hominins closest to us in their genetic makeup; they supplement their plant diet by hunting (and sharing) small monkeys, wild pigs, and tortoises.[70]

只有当儿童和青少年时期的饮食中含有足够量的动物蛋白时，才能充分发挥人类的生长潜力。这些动物蛋白最初来源于牛奶，之后来源于其他乳制品、鸡蛋和肉类。日本、韩国和中国在1950年后的身高增长，正是由于动物产品摄入量的增加，这无疑证明了这一点。[71]相反，大多数素食者或纯素食者并不会终生坚持这种饮食习惯。认为全世界数十亿人——不仅仅是富裕的西方城市居民——会自愿不食用任何动物产品，或者认为政府会在短期内获得足够的支持来强制执行这种做法，都是荒谬的。

Full expression of human growth potential on a population basis can take place only when diets in childhood and adolescence contain sufficient quantities of animal protein, first in milk and later in other dairy products, eggs, and meat: rising post-1950 body heights in Japan, South Korea, and China, as a result of increased intake of animal products, are unmistakable testimonies to this reality.[71] Conversely, most people who become vegetarians or vegans do not remain so for the remainder of their lives. The idea that billions of humans—across the world, not only in affluent Western cities—would willfully not eat any animal products, or that there’d be enough support for governments to enforce that anytime soon, is ridiculous.

但这并不意味着我们不能比过去两代人以来富裕国家的平均肉类消费量少得多。 [72]以胴体重量计算，许多高收入国家的年肉类供应量平均接近甚至超过平均水平。人均100公斤——但最好的营养建议是，我们每年不必吃超过成年人体重的肉类就能获得足够的高质量蛋白质。[73]

But none of this means that we could not eat much less meat than affluent countries have averaged during the past two generations.[72] When expressed in terms of carcass weight, annual meat supply in many high-income countries has averaged close to, or even in excess of, 100 kilograms per capita—but the best nutritional advice is that we do not have to eat more than an adult’s body mass equivalent in meat per year to obtain an adequate amount of high-quality protein.[73]

素食主义虽然浪费了宝贵的生物质（只有反刍动物——即牛、羊和山羊——才能消化秸秆和茎秆等纤维素植物组织），但高水平的肉食性并没有被证实具有任何营养益处：它当然不会延长寿命，反而会造成额外的环境压力。在日本这个世界上寿命最长的国家，近年来肉类消费量已低于每年30公斤；而一个鲜为人知的事实是，在传统上肉类消费量很高的法国，类似的低消费率也变得相当普遍。到2013年，近40%的法国成年人是“小肉食者”（petits consommateurs），他们只吃少量肉类，每年摄入量不足39公斤，而平均每年摄入约80公斤肉类的大肉食者仅占法国成年人口的不到30%。[74]

While veganism is a waste of valuable biomass (only ruminants—that is cattle, sheep, and goats—can digest such cellulosic plant tissues as straw and stalks), high-level carnivory has no proven nutritional benefits: it certainly does not add any years to life expectancy, and it is a source of additional environmental stress. Meat consumption in Japan, the country with the world’s highest longevity, has recently been below 30 kilograms per year; and a much less appreciated fact is that similarly low consumption rates have become fairly common in France, traditionally a nation of high meat intake. By 2013, nearly 40 percent of adult French were petits consommateurs, eating meat only in small amounts adding up to less than 39 kg/year, while the heavy meat consumers, averaging about 80 kg/year, made up less than 30 percent of French adults.[74]

显然，如果所有高收入国家都效仿这些做法，它们就可以减少粮食产量——因为它们的大部分粮食并非直接用于食用，而是用作动物饲料。[75]但这并非普遍适用。虽然许多富裕国家的肉类摄入量一直在下降，而且还可以进一步减少，但在巴西和印度尼西亚（自1980年以来增长了一倍多）以及中国（自1980年以来增长了四倍）等现代化国家，肉类摄入量却在迅速增长。[76]此外，亚洲和非洲还有数十亿人肉类消费量仍然很低，而增加肉类摄入量将有益于他们的健康。

Obviously, if all high-income countries were to follow these examples, they could reduce their crop harvests—because most of their grain harvests are not destined directly for food but for animal feed.[75] But this is not a universal option. While meat intakes in many affluent countries have been declining and could be cut even further, they have been rising rapidly in such modernizing nations as Brazil and Indonesia (where they have more than doubled since 1980) and China (where they have quadrupled since 1980).[76] Moreover, there are billions of people in Asia and Africa whose meat consumption remains minimal and whose health would benefit from more meaty diets.

减少对合成氮肥依赖的更多机会来自生产环节——例如，提高植物对氮的吸收效率。但这些机会同样有限。1961年至1980年间，作物实际吸收的氮肥比例大幅下降（从68%降至45%），之后稳定在47%左右。[77]而在中国，作为世界上最大的氮肥消费国，只有三分之一的氮肥被水稻实际吸收；其余的则流失到大气、地下水和河流中。[78]鉴于我们预计……到 2050 年，全球人口至少将增加 20 亿，而亚洲和非洲低收入国家的人口数量将增加两倍以上，这些国家的粮食供应在数量和质量上都应该得到进一步提高。因此，近期内大幅减少全球对合成氮肥的依赖没有希望。

Additional opportunities to reduce the dependence on synthetic nitrogenous fertilizers come on the production side—for example, improving the efficiency of nitrogen uptake by plants. But again, these opportunities are circumscribed. Between 1961 and 1980 there was a substantial decline in the share of applied nitrogen actually incorporated by crops (from 68 percent to 45 percent), then came a levelling off at around 47 percent.[77] And in China, the world’s largest consumer of nitrogen fertilizer, only a third of the applied nitrogen is actually used by rice; the rest is lost to the atmosphere and to ground and stream waters.[78] Given that we are expecting at least 2 billion more people by 2050, and that more than twice as many people in the low-income countries of Asia and Africa should see further gains—both in quantity and quality—in their food supply, there is no near-term prospect for substantially reducing the global dependence on synthetic nitrogenous fertilizers.

显然，无需化石燃料即可运行田间机械存在着巨大的机遇。利用太阳能或风能发电而非内燃机驱动的水泵，可以普及脱碳灌溉。能量密度不断提高、成本不断降低的电池将使更多拖拉机和卡车实现电动化。[79]下一章我将阐述目前以天然气为基础的氨合成方法的替代方案。但所有这些方案都无法快速实施，也需要额外的（通常是巨额的）投资。

There are obvious opportunities for running field machinery without fossil fuels. Decarbonized irrigation could become common with pumps powered by solar- or wind-generated electricity rather than by combustion engines. Batteries with improving energy density and lower cost would make it possible to convert more tractors and trucks to electric drive.[79] And in the next chapter I will explain the alternatives to the dominant, natural gas–based synthesis of ammonia. But none of these options can be adopted either rapidly or without additional (and often substantial) investments.

目前，这些进展还遥遥无期。它们将依赖于廉价的可再生电力生产，并辅以充足的大规模储能，而这种组合尚未实现商业化（大型抽水蓄能的替代方案也尚未发明；详见第三章）。一个近乎完美的解决方案是培育具有豆科植物共同特性的谷物或油料作物——也就是说，它们的根部能够寄生细菌，将大气中的惰性氮转化为硝酸盐。植物科学家们几十年来一直梦想着这一点，但商业化的固氮小麦或水稻品种短期内不会上市。[80]此外，所有富裕国家和经济较为发达的现代化经济体不太可能自愿大规模减少其典型饮食的数量和种类，也不太可能将通过这种缩减节省下来的资源（燃料、化肥和机械）转移到非洲，以改善非洲大陆仍然糟糕的营养状况。

These advances are, at present, a very long way off. They will depend on inexpensive renewable electricity generation backed up by adequate large-scale storage, a combination that is yet to be commercialized (and an alternative to large pumped hydro storage is yet to be invented; for more see chapter 3). A nearly perfect solution would be to develop grain or oil crops with the capabilities common to leguminous plants—that is, with their roots hosting bacteria able to convert inert atmospheric nitrogen to nitrates. Plant scientists have been dreaming about this for decades, but no releases of commercial nitrogen-fixing varieties of wheat or rice are coming anytime soon.[80] Nor is it very likely that all affluent countries and better-off modernizing economies will adopt large-scale voluntary reductions in the quantity and variety of their typical diets, or that the resources (fuel, fertilizers, and machinery) saved by such pullbacks would be transferred to Africa to improve the continent’s still-dismal nutrition.

半个世纪前，霍华德·奥杜姆（Howard Odum）在对能源和环境进行系统研究时指出，现代社会“不了解其中涉及的能量学，也不了解进入复杂系统的能量如何以各种方式间接地作为补贴反馈到网络的各个部分……工业人不再吃用太阳能制成的土豆；现在他吃的土豆部分是用油制成的。” [81]

Half a century ago, Howard Odum—in his systematic examination of energy and the environment—noted that modern societies “did not understand the energetics involved and the various means by which the energies entering a complex system are fed back as subsidies indirectly into all parts of the network . . . industrial man no longer eats potatoes made from solar energy; now he eats potatoes partly made of oil.”[81]

五十年后，这种生存依赖性仍然没有得到足够的重视——但本书的读者现在明白，我们的食物一部分不仅由石油制成，还由煤炭制成，而煤炭曾用于生产焦炭，焦炭是冶炼铁矿所需的原料，铁矿是田间、运输和食品加工机械的原料；天然气既是合成氮肥的原料，也是燃料；以及化石燃料燃烧产生的电力，而电力对于农作物加工、动物饲养以及食品和饲料的储存和制备是必不可少的。

Fifty years later, this existential dependence is still insufficiently appreciated—but the readers of this book now understand that our food is partly made not just of oil, but also of coal that was used to produce the coke required for smelting the iron needed for field, transportation, and food processing machinery; of natural gas that serves as both feedstock and fuel for the synthesis of nitrogenous fertilizers; and of the electricity generated by the combustion of fossil fuels that is indispensable for crop processing, taking care of animals, and food and feed storage and preparation.

现代农业产量的大幅提高并非源于光合作用的效率提升，而是因为我们提供了更优良的作物品种，并改善了它们的生长条件，包括充足的养分和水分、减少争夺养分的杂草以及防治病虫害。与此同时，野生水生生物捕捞量的显著增加依赖于捕捞范围和强度的扩大，而水产养殖业的兴起也离不开必要的养殖设施和优质饲料。

Modern agriculture’s higher yields are not produced with a fraction of the labor that was required just a lifetime ago because we have improved the efficiency of photosynthesis, but because we have provided better varieties of crops with better conditions for their growth by supplying them with adequate nutrients and water, by reducing weeds that compete for the same inputs, and by protecting them against pests. Concurrently, our much-increased capture of wild aquatic species has depended on expanding the extent and the intensity of fishing, and the rise of aquaculture could not happen without providing requisite enclosures and high-quality feed.

所有这些关键干预措施都需要大量（且不断增加）的化石燃料投入；即使我们尝试以现实可行的速度改变全球粮食系统，在未来几十年里，我们仍然会食用经过转化的化石燃料，无论是面包还是鱼。

All these critical interventions have demanded substantial—and rising—inputs of fossil fuels; and even if we try to change the global food system as fast as is realistically conceivable, we will be eating transformed fossil fuels, be it as loaves of bread or as fishes, for decades to come.

3. 了解我们的物质世界

3. Understanding Our Material World

现代文明的四大支柱

The Four Pillars of Modern Civilization

在真正重要的事情上，排名是不可能的——或者至少是不明智的。心脏并不比大脑更重要；维生素C对人体健康的重要性丝毫不亚于维生素D。食物和能源供应，这两项生存必需品在前几章中已经讨论过，如果没有大量人造材料——金属、合金、非金属和合成化合物——的投入使用，这一切都将无法实现。同样的道理也适用于我们所有的建筑和基础设施，以及所有的交通和通讯方式。当然，如果你仅仅根据这些材料所受到的关注（或者更确切地说，是缺乏关注）来判断它们的重要性，你就无法理解这一点。这种关注不仅来自大众媒体的“新闻”，也来自那些看似高深莫测的经济分析或对重大发展的预测。

Where it matters, ranking is impossible—or, at least, inadvisable. The heart is not more important than the brain; vitamin C is no less indispensable for human health than vitamin D. Food and energy supply, the two existential necessities covered in the preceding chapters, would be impossible without mass-scale mobilization of many man-made materials—metals, alloys, non-metallic and synthetic compounds—and the same is true about all our buildings and infrastructures and about all modes of transportation and communication. Of course, you would not know this if you were to judge the importance of these materials by the attention they get (or rather do not get), not only from mass media “news” but also from supposedly much more exalted economic analyses or forecasts of notable developments.

所有这些报道都主要关注一些无形、无底线的现象，例如GDP的年增长率（西方经济学家过去常常对中国两位数的增长率赞叹不已！）、不断上升的国债比率（在现代货币理论的世界里，这并不重要，因为货币供应量被认为是无限的）、创纪录的资金涌入新的首次公开募股（用于像游戏应用程序这样具有生存意义的发明）、前所未有的移动连接的好处（将5G网络视为近乎第二次降临），或者人工智能即将改变我们生活的承诺（疫情很好地证明了这些说法完全是空洞的）。

All of this coverage deals overwhelmingly with such immaterial, intangible phenomena as the annual percentage growth of GDP (how Western economists used to swoon over China’s double-digit rates!), rising national debt ratios (unimportant in the world of Modern Monetary Theory, with money supply seen as unlimited), record sums poured into new initial public offerings (for such existentially critical inventions as gaming apps), the benefits of unprecedented mobile connectivity (awaiting 5G networks as something close to the second coming), or promises of artificial intelligence imminently transforming our lives (the pandemic was an excellent demonstration of the complete emptiness of such claims).

首先，我们本可以拥有一个发达且相当富裕的文明，提供充足的食物、物质享受以及教育和医疗保健：即使没有半导体、微芯片或个人电脑，我们也曾拥有这样的文明，直到20世纪50年代中期（晶体管的首次商业应用）、70年代初期（英特尔的首款微处理器）和80年代初期（首款大规模集成电路）。（个人电脑的拥有量）。[1]直到20世纪90年代，我们成功地实现了经济一体化，调动了必要的投资，建设了必要的基础设施，并通过宽体喷气式客机连接了世界，而当时还没有智能手机、社交媒体和幼稚的应用程序。但是，如果没有充足的能源和材料供应，电子和通信领域的所有这些进步都不可能实现，而这些能源和材料正是将各种发明转化为无数耗电组件、设备、组件和系统（从微型微处理器到大型数据中心）所必需的。

First things first. We could have an accomplished and reasonably affluent civilization that provides plenty of food, material comforts, and access to education and health care, without any semiconductors, microchips, or personal computers: we had one until, respectively, the mid-1950s (first commercial applications of transistors), the early 1970s (Intel’s first microprocessors), and the early 1980s (first larger-scale ownership of PCs).[1] And we managed, until the 1990s, to integrate economies, mobilize necessary investments, build requisite infrastructures, and connect the world by wide-body jetliners without any smartphones, social media, and puerile apps. But none of these advances in electronics and telecommunications could have taken place without the assured provision of energies and materials required to embody the inventions in myriads of electricity-consuming components, devices, assemblies, and systems ranging from tiny microprocessors to massive data centers.

硅（Si）制成的薄片（微芯片的基本衬底）是电子时代的标志性材料，但即使没有它，数十亿人也能过上富裕的生活；它并非现代文明生存的必要条件。生产大尺寸、高纯度（纯度为99.999999999%）的硅晶体并将其切割成薄片是一个复杂、多步骤且高度耗能的过程：其一次能源消耗比从铝土矿中制造铝高出两个数量级，比冶炼铁和炼钢高出三个数量级。[2]但这种原材料储量极其丰富（硅是地壳中含量第二高的元素——占比接近28%，而氧的含量为49%），而且电子级硅的年产量与其他不可或缺的材料相比非常小，最近的产量约为1万吨薄片。[3]

Silicon (Si) made into thin wafers (the basic substrate of microchips) is the signature material of the electronic age, but billions of people could live prosperously without it; it is not an existential constraint on modern civilization. Producing large, high-purity (99.999999999 percent pure) silicon crystals that are cut into wafers is a complex, multi-step, and highly energy-intensive process: it costs two orders of magnitude more primary energy than making aluminum from bauxite, and three orders of magnitude more than smelting iron and making steel.[2] But the raw material is super-abundant (Si is the second-most common element in the Earth’s crust—nearly 28 percent, compared to 49 percent for oxygen) and the annual output of electronic-grade silicon is very small compared to other indispensable materials, recently on the order of 10,000 tons of wafers.[3]

当然，材料的年消耗量并非衡量其不可或缺性的最佳指标，但就此而言，结论显而易见：尽管1950年后的电子技术进步带来了诸多便利和变革，但它们并非现代文明不可或缺的物质基础。虽然我们无法仅凭其重要性来对物质需求进行绝对排序，但我可以提供一个合理的排名，该排名综合考虑了物质的不可或缺性、普遍性和需求量。四种材料在这个综合排名中位列前茅，它们构成了我所谓的现代文明的四大支柱：水泥、钢铁、塑料和氨。[4]

Of course, annual consumption of a material is not the best indicator of its indispensability, but in this case the verdict is clear: as useful and as transformative as post-1950 electronic advances have been, they do not constitute the indispensable material foundations of modern civilization. And while there can be no indisputable ordering of our material needs based on claims of their importance, I can offer a defensible ranking that considers their indispensability, ubiquity, and the demand size. Four materials rank highest on this combined scale, and they form what I have called the four pillars of modern civilization: cement, steel, plastics, and ammonia.[4]

从物理和化学角度来看，这四种材料在性质和功能上存在巨大的差异。尽管它们的属性和具体用途各不相同，但它们除了对现代社会运转不可或缺之外，还有更多共同之处。与其他必需投入品相比，这些材料的需求量更大（而且还在不断增加）。2019 年，世界消耗了约 45 亿吨水泥、18 亿吨钢铁、3.7 亿吨塑料和 1.5 亿吨氨，而且这些材料很难被其他材料替代——至少在不久的将来或在全球范围内都无法替代。[5]

Physically and chemically, these four materials are distinguished by an enormous diversity of properties and functions. But despite these differences in attributes and specific uses, they share more than their indispensability for the functioning of modern societies. They are needed in larger (and still increasing) quantities than are other essential inputs. In 2019, the world consumed about 4.5 billion tons of cement, 1.8 billion tons of steel, 370 million tons of plastics, and 150 million tons of ammonia, and they are not readily replaceable by other materials—certainly not in the near future or on a global scale.[5]

正如第二章所述，只有将放牧动物的所有排泄物进行完全回收利用（这几乎是不可能的），再加上对所有其他有机氮源近乎完美的回收利用，才能提供每年施用于农作物的氨基肥料所需的氮量。同时，没有任何其他材料能够媲美多种塑料所兼具的延展性、耐久性和轻质特性。同样，即使我们能够生产出相同质量的建筑木材或采石场石材，它们也无法与钢筋混凝土的强度、多功能性和耐久性相媲美。我们可以建造金字塔和大教堂，但却无法建造优雅的长跨度拱桥、巨型水电站、多车道公路或长长的机场跑道。钢铁的应用如此广泛，以至于其不可替代的部署决定了我们获取能源、生产粮食和为人口提供住所的能力，以及确保所有重要基础设施的规模和质量：没有任何金属能够与之相提并论。

As noted in chapter 2, only an impossibly complete recycling of all wastes voided by grazing animals could, together with near-perfect recycling of all other sources of organic nitrogen, provide the amount of nitrogen annually applied to crops in ammonia-based fertilizers. Meanwhile, there are no other materials that can rival the combination of malleability, durability, and light weight offered by many kinds of plastics. Similarly, even if we were able to produce identical masses of construction lumber or quarried stone, they could not equal the strength, versatility, and durability of reinforced concrete. We would be able to build pyramids and cathedrals but not elegant long spans of arched bridges, giant hydroelectric dams, multilane roads, or long airport runways. And steel has become so ubiquitous that its irreplaceable deployment determines our ability to extract energies, produce food, and shelter populations, as well as ensuring the extent and quality of all essential infrastructures: no metal could, even remotely, become its substitute.

当我们展望没有化石碳的未来时，这四种材料的另一个关键共同点尤其值得关注：它们的大规模生产都严重依赖化石燃料的燃烧，而其中一些燃料也是合成氨和生产塑料的原料。[6]高炉炼铁需要用煤（以及天然气）制成的焦炭；水泥生产所需的能源主要来自煤粉、石油焦和重质燃料油。构成塑料的绝大多数简单分子，即长链或支链，都来源于原油和天然气。在现代氨合成过程中，天然气既是氢气的来源，也是工艺能源。

Another key commonality between these four materials is particularly noteworthy as we contemplate the future without fossil carbon: the mass-scale production of all of them depends heavily on the combustion of fossil fuels, and some of these fuels also supply feedstocks for the synthesis of ammonia and for the production of plastics.[6] Iron ore smelting in blast furnaces requires coke made from coal (and also natural gas); energy for cement production comes mostly from coal dust, petroleum coke, and heavy fuel oil. The vast majority of simple molecules that are bonded in long chains or branches to make plastics are derived from crude oils and natural gases. And in the modern synthesis of ammonia, natural gas is both the source of hydrogen and processing energy.

因此，这四种不可或缺材料的全球生产消耗了全球约17%的一次能源供应，并占化石燃料燃烧产生的二氧化碳总排放量的25%。燃料——目前还没有商业化且易于大规模部署的替代方案来取代这些现有工艺。[7]虽然不依赖化石碳生产这些材料的方案和实验技术层出不穷——从用于氨合成的新型催化剂到氢基炼钢——但这些替代方案均未实现商业化。即使积极寻求非碳替代方案，显然也需要数十年才能取代现有产能，而这些现有产能以可承受的价格，每年生产数亿至数十亿吨。[8]

As a result, global production of these four indispensable materials claims about 17 percent of the world’s primary energy supply, and 25 percent of all CO2 emissions originating in the combustion of fossil fuels—and currently there are no commercially available and readily deployable mass-scale alternatives to displace these established processes.[7] Although there is no shortage of proposals and experimental techniques to produce these materials without relying on fossil carbon—ranging from new catalyses for ammonia synthesis to hydrogen-based steelmaking—none of those alternatives has been commercialized, and even if the aggressive pursuit of non-carbon options were to take place, it would obviously take decades to displace the existing capacities that are producing, at affordable prices, at annual rates of hundreds of millions to billions of tons.[8]

为了真正理解这些材料的重要性，我将解释它们的基本特性和功能，简要概述使它们得以广泛应用且价格低廉的技术进步和划时代发明，并描述它们在现代的多种用途。我将从氨开始——因为它对于养活日益增长的全球人口至关重要——然后按照全球年产量的顺序，依次介绍塑料、钢铁和水泥。

In order to truly appreciate the importance of these materials, I will explain their basic properties and functions, outline briefly the histories of technical advances and epoch-making inventions that made them abundantly available and affordable, and describe the enormous variety of their modern uses. I will start with ammonia—because of its indispensability for feeding a growing share of the global population—and proceed, in the order of annual global mass production, to plastics, steel, and cement.

氨：滋养世界的气体

Ammonia: the gas that feeds the world

在这四种物质中（尽管我不喜欢排名！），氨才是最重要的物质，理应位列榜首。正如前一章所述，如果没有氨作为主要的氮肥（直接使用或作为合成其他含氮化合物的原料），我们今天近80亿人口中至少40%、甚至高达50%的人将无法获得足够的食物。简而言之：如果没有合成氨，2020年将有近40亿人无法生存。塑料、钢铁，以及制造混凝土所需的水泥（如前所述，硅也是如此），都不存在类似的生存限制。

Of the four substances (and despite my dislike of rankings!), it is ammonia that deserves the top position as our most important material. As explained in the previous chapter, without its use as the dominant nitrogen fertilizer (directly or as feedstock for the synthesis of other nitrogenous compounds), it would be impossible to feed at least 40 percent and up to 50 percent of today’s nearly 8 billion people. Simply restated: in 2020, nearly 4 billion people would not have been alive without synthetic ammonia. No comparable existential constraints apply to plastics or steel, nor to the cement that is required to make concrete (nor, as already noted, to silicon).

氨是一种简单的无机化合物，由一个氮原子和三个氢原子组成（NH₃ ），这意味着氮原子占其质量的82%。[9]在大气压下，它是一种无色无味的气体，具有类似未冲水马桶或腐烂物品的刺鼻气味。动物粪便。吸入低浓度动物粪便会导致头痛、恶心和呕吐；高浓度动物粪便会刺激眼睛、鼻子、口腔、咽喉和肺部；吸入极高浓度动物粪便可能立即致命。相比之下，氨溶于水形成的铵（NH₄⁺ ，铵离子）无毒，且不易穿透细胞膜。

Ammonia is a simple inorganic compound of one nitrogen and three hydrogens (NH3), which means that nitrogen makes up 82 percent of its mass.[9] At atmospheric pressure it is an invisible gas with a characteristic pungent smell of unflushed toilets or decomposing animal manure. Inhaling it in low concentrations causes headaches, nausea, and vomiting; higher concentrations irritate the eyes, nose, mouth, throat, and lungs; and inhalation of very high concentrations can be instantly fatal. In contrast, ammonium (NH4+, ammonium ion), formed by the dissolution of ammonia in water, is non-toxic and does not easily penetrate cell membranes.

合成这种简单的分子却出乎意料地困难。发明史上不乏偶然发现的著名案例；在本章材料篇章中，特氟龙的故事或许是最恰当的例子。1938年，杜邦公司的化学家罗伊·普朗克特和他的助手杰克·雷博克研制出四氟乙烯，作为一种新型制冷剂化合物。在将其储存在冷藏钢瓶中后，他们发现这种化合物发生了意想不到的聚合反应，变成了聚四氟乙烯——一种白色、蜡状、滑腻的粉末。二战后，特氟龙成为最著名的合成材料之一，或许也是唯一一种进入政治术语的合成材料（我们有“特氟龙总统”，但似乎没有“胶木总统”——尽管有一位“铁娘子”）。[10]

Synthesizing this simple molecule was surprisingly challenging. The history of inventions includes famous cases of accidental discoveries; in this chapter on materials, the story of Teflon might be the most apposite example. In 1938, Roy Plunkett, a chemist at DuPont, and his assistant Jack Rebok formulated tetrafluoroethylene as a new refrigerant compound. After storing it in refrigerated cylinders, they found that the compound underwent unexpected polymerization, turning into polytetrafluoroethylene, a white, waxy, slippery powder. After the Second World War, Teflon became one of the best-known synthetic materials, and perhaps the only one that made it into political jargon (we have Teflon presidents, but seemingly no Bakelite presidents—though there was an Iron Lady).[10]

从元素合成氨属于另一类发现——这类发现目标明确，由一些最杰出的科学家追求，最终由一位坚持不懈的研究者实现。这项突破的必要性显而易见。1850年至1900年间，欧洲和北美工业化国家的总人口从3亿增长到5亿，快速的城市化推动了饮食结构的转变，从勉强够用的以谷物为主的饮食转向能量摄入更高、包含更多动物产品和糖类的食物。[11]虽然粮食产量停滞不前，但前所未有的耕地扩张支撑了这种饮食结构的转变：1850年至1900年间，北美、南美、俄罗斯和澳大利亚约有2亿公顷的草原被改造成谷物田。[12]

The synthesis of ammonia from its elements belongs to the opposite class of discoveries—those with a clearly defined goal pursued by some of the best-qualified scientists and eventually reached by a persevering researcher. The need for this breakthrough was obvious. Between 1850 and 1900 the total population of the industrializing countries of Europe and North America grew from 300 million to 500 million, and rapid urbanization helped to drive a dietary transition from a barely adequate grain-dominated supply to generally higher food energy intakes containing more animal products and sugar.[11] Yields remained stagnant but the dietary shift was supported by an unprecedented expansion of cropland: between 1850 and 1900, about 200 million hectares of North and South American, Russian, and Australian grasslands were converted to grain fields.[12]

日臻成熟的农学科学表明，确保20世纪人口粮食供应充足的唯一途径是提高作物产量，而提高产量的关键在于增加氮和磷这两种重要的植物大量营养元素的供应。磷酸盐的开采（最初在北卡罗来纳州，后来在佛罗里达州）以及酸处理是实现这一目标的重要一步。这为磷肥的可靠供应铺平了道路。[13]但是，当时并没有同样可靠的氮肥来源。在干旱的热带岛屿上开采鸟粪（富含氮的鸟粪堆积物）很快就耗尽了最丰富的矿藏，而智利硝酸盐（该国北部干旱地区拥有丰富的硝酸钠矿层）进口量的不断增长也无法满足未来的全球需求。[14]

Maturing agronomic science made it clear that the only way to secure adequate food for the larger populations of the 20th century was to raise yields by increasing the supply of nitrogen and phosphorus, two key plant macronutrients. The mining of phosphates (first in North Carolina and then in Florida) and their treatment by acids opened the way to a reliable supply of phosphatic fertilizers.[13] But, there was no comparably assured source of nitrogen. The mining of guano (accumulated bird droppings, moderately rich in nitrogen) on dry tropical islands had quickly exhausted the richest deposits, and the rising imports of Chilean nitrates (the country has extensive sodium nitrate layers in its arid northern regions) were insufficient to meet future global demand.[14]

当时的挑战在于如何确保人类能够获得足够的氮来维持不断增长的人口。1898年，化学家兼物理学家威廉·克鲁克斯在英国科学促进协会的就职演说中，以最清晰的方式阐述了这一需求，该演说专门针对所谓的“小麦问题”。他警告说，“所有文明国家都面临着粮食短缺的致命危险”，但他看到了解决之道：科学能够力挽狂澜，利用大气中几乎无限的氮（以惰性分子N₂的形式存在），并将其转化为植物可以吸收的化合物。他正确地总结道，这一挑战“与目前尚处于萌芽阶段但尚未成熟的其他化学发现有着本质区别。固氮作用对人类文明的进步至关重要。其他发现则有助于提升我们的精神舒适度、享受生活或获得便利；它们使生活更轻松，加速财富积累，或节省时间、维护健康或减轻忧虑。固氮作用是近在眼前的现实。 ” [15]

The challenge was to ensure that humanity could secure enough nitrogen to sustain its expanding numbers. The need was explained in 1898 in the clearest possible manner by William Crookes, chemist and physicist, to the British Association for the Advancement of Science, in his presidential address dedicated to the so-called wheat problem. He warned that “all civilized nations stand in deadly peril of not having enough to eat,” but he saw the way out: science coming to the rescue, tapping the practically unlimited mass of nitrogen in the atmosphere (present as the unreactive molecule N2) and converting it into compounds assimilable by plants. He rightly concluded that this challenge “differs materially from other chemical discoveries which are in the air, so to speak, but are not yet matured. The fixation of nitrogen is vital to the progress of civilized humanity. Other discoveries minister to our increased intellectual comfort, luxury, or convenience; they serve to make life easier, to hasten the acquisition of wealth, or to save time, health, or worry. The fixation of nitrogen is a question of the not far-distant future.”[15]

克鲁克斯的设想在他发表演讲仅仅十年后便得以实现。许多杰出的化学家（包括1909年诺贝尔化学奖得主威廉·奥斯特瓦尔德）都致力于从氮和氢两种元素合成氨，但1908年，时任卡尔斯鲁厄理工大学物理化学和电化学教授的弗里茨·哈伯，在其英国助手罗伯特·勒·罗西尼奥尔的协助下，并在德国乃至世界领先的化工企业巴斯夫公司的支持下，成为首位成功合成氨的研究人员。[16]他的解决方案依赖于使用铁催化剂（一种能够提高化学反应速率而不改变自身组成的化合物）并施加前所未有的反应压力。

Crookes’s vision was realized just 10 years after his address. The synthesis of ammonia from its elements, nitrogen and hydrogen, was pursued by a number of highly qualified chemists (including Wilhelm Ostwald, a Nobel Prize winner in chemistry in 1909), but in 1908 Fritz Haber—at that time professor of physical chemistry and electrochemistry at the Technische Hochschule in Karlsruhe—working with his English assistant Robert Le Rossignol and supported by BASF, Germany’s (and the world’s) leading chemical enterprise, was the first researcher to succeed.[16] His solution relied on using an iron catalyst (a compound that increases the rate of a chemical reaction without altering its own composition) and deploying unprecedented reaction pressure.

将哈伯的实验成果转化为商业化生产同样是一项艰巨的挑战。在1899年加入巴斯夫的化学和冶金工程专家卡尔·博世的领导下，仅用了四年时间就取得了成功。世界上第一座氨合成厂于1913年9月在奥帕乌投产，“哈伯-博世法”这一名称也沿用至今。[17]

It was a no smaller challenge to scale up Haber’s experimental success to a commercial enterprise. Under the leadership of Carl Bosch, an expert in chemical as well as metallurgical engineering who joined BASF in 1899, success was achieved in just four years. The world’s first ammonia synthesis plant began to operate at Oppau in September 1913, and the term “Haber-Bosch process” has endured ever since.[17]

不到一年，奥帕乌工厂的氨就被转用于生产德军所需的炸药硝酸盐。1917年，莱纳建成了一座规模更大的新氨厂，但这对阻止德国战败几乎毫无作用。尽管经历了20世纪30年代的经济危机，战后氨合成的扩张仍在继续，并在第二次世界大战期间持续进行，但到1950年，合成氨仍然远不如动物粪便普遍。[18]

Within a year, the Oppau plant’s ammonia was diverted to make the nitrate needed to produce explosives for the German army.
