That was good enough to make a profit carrying such high-value cargoes as spices, tea, and china, but completely uneconomical for any trade in bulk commodities (valuable Japanese copper was the major exception). And while the sailings to Batavia were limited by the availability of ships and the risks of travel, sailings to Japan were restricted by the Tokugawa shoguns to no more than 2–7 ships a year and to just one arrival a year during the 1790s. And because the Dutch East India Company kept detailed records, we also know the number of people who boarded the more than 4,700 ships bound from the Netherlands to the East Indies: nearly 1 million people made this journey between 1595 and 1795, but that is just 5,000 a year, and about 15 percent of them died before reaching Ceylon or Batavia.[19]

即便如此，在近代早期第二个世纪（1500-1800年），那些处于全球化浪潮前沿的社会，尽管当时的全球化规模尚小，但已初见端倪，它们仍然受到这些远距离交流的影响。[20]毫不奇怪，鉴于他们新近获得的财富以及与其他大陆的联系，荷兰共和国黄金时代（1608-1672年）的城市精英的生活或许是这些新成果的最佳例证。他们日益丰富的财产和经历，显然是贸易以及物质和文化交流所带来的收益的标志，许多著名画家也为我们提供了对这种萌芽状态的精彩记录。

Even so, during the second century of the early modern era (1500–1800) the societies at the forefront of this still-modest but rising wave of globalization were influenced by these long-range interchanges.[20] Not surprisingly, given their newly acquired riches and contact with other continents, the lives of urban elites during the Dutch Republic’s Golden Age (1608–1672) offer perhaps the best examples of these new benefits. Their growing range of possessions and experiences were the obvious markers of the gains derived from trade and from material and cultural exchanges, and many famous painters provide a fascinating record of this incipient affluence.

迪尔克·哈尔斯、杰拉德·特·博尔赫、弗朗斯·范·米里斯、扬·维米尔·范·德尔夫特以及许多其他名气稍逊的大师的作品都展现了这些新利润如何转化为瓷砖地板、玻璃窗、做工精良的家具、厚实的桌布和乐器。[21]有人认为这一切都可以忽略不计，因为这类绘画描绘的是一个在现实中从未存在过的幻想世界。[22]夸张和风格化虽然当时确实存在奢侈，但正如历史学家扬·德·弗里斯所明确指出的那样，他所谓的“新奢侈”（由城市社会产生）是真实存在的：它不追求宏伟和奢靡，而是体现在精湛工艺的产品中——从家具到挂毯，从代尔夫特瓷砖到银器——其中包括17世纪60年代荷兰家庭拥有的约300万幅绘画作品。[23]

Works by Dirck Hals, Gerard ter Borch, Frans van Mieris, Jan Vermeer van Delft, and many lesser masters show these new profits turned into tiled floors, glass windows, well-made furniture, thick tablecloths, and musical instruments.[21] Some have argued that this can all be dismissed because this genre of painting depicted a fantasy world that never existed in reality.[22] Exaggeration and stylization were certainly present, but, as historian Jan de Vries makes clear, what he calls the “New Luxury” (generated by urban society) was real: not striving for grandeur and excess, but evinced in products of good craftsmanship—from furniture to tapestries, from Delft tiles to silver utensils—including about 3 million paintings owned by families in Holland in the 1660s.[23]

还有其他更直接的证据证明荷兰人向外拓展和引进了非洲人：阿姆斯特丹有非洲人居住，地图很受欢迎，地图集的编纂和出版生意很赚钱，人们消费糖和异国水果，进口香料（荷兰对东印度群岛的殖民始于 1607 年，当时荷兰占领了丁香的最大产地特尔纳特，随后不久又占领了盛产肉豆蔻的班达群岛），以及人们饮用茶和咖啡。[24]

And there were other, more direct, proofs of reaching out and bringing in: the presence of Africans in Amsterdam, the popularity of maps, the profitable business of compiling and publishing atlases, the consumption of sugar and exotic fruits, the import of spices (the Dutch colonization of the East Indies began in 1607 by taking over Ternate, the largest producer of cloves, followed shortly afterwards by occupying the nutmeg-growing Banda Islands), and the drinking of tea and coffee.[24]

但这些早期的交流经济影响有限，因为它们从未惠及那些从新事业中受益的小部分人群之外。乡村地区依然保持着传统的生活方式。这仅仅是一种萌芽状态的、选择性的、有限的全球化，没有产生任何实质性的全国性影响，更遑论真正的全球性后果。例如，经济学家安格斯·麦迪逊估计，在1698年至1700年间，来自东印度群岛的商品出口仅占荷兰国内生产总值的1.8%，而印尼的出口顺差也仅占荷兰国内生产总值的1.1%——近一个世纪后（1778年至1780年），这两个比例仍然只有1.7%。[25]

But these early exchanges had limited economic impact, as they never reached beyond the small segments of people who benefited from the new ventures. The countryside was left with its traditional ways. This was just an incipient, selective, and limited globalization without any substantial nationwide impacts, to say nothing about truly global consequences. For example, economist Angus Maddison estimated that in 1698–1700 commodity exports from the East Indies accounted for just 1.8 percent of the Dutch net domestic product, and that the Indonesian export surplus was a mere 1.1 percent of the Dutch GDP—and nearly a century later (1778–1780) both of these shares were still only 1.7 percent.[25]

蒸汽机和电报

Steam engines and telegraph

全球化进程中的第一次量化飞跃，只有随着更可靠的导航技术、蒸汽动力（带来更大的船舶载货量和更快的航速）以及电报——第一种（几乎）即时的远距离通信手段——的出现才得以实现。导航技术先于其他技术发展，1765年，约翰·哈里森发明了第四座高精度航海钟，这台精密计时器使得确定精确经度成为可能。但速度和载货量的飞跃则要等到……蒸汽机取代了帆船在洲际航运中的应用，螺旋桨取代了明轮船，钢制船体船舶占据了主导地位。[26]

The first quantitative leap in the process of globalization came only with the combination of more reliable navigation, steam power (resulting in larger ship capacities and faster speeds), and the telegraph—the first means of (nearly) instant long-distance communication. Navigation came first, in 1765, with John Harrison’s fourth highly accurate sea clock, a chronometer which made it possible to determine exact longitude. But the leap in speeds and capacities had to wait until steam engines displaced sails in intercontinental shipping, when screws made paddlewheels obsolete, and when steel-hulled ships became dominant.[26]

1838年，蒸汽动力船首次完成向西横渡大西洋的航行，但帆船在接下来的四十年里仍然保持着竞争力。由于风力是主要动力，帆船运输单位货物单位距离的成本在很大程度上与航程长短无关；而蒸汽船航程越长，就必须装载越多的煤炭来为效率相对较低的发动机提供燃料，从而减少了装载货物的空间。加油站虽然缓解了这一劣势，但并未完全消除。[27]

The first steam-powered westward transatlantic crossings took place in 1838, but sailing ships remained competitive for another four decades. With wind as the prime mover, the cost of carrying a unit of cargo per unit of distance by a sailing ship was largely independent of the length of the voyage; while the longer the steamship voyage, the more of the vessel’s deadweight capacity had to be loaded with coal to fuel relatively inefficient engines, leaving less room for cargo. Refueling stations reduced, but did not eliminate, this disadvantage.[27]

德国的转型很好地证明了帆船和蒸汽船长期共存的事实：到 1873 年，帆船在欧洲内部航线上失去了竞争优势，而在洲际航线上，帆船直到 1880 年还具有优势，但随着更高效的发动机的采用，帆船很快就失去了优势。[28]

This long coexistence of sail and steam is well documented by the German transition: by 1873, sailing ships had lost the competition on the intra-European routes, while on the intercontinental routes sails had the advantage until 1880 but lost it rapidly afterwards with the adoption of more efficient engines.[28]

所有横渡大西洋的先驱蒸汽船都采用明轮推进，但螺旋桨推进在19世纪40年代才开始商业化应用；1877年，劳氏船级社批准钢铁作为可投保的建筑材料，与此同时，新的生产方法使得钢铁的供应充足且价格低廉（参见第三章）。钢制船体、螺旋桨和大型蒸汽机使得蒸汽船的航速能够稳定达到30公里/小时，随后又达到40公里/小时，而19世纪50年代最快的帆船的平均航速仅为20公里/小时。此外，随着活牛的出口，以及从19世纪70年代开始，来自美国、澳大利亚和新西兰的冷藏肉（几乎全部由客轮运输）和黄油的出口，远洋航运也获得了新的市场。[29]

All pioneering steamships crossing the Atlantic were propelled by paddlewheels, but screw propulsion was commercially introduced during the 1840s; and in 1877 Lloyd’s Register of Shipping approved steel as an insurable construction material just as new production methods made the metal abundant and affordable (see chapter 3). Steel hulls and screws and large steam engines made it possible to cover reliably 30 and then 40 km/hour compared to the average of 20 km/hour for the fastest clippers of the 1850s, and long-distance shipping also gained new markets with the exports of live cattle and—starting in the 1870s—chilled meat (carried almost exclusively by passenger liners) and butter from the US, Australia, and New Zealand.[29]

实用电报技术在19世纪30年代末至40年代初发展起来；第一条（短暂存在的）跨大西洋海底电缆于1858年铺设；到世纪末，海底电缆已连接了所有大陆。[30]历史上第一次，贸易可以考虑到世界各地不同的需求和价格信息——而一种新的强大动力的出现可以将这些信息转化为有利可图的国际交易：例如，当爱荷华州牛肉的价格低于质量较差的英国牛肉，并且新的冷藏技术出现时，牛肉出口量就大幅增加。美国冷冻肉销量迅速增长——从 19 世纪 70 年代末到 20 世纪初，销量增长了四倍多。

Practical telegraph was developed during the late 1830s and the early 1840s; the first (short-lived) transatlantic link cable was laid in 1858; and by the century’s end undersea cables had connected all continents.[30] For the first time in history, trading could take into consideration the knowledge of demand and prices in different parts of the world—and the availability of a new powerful prime mover could translate this information into profitable international exchanges: when the price of Iowa beef was cheaper than British beef of inferior quality and new refrigerating techniques became available, for example, the exports of frozen American meat rose rapidly—more than quadrupling between the late 1870s and the late 1900s.

在蒸汽时代推动的全球化浪潮中，电话——这种远胜于电报的直接个人通讯工具——的作用仍然有限。[31] 1876年电话获得专利并首次公开演示后，其服务通过人工交换机缓慢普及。美国电话拥有量从1880年的不足5万户增长到1900年的135万户（平均每56个美国人拥有一部电话）；通话距离逐渐扩大（直到1892年才能从纽约打到芝加哥）；1915年，首次跨大陆电话（经由多个交换机）打到旧金山；三分钟的通话费用约为20美元，相当于2020年的500多美元。首次洲际电话——从美国打到英国——直到1927年才实现，即使是垄断的国内电话服务，在接下来的两代人中也仍然相对昂贵。[32]

During this wave of steam-driven globalization, the role of the telephone—a device far superior to telegraph for direct personal communication—remained limited.[31] Its patenting and the first public demonstration in 1876 were followed by a slow diffusion of service mediated by manual exchanges. US telephone ownership rose from less than 50,000 in 1880 to 1.35 million by 1900 (one phone for every 56 Americans); calling distances expanded gradually (a call from New York to Chicago could be made only in 1892); the first transcontinental calls to San Francisco (via multiple exchanges) came in 1915; and a three-minute conversation cost about $20, or more than $500 in 2020 monies. The first intercontinental call—from the US to the UK—came only in 1927, and even the monopolized domestic service remained relatively expensive for the next two generations.[32]

但洲际航运的进步，加上1840年后铁路的快速建设——遍及欧洲、北美、印度、亚洲其他地区以及拉丁美洲——催生了真正意义上的大规模全球化的第一波浪潮。1870年至1913年间，全球贸易总量增长了四倍；贸易（出口和进口）占全球经济产出的比重从1850年的约5%上升到1870年的9%，并在1913年达到14%；对包括澳大利亚、加拿大、法国、日本、墨西哥和英国在内的13个国家的最佳估计显示，它们的贸易份额总和从1870年的30%上升到第一次世界大战前夕的50%。[33]

But the advances in intercontinental shipping, combined with rapid post-1840 construction of railroads—across Europe and North America, as well as in India, other regions of Asia, and Latin America—created the first wave of a truly large-scale globalization. The total volume of global trade quadrupled between 1870 and 1913; the share of trade (exports and imports) in the worldwide economic product rose from about 5 percent in 1850 to 9 percent by 1870, and to 14 percent in 1913; and the best estimates for 13 countries (including Australia, Canada, France, Japan, Mexico, and the UK) show their combined share rising from 30 percent in 1870 to 50 percent just before the First World War.[33]

大型蒸汽轮船也以前所未有的规模运送乘客。在帆船时代，普通客轮搭载250至700名统舱乘客；到了20世纪初，一艘蒸汽轮船的载客量可能超过2000人。[34]休闲旅行，这种曾经仅限于特权阶层的临时性迁徙形式，随着蒸汽火车和轮船的出现而蓬勃发展，呈现出多种形式。1841年，托马斯·库克率先推出旅行社提供的旅游套餐，温泉和海滨度假也成为一种时尚，人们纷纷前往巴登-巴登、卡尔斯巴德和维希，以及法国大西洋沿岸的特鲁维尔或卡普里岛。

Large steam liners were also able to move passengers on an unprecedented scale. During the sailing era, packet ships carried 250–700 steerage passengers; by the first decade of the 20th century, a steam liner might carry more than 2,000 passengers.[34] Leisure travel, a form of temporary migration formerly reserved for the privileged classes, took off in its many manifestations with steam-powered trains and ships. With Thomas Cook leading the way in 1841, travel agencies offered package tours, and spa and seaside vacations became fashionable as people visited Baden-Baden, Karlsbad, and Vichy, and traveled to Trouville on the French Atlantic coast or to Capri.

这些旅行中有些是跨洲的：富裕的俄罗斯家庭乘坐火车从莫斯科和圣彼得堡一路前往法国里维埃拉。一些旅行者寻求体能挑战（当时新兴的阿尔卑斯山登山运动），而另一些人则进行（更为经济实惠的）宗教朝圣。[35]这种新的流动性也具有鲜明的政治意义，流亡者——乘坐火车和轮船——在国外寻求庇护：最著名的例子是，几乎所有未来杰出的布尔什维克领导人（列宁、托洛茨基、布哈林、季诺维也夫）都曾在欧洲和美国生活多年。[36]

Some of these trips were transcontinental: affluent Russian families took trains all the way from Moscow and Saint Petersburg to the French Riviera. Some travelers sought physical challenges (newly fashionable Alpine mountaineering), while others went on (more affordable) religious pilgrimages.[35] And this new mobility also had a distinctly political dimension, with exiles—traveling by trains and ships—seeking refuge in foreign countries: most famously, nearly all future prominent Bolshevik leaders (Lenin, Leon Trotsky, Nikolai Bukharin, Grigory Zinoviev) spent many years abroad in Europe and the US.[36]

我认为，蒸汽全球化也催生了一种新的文学审美，而约瑟夫·康拉德（原名约瑟夫·科热尼奥夫斯基）正是这种审美的代表人物，这种观点是完全合理的。他最伟大的三部小说的主人公都因那个时代的贸易和旅行而远离家乡（诺斯特罗莫在南美洲，吉姆在亚洲，马洛在非洲），他们的生活和不幸都与蒸汽船息息相关：在同名小说《诺斯特罗莫》中，诺斯特罗莫被称为“码头总管”（Capataz de Cargadores）；在《吉姆爷》中，吉姆在帮助穆斯林朝圣者从亚洲前往麦加的途中遭遇了悲剧；而在《黑暗之心》中，如果没有西方商品深入刚果盆地，马洛的转变也不可能发生。

And I think it is quite reasonable to argue that steam globalization also helped to create a new kind of literary sensibility, with Joseph Conrad (Józef Korzeniowski) as its master. The protagonists of his three greatest novels find themselves far from their homes thanks to the era’s mass trade and travel (Nostromo in South America, Jim in Asia, Marlow in Africa), and their lives and misfortunes were linked to steamships: Nostromo, in the eponymous novella, is known as Capataz de Cargadores (Head Longshoreman); Jim’s life takes a tragic turn while he is helping transport Muslim pilgrims from Asia to Mecca in Lord Jim; and Marlow’s transformation could not have taken place without Western goods being brought deep into the Congo basin in Heart of Darkness.

第一台柴油发动机、飞行和无线电

The first diesel engines, flight, and radio

推动远洋运输能力提升的下一个根本性进步是柴油发动机取代蒸汽发动机——柴油发动机效率更高、性能更可靠。[37]促进全球化的两项并行进程是：由往复式汽油发动机驱动的飞机的发明和无线电通信的出现。莱特兄弟于1903年末进行了首次短暂飞行；第一次世界大战期间，数百架飞机投入战斗；第一家航空公司——荷兰皇家航空公司（KLM）——于1921年成立。[38]第一个跨大西洋无线电信号于1901年12月到达；法国军队部署了……1916 年出现了第一台用于空地通信的便携式发射机；20 世纪 20 年代初出现了第一家商业广播电台。[39]

The next fundamental advance in prime movers that raised the capability of long-distance shipping was the replacement of steam engines with diesel engines—machines of superior efficiency and reliable performance.[37] Two concurrent processes that promoted further globalization were the invention of airplanes powered by reciprocating gasoline engines, and radio communication. The first brief flights—by the Wright brothers—took place in late 1903; hundreds of planes flew in combat during the First World War; and the first airline company, the Dutch KLM, was set up in 1921.[38] The first transatlantic radio signal arrived in December 1901; the French army deployed the first portable transmitters for air-to-ground communication in 1916; and the first commercial radio stations began to broadcast in the early 1920s.[39]

鲁道夫·狄塞尔立志设计一种新型、更高效的原动机，到1897年，他的第一台（笨重且固定式的）发动机效率已达到30%，是当时最好的蒸汽机的两倍。[40]但第一台船用发动机直到1912年才安装在丹麦货轮“克里斯蒂安十世”号上。柴油动力船比燃煤蒸汽船携带的燃料少得多，而且无需加油就能航行更远，因为新型发动机的效率几乎是燃煤蒸汽船的两倍——此外，单位质量的柴油所含能量也几乎是燃煤蒸汽船的两倍。一位美国工程师在1912年第一艘柴油动力船首航纽约后，总结道：“柴油发动机的出现正在书写航海史。” [41]

Rudolf Diesel deliberately set out to design a new, more efficient, prime mover, and by 1897 his first (heavy and stationary) engine had reached an efficiency of 30 percent, double the performance of the best steam engines.[40] But the first marine engine was installed only in 1912 on Christian X, a Danish freighter. Diesel-powered ships carried much less fuel than coal-fired steamers, but could travel further without refueling because the new engines were nearly twice as efficient—and because, per unit of mass, diesel oil contains nearly twice as much energy. An American engineer who saw the first diesel-powered vessel after her maiden voyage to New York in 1912 concluded that: “marine history is being written by the advent of the Diesel engine.”[41]

到了20世纪30年代，柴油发动机席卷航运市场之际，迅速发展的航空业也开始交付首批能够实现长途盈利飞行的飞机。1936年，道格拉斯DC-3型双引擎飞机首次交付，该机可搭载多达32名乘客，飞行速度略高于现代喷气式客机的着陆速度。[42]三年后，波音314“飞剪”型水上飞机问世，这是一款航程达5633公里的远程水上飞机——虽然不足以横跨太平洋，但足以从旧金山飞往檀香山，然后继续飞往中途岛、威克岛、关岛和马尼拉，最终抵达亚洲。

By the 1930s, when diesel engines conquered the shipping market, the rapidly maturing aviation industry began to deliver the first airplanes capable of flying profitably over long distances. In 1936 came the first deliveries of the Douglas DC-3, a twin-engine aircraft capable of carrying up to 32 passengers just a bit faster than the landing speed of modern jetliners.[42] Three years later came the Boeing 314 Clipper, a long-range flying boat with an impressive range of 5,633 kilometers—still not enough to cross the Pacific, but more than enough to reach Honolulu from San Francisco before continuing to Midway, Wake, Guam, and Manila to reach Asia.

“快船号”为船上74名乘客提供了舒适的设施——包括客舱、餐厅、更衣室以及可转换为卧铺的座椅——但往复式发动机的噪音和震动却无法消除，而且最高巡航高度（5.9公里）仍然太低，无法飞越最湍急的大气层。从纽约到洛杉矶，中途停靠三次，耗时15个半小时；1934年首航伦敦至新加坡的航线，中途停靠22站，包括雅典、开罗、巴格达、巴士拉、沙迦、焦特布尔、加尔各答和仰光，耗时八天。[43]但即便如此，与从南安普顿经苏伊士运河乘船大约需要30天相比，这已经是一个相当大的进步了。

The Clipper had no shortage of physical comforts for its 74 passengers—including a stateroom and a dining room, dressing rooms, and seats that converted into bunks—but there was no way to eliminate the noise and vibration of reciprocating engines, and the highest cruising altitude (5.9 kilometers) was still too low to put it above the most turbulent atmospheric layers. With three stops it took 15½ hours from New York to Los Angeles, and the first London to Singapore link in 1934 took eight days with 22 layovers, including Athens, Cairo, Baghdad, Basra, Sharjah, Jodhpur, Calcutta, and Rangoon.[43] But long as it was, it was a considerable improvement on the approximately 30 days needed to travel by ship from Southampton via the Suez Canal.

无线电对于提升海空导航至关重要，而且与电报相比，它也是大规模即时信息传播的更优越工具。无线电通信最初应用于跨大西洋远洋客轮：得益于泰坦尼克号于1912年4月15日凌晨12点15分发出的遇险信号——“CQD Titanic 41.44 N 50.24 W”，卡帕西亚号救起了700名乘坐救生艇的乘客。[44] 20世纪30年代，随着测距站的引入，无线电导航取得了长足进步：正飞往机场的飞机可以听到持续的音频信号；偏离航线的飞机，如果位于航线左侧，则会听到摩尔斯电码N（- •），如果位于航线右侧，则会听到摩尔斯电码A（• –）。[45]

Radio was of critical importance for better sea and air navigation, and, compared to the telegraph, it was also a superior tool for mass-scale dissemination of instant information. Radio communication was deployed first on transatlantic ocean liners: thanks to Titanic’s distress message—“CQD Titanic 41.44 N 50.24 W,” sent at 12:15 a.m. on April 15, 1912—700 people in lifeboats were saved by Carpathia.[44] Radio navigation made great advances during the 1930s with the introduction of range stations: planes on course to an airport heard a continuous audio tone; those drifting off-course heard N Morse code (– •) when to the left of the path, A (• –) when right of it.[45]

无线广播无需昂贵的海底电缆，而且可以实现广域覆盖和普遍接入（任何拥有简单接收器的人都可以收听）。毫不奇怪，无线电接收器的普及速度非常快：在推出后的十年内，60%的美国家庭都拥有了无线电接收器——其普及速度几乎与二战后黑白电视（同样起源于20世纪20年代）的普及速度一样快，甚至比随后彩色电视的普及速度还要快，彩色电视在美国于20世纪60年代初迅速发展。[46]

Wireless broadcasts required no expensive undersea cables, and they could achieve wide area coverage and universal access (anybody with a simple receiver could listen). Not surprisingly, the adoption of radio receivers was rapid: within a decade after their introduction, 60 percent of American families had them—nearly as fast a rate of acquisition as that of black-and-white TVs (which also originated in the 1920s) after the Second World War, and a faster rate than the subsequent diffusion of color TV which in the US took off rapidly during the early 1960s.[46]

在两次世界大战之间的二十年间，船用柴油机和往复式飞机发动机一直是全球化的技术推动力，它们的大规模部署对第二次世界大战的结局起到了决定性作用。到战争结束时，美国制造了近29.6万架飞机，而德国和日本的飞机产量分别为约11.2万架和6.8万架。[47] 1945年，美国崛起为世界霸主，西欧的经济复苏迅速。在美国投资（1948年马歇尔计划）的帮助下，到1949年，该地区所有国家的工业生产水平都超过了战前（1934-1938年）水平，而日本的复苏则因其工业对朝鲜战争的贡献而加速。[48]

Marine diesels and reciprocating aircraft engines remained the technical enablers of globalization during the two interwar decades, and their mass-scale deployment made the decisive contribution to the outcome of the Second World War. By the conflict’s end, the US had built nearly 296,000 airplanes compared to about 112,000 in Germany and 68,000 in Japan.[47] In 1945, the United States emerged as the world’s dominant power, and the economic recovery of Western Europe was fast. Aided by the US investment (1948’s Marshall Plan), all of the region’s countries surpassed their prewar (1934–1938) level of industrial production by 1949, while Japan’s recovery was accelerated by the contribution of that country’s industries to the Korean War.[48]

因此，前所未有的增长和一体化时期以及广泛的社会文化交流由此拉开序幕。以苏联和中国为首的共产主义经济体是显著的例外：尽管它们报告了令人瞩目的经济增长率，但它们高度自给自足，与集团以外的国家几乎没有对外贸易（并且禁止其公民出国旅行）。

The stage was thus set for a period of unprecedented growth and integration, as well as for extensive social and cultural interactions. Communist economies, led by the USSR and China, were the notable exceptions: although they reported impressive economic growth rates, they were highly autarkic and operated with very little foreign trade beyond their bloc (and kept their citizens from traveling abroad).

大型柴油机、涡轮机、集装箱和微芯片

Large diesels, turbines, containers, and microchips

1950年后的全球化浪潮独特而强劲，但远未普及——这场浪潮在1973-1974年随着欧佩克两轮石油价格上涨而结束，随后经历了15年的相对停滞——得益于四项根本性技术进步的结合。这四项进步分别是：动力更强劲、效率更高的柴油发动机设计的迅速普及；新型原动机——用于喷气式客机推进的燃气轮机——的引入（以及更快速的推广）；洲际航运的卓越设计（用于运输液体和固体的大型散货船，以及其他货物的集装箱化）；以及计算机和信息处理技术的飞跃式发展。

This distinct and intensive, but still far from universal, spell of post-1950 globalization—which ended in 1973–1974 with OPEC’s two rounds of oil price increases and which was followed by 15 years of relative stagnation—was enabled by a combination of four fundamental technical advances. These were the rapid adoption of much more powerful and efficient designs of diesel engines; the introduction (and even faster diffusion) of a new prime mover, the gas turbine used for the propulsion of jetliners; superior designs for intercontinental shipping (massive bulk carriers for liquids and solids, and the containerization of other cargoes); and quantum leaps in computing and information processing.

这些进步始于第一批电子计算机——它们使用不可靠且笨重的真空管，在二战期间及战后不久研制成功——而晶体管的专利（1947-1949年）和商业化（始于1954年）则彻底改变了电子计算机的发展进程。晶体管至今仍是现代固态电子学的基础。下一步（20世纪50年代末至60年代初）是将越来越多的晶体管集成到微芯片上，从而制造出集成电路。1971年，英特尔发布了世界上第一款微处理器——4004。它包含2300个晶体管，构成了一个完整的通用中央处理器，适用于多种可编程应用。

These advances took off with the first electronic computers—which used unreliable and bulky vacuum tubes and were built during, and right after, the Second World War—and their progress was revolutionized by the patenting (1947–1949) and commercialization (starting in 1954) of the first transistors, devices that remain the foundation of modern solid-state electronics. The next step (late 1950s–early 1960s) was placing increasing numbers of transistors on a microchip to create integrated circuits, and in 1971 Intel released its 4004, the world’s first microprocessor. It contained 2,300 transistors, forming a complete general-purpose central processing unit suitable for many programmable applications.

尽管人们普遍认为，自21世纪初以来，各项技术能力（尤其是人工智能和合成生物学的进步）的变革性意义不容忽视，但我们的世界仍然依赖于1973年以前取得的关键成就。此外，由于目前尚无其他替代方案能够以类似的规模完成相同的任务，因此在未来几十年里，我们仍将依赖这些技术——无论是巨型船用柴油发动机、集装箱船和宽体喷气式客机，还是微处理器。正因如此，这些技术才值得我们深入研究。

And despite the recent perceptions of the transformative nature of technical capabilities deployed since the beginning of the 21st century (above all, advances in artificial intelligence and synthetic biology), our world is still beholden to these critical pre-1973 achievements. Moreover, as there are no immediately available alternatives that could be deployed for the same tasks on similarly massive scales, we will depend on these techniques—be they giant marine diesel engines, container ships and wide-body jetliners, or microprocessors—for decades to come. And that is also why these techniques deserve a closer look.

1950年至1973年间全球经济扩张的规模是现代文明四大物质支柱（其评估见第三章）产量的增长以及世界能源需求的不断攀升（见第一章）最能说明这一点。[49]钢铁产量几乎翻了两番（从每年约1.9亿吨增至6.98亿吨），水泥产量增长了近六倍（从1.33亿吨增至7.7亿吨），氨合成量增长了近八倍（从不足500万吨氮增至3700万吨氮），塑料产量增长了26倍以上（从不足200万吨增至4500万吨）。一次能源产量几乎增长了两倍，原油消耗量增长了近六倍，因为世界对中东石油的依赖程度日益加深。因此，毫无疑问，哪项技术对全球经济的大规模运输贡献最大：如果没有柴油发动机，从谷物到原油的洲际散装货物贸易量将远不及现在。

The scale of global economic expansion between 1950 and 1973 is best illustrated by the growing output of the four material pillars of modern civilization (for their assessment, see chapter 3) and by the world’s rising energy demand (see chapter 1).[49] Steel production nearly quadrupled (from about 190 to 698 megatons per year), cement production increased almost sixfold (from 133 to 770 megatons), ammonia synthesis almost eightfold (from less than 5 to 37 megatons of nitrogen), and plastic output was more than 26 times higher (from less than 2 to 45 megatons). Primary energy output nearly tripled, and crude oil consumption rose almost sixfold as the world became increasingly dependent on Middle Eastern oil. As a result, there is no contest as to which technique has made the greatest difference in enabling mass-scale transport in the global economy: without diesel engines, intercontinental trade in bulk cargoes—from grain to crude oil—would have been just a small fraction of recent shipments.

二战后，随着西欧和日本经济的快速增长，以及中东新发现的巨型油田（沙特阿拉伯的加瓦尔油田是当时世界上最大的油田，于1948年被发现，1951年开始产油），原油油轮成为运力增长最快的船舶之一。这种廉价燃料（1971年之前售价不到每桶2美元）的出口需要运力不断提升的船舶。1950年以前的典型油轮运力仅为16,000载重吨（主要用于装载货物，但也包括燃料、压载水、补给和船员）。第一艘超过50,000载重吨的油轮于1956年下水，到20世纪60年代中期，日本造船厂开始建造运力在180,000至320,000载重吨之间的超大型原油运输船（VLCC）。除此之外，还有超大型原油运输船（ULCC）。20世纪70年代，七艘载重吨位超过50万吨的船舶下水，由于只能停靠在最深的港口，这些船舶体积过大，无法灵活选择航线。[50]这支不断壮大的船队使得中东石油的运输量从1950年的不足5000万吨增加到1972年的约8.5亿吨。[51]

After the Second World War, crude oil tankers were the first vessels to grow in capacity as the rapid economic growth of Western Europe and Japan coincided with the availability of newly discovered Middle Eastern giant oil fields (Saudi Arabia’s Ghawar, the world’s largest, was found in 1948 and began flowing in 1951), and exports of this inexpensive fuel (until 1971 it sold for less than $2 per barrel) required vessels of increasing capacities. Typical pre-1950 oil tankers had capacity of only 16,000 deadweight tons (mostly the ship’s cargo, but also its fuel, ballast, provision, and crew). The first tanker of more than 50,000 deadweight tons was launched in 1956, and by the mid-1960s Japanese shipyards began launching very large crude carriers (VLCC) with capacities of between 180,000 and 320,000 deadweight tons. Beyond that came ultra large crude carriers (ULCC) and seven ships larger than 500,000 deadweight tons were launched during the 1970s, too large to allow for flexible routing as they can be accommodated only at the deepest ports.[50] This growing fleet made it possible to increase the shipments of Middle Eastern oil from less than 50 megatons in 1950 to about 850 megatons by 1972.[51]

即使在 20 世纪 50 年代末和 60 年代初原油出口飙升的情况下，也没有办法运输天然气。天然气是一种比煤炭或精炼石油燃料更清洁的燃料，也非常适合工业和家庭用途以及高效发电。随着第一批液化天然气 (LNG) 运输船（在隔热容器中以 -162°C 的温度运输燃料）的投入使用，洲际天然气运输成为可能。1964 年，阿尔及利亚开始向英国出口天然气，1969 年，阿拉斯加开始向日本出口天然气。[52]但几十年来，这些船舶的运力很低，市场仅限于与少数买家签订长期合同。

Even as crude oil exports were soaring during the late 1950s and early 1960s, there was no way to ship natural gas, a cleaner fuel than coal or refined oil fuels and also well suited both to industrial and household uses and to the highly efficient generation of electricity. Intercontinental natural gas shipments became possible with the introduction of the first liquefied natural gas (LNG) tankers (carrying the fuel at –162°C in insulated containers), which brought exports from Algeria to the UK starting in 1964 and from Alaska to Japan in 1969.[52] But for decades, the ships were of low capacity and the market was limited to long-term contracts with a small number of buyers.

日益增长的洲际贸易需要新的专业运输方式。散货船配备了大型舱室和巨大的水密舱口，用于运输煤炭、谷物、矿石、水泥和化肥，并且可以快速装卸。但最伟大的航运创新出现在1957年，当时北卡罗来纳州的卡车司机马尔科姆·麦克莱恩终于将他在二战前的想法——用统一尺寸的钢制箱体运输货物，这种箱体便于大型港口起重机装载，可以直接卸载到等候的卡车或火车上，也可以临时堆放以便后续分销——变成了商业现实。

Growing intercontinental trade required new modes of specialized shipping. Bulk carriers with large compartments and massive watertight hatches were designed to transport coal, grain, ores, cement, and fertilizer, and they could be rapidly loaded and unloaded. But the greatest shipping innovation came in 1957, when a North Carolina trucker Malcolm McLean finally transformed his pre–Second World War idea—carrying cargo in uniformly-sized steel boxes, which are easy to load by large port cranes and can be off-loaded directly onto waiting trucks or trains or stacked temporarily for later distribution—into a commercial reality.

1957年10月，“门户城号”（Gateway City）货轮的船舱被改造成可容纳226个堆叠集装箱的单元式隔间，成为世界上第一艘真正意义上的集装箱船。1966年4月，麦克莱恩的海陆公司（Sea-Land）开通了往返欧洲（纽瓦克-鹿特丹）的定期集装箱航线，并于1968年开通了往返日本的航线。 [53]随着洲际汽车出口的不断扩大，也需要新的船舶。美国市场首先向大众甲壳虫汽车开放（甲壳虫是1949年进口的第一款汽车），随后又向日本小型汽车开放（丰田Toyopet自1958年起，本田N600自1969年起，本田思域自1973年起）。为了满足这些需求，新型滚装船（大多带有内置可伸缩装卸坡道）应运而生。经过多年的缓慢推广，大众汽车的销量在 1970 年达到顶峰，为 57 万辆，此后几十年，日本设计继续在美国市场占据份额。[54]

In October 1957, Gateway City, a freighter whose hold was fitted with cellular compartments to accommodate 226 stacked containers, became the world’s first true container ship, and McLean’s Sea-Land company began a regular container service to Europe (Newark–Rotterdam) in April 1966 and to Japan in 1968.[53] New ships were also needed for expanding intercontinental car exports. The American market opened up first to Volkswagen’s Beetle (the first car imported already in 1949) and then to small Japanese designs (the Toyopet since 1958, Honda N600 since 1969, and Honda Civic since 1973), and new roll-on/roll-off vessels (mostly with built-in retractable loading ramps) were designed to meet those needs. After years of slow adoption, VW’s sales peaked at 570,000 units in 1970, and Japanese designs continued to gain US market share over the coming decades.[54]

幸运的是，这些新型大型船舶的推进需求并未出现问题。二战前最大柴油发动机的尺寸到20世纪50年代末已经翻了一番多，功率超过10兆瓦，效率也接近50%。[55]随后，这些巨型多缸发动机的最大功率在20世纪60年代末上升到35兆瓦，到1973年超过40兆瓦。任何额定功率超过30兆瓦的柴油发动机都可以……为最大的超大型油轮提供动力，因此这些船舶的尺寸从未受到足够原动机可用性的限制。

Fortunately, there was no problem meeting the propulsion needs of these new large ships. The pre–Second World War sizes of the largest diesel engine had more than doubled by the late 1950s—to more than 10 megawatts—as their efficiencies approached 50 percent.[55] Subsequently, the maximum power of these massive multi-cylinder engines rose to 35 megawatts by the late 1960s and to more than 40 megawatts by 1973. Any diesel engines rated above 30 megawatts can power the largest ULCC, and hence the size of these vessels has never been limited by the availability of adequate prime movers.

为了寻求实用的燃气涡轮机——一种全新的原动机，它将燃料喷入压缩空气流中，产生高温气体，气体膨胀后高速排出——人们于1938年研制出了第一台固定式燃气涡轮机（用于发电）。与此同时，在战前英国和德国，喷气式发动机的首批实用设计也几乎同时独立出现。[56]弗兰克·惠特尔和汉斯·冯·奥海恩是首批测试出足够高效可靠、可用于军用飞机的涡轮机的工程师。少量此类喷气式飞机于1944年末投入实战，但为时已晚，无法改变战争的既定进程。战争结束后，英国工业充分利用其优势，于1949年推出了“彗星”号，成为世界上第一架商用喷气式客机，该机由四台德哈维兰“幽灵”涡轮喷气发动机提供动力。[57]

The quest for a practical gas turbine, a radically new prime mover in which fuel is sprayed into a stream of compressed air in order to generate a high-temperature gas that expands and exits the machine at high speed, resulted in the first stationary turbine (for electricity generation) in 1938, just as the first practical designs for jet engines emerged—independently and at nearly the same time—in prewar England and Germany.[56] Frank Whittle and Hans von Ohain were the first engineers to test turbines that were sufficiently efficient and reliable to power military airplanes. Small numbers of these jets were used in combat in late 1944, too late to have any effect on the predetermined course of the war, but after its end the British industry pressed its advantage and in 1949 the Comet became the world’s first commercial jetliner, powered by four de Havilland Ghost turbojet engines.[57]

不幸的是，到1954年，一系列致命事故（与发动机无关）迫使该机型退役。1958年，重新设计的彗星客机重返市场，但很快就被波音707的光芒所掩盖。波音707是当时仍在不断壮大的喷气式客机家族的首款机型。[58]第二款机型是三引擎的波音727，1967年，波音737问世，它是该系列中最小的飞机。1966年，公司董事长威廉·艾伦做出了一个大胆的决定——投入超过公司市值两倍的资金，实际上是将公司的未来押注在这个项目的成功上——开发第一款宽体喷气式客机。

Unfortunately, by 1954 a series of fatal accidents (not related to the engines) forced the withdrawal of the plane from service, and when a redesigned Comet returned in 1958 it was quickly overshadowed by Boeing’s 707, the first design of a still-expanding family of jetliners.[58] The second in line was the tri-engine Boeing 727, and in 1967 came the Boeing 737, the smallest plane of the series. In 1966 William Allen, the company’s chairman, took a bold decision—investing more than twice the company’s worth, and hence essentially betting its future on the success of the project—to develop the first wide-body jetliner.

人们曾预期超音速喷气式飞机将接管洲际航线——英法联合研制的协和式飞机于1964年开始研发——但超音速飞行仍然仅限于昂贵且噪音巨大的协和式飞机，而波音747则成为了历史上最具革命性的飞机设计。[59]这架飞机最初是作为货机设计的：其宽大的机身可以并排放置两个标准集装箱，而位于顶部“泡泡”座舱的驾驶舱则允许飞机抬起机头进行前装卸。泛美航空订购25架747飞机不到三年后，原型机便成功首飞，并于1970年1月21日从纽约飞往伦敦，完成了首次商业飞行。

Supersonic jets were expected to take over intercontinental routes—the development of the British-French Concorde began in 1964—but supersonic flight remained restricted to the expensive and noisy Concorde and it was Boeing’s 747 that became the most revolutionary plane design in history.[59] The plane was actually conceived as a freighter: its wide body allowed the placing of two standard ship containers side by side, and the cockpit in the top bubble made it possible to turn up the nose for front-loading. The prototype took off less than three years after Pan Am’s order for 25 of the 747s, and the first commercial flight left New York for London on January 21, 1970.

该飞机的尺寸（最大起飞重量为333吨）是通过部署四台普惠涡扇发动机，即可实现这一目标。[60]与涡轮喷气发动机不同，涡轮喷气发动机的所有压缩空气都流经燃烧室，而涡扇发动机则让更大质量、压缩程度较低、速度较慢的空气绕过燃烧室，从而在起飞时产生更大的推力（而且噪音更小）。707 飞机的发动机旁通比为 1:1，而 747 飞机的旁通比为 4.8:1，这意味着绕过涡轮的空气量几乎是 707 的五倍。

The plane’s size (a maximum takeoff weight of 333 tons) was made possible by deploying four Pratt & Whitney turbofan engines.[60] Unlike turbojet engines, where all compressed air moves through the combustion chamber, in turbofans larger masses of less compressed and hence slower-moving air bypass the combustor and help to generate higher thrust during takeoff (and do so with less noise). Engines on 707s had a bypass ratio of 1:1, on the 747 it was 4.8:1, with nearly five times as much air bypassing the turbine.

在半个世纪的生产历程中，波音747的总交付量达到1548架。波音公司估计，在这五十年间，该机型运送了59亿人次，约占当时世界人口的75%。[61]这款飞机的革命性设计改变了洲际旅行，宽体客机以不断下降的成本和不断提高的安全性，将数亿人次运送到越来越多的目的地。

Total deliveries of the 747 have added up to 1,548 planes in half a century of production, and Boeing estimates that during those five decades the planes carried 5.9 billion people, the equivalent of about 75 percent of the world’s population.[61] The plane’s revolutionary design changed intercontinental travel, as wide-body jets have transported hundreds of millions of people to a growing number of destinations with steadily declining costs and increasing safety.

全球经济一体化与宽体客机的引入密切相关——从波音747到后来的空客A340和A380等机型。这些飞机的服务对亚洲出口商尤为重要，他们利用宽体客机在短时间内将许多热门或季节性商品（例如最新款手机、圣诞礼物）运送到北美和欧洲市场。此外，宽体客机还促进了此前鲜有人至的目的地（例如巴厘岛、特内里费岛、内罗毕和塔希提岛等地拥有足以起降747的跑道）的大规模旅游、洲际移民以及教育交流。

The integration of the global economy has been closely tied to the introduction of wide-body jetliners—to the Boeing 747 and to its later Airbus (A340 and A380) emulators. Their services have been particularly important for Asian exporters, who use them to deliver on short notice many highly sought-after or seasonal items (the latest mobile phone brands, Christmas gifts) to North American and European markets. And wide-body airplanes enabled mass-scale tourism to previously rarely visited destinations (runways long enough to accommodate 747s are in Bali and Tenerife, Nairobi and Tahiti), intercontinental immigration trips, and educational exchanges.

当然，全球化的进步不仅与强大的原动机的容量和性能的提升密切相关，也与计算、信息处理和通信所需组件的不断小型化密切相关。无线电的发展，以及后来的电视和第一台电子计算机的发展，都依赖于各种真空管的应用，从20世纪初的二极管和三极管开始。四十年后，我们对这些大型热玻璃组件的依赖反而成为电子计算发展的限制因素。

Of course, the advances of globalization were closely tied not only to the rising capacities and better performance of powerful prime movers but also to the relentless miniaturization of components needed for computing, information processing, and communication. The development of radio, and later of television and the first electronic computers, depended on deploying a variety of vacuum tubes, beginning with diodes and triodes during the first decade of the 20th century. Four decades later our reliance on these large assemblies of hot glass became a limiting factor for the development of electronic computing.

ENIAC是第一台电子通用数字计算机，它有17648个真空管，体积约为80立方米（（占地面积大约相当于两个羽毛球场），加上电源和冷却系统，它的重量约为30吨，频繁的运行中断是由于电子管的反复故障造成的，这些电子管需要几乎不间断的维护和更换。[62]第一批实用的晶体管——功能与玻璃封装器件相同的固态器件——在20世纪50年代初开始商业化。在50年代末之前，几位美国发明家（罗伯特·诺伊斯、杰克·基尔比、让·霍尔尼、库尔特·莱霍维克和穆罕默德·阿塔拉）的理念促成了第一批集成电路的诞生。集成电路将有源元件（晶体管）和无源元件（电容器、电阻器）构建并互连在一层薄薄的硅（一种半导体材料）上。这些电路可以执行任何指定的计算功能，它们最初的实际应用是在火箭和太空探索领域。[63]

ENIAC, the first electronic general-purpose digital computer, had 17,648 vacuum tubes, a volume of about 80 cubic meters (the footprint of roughly two badminton courts), with its power supply and cooling system it weighed about 30 tons, and its frequent operating interruptions were caused by recurrent failures of tubes that required near-constant maintenance and replacement.[62] The first practical transistors—solid-state devices performing the same functions as glass-enclosed devices—became commercially available during the early 1950s, and before the decade’s end the ideas of several American inventors (Robert Noyce, Jack Kilby, Jean Hoerni, Kurt Lehovec, and Mohamed Atalla) resulted in the production of the first integrated circuits, with active (transistors) and passive (capacitors, resistors) components built and interconnected on a thin layer of silicon (a semiconducting material). These circuits can perform any specified computing functions, and their first practical uses were in rockets and space exploration.[63]

下一个关键步骤是英特尔在1969年迈出的，当时它开始设计世界上第一个微处理器，将2000多个晶体管放置在单个硅片上，以执行一整套预定的功能：以英特尔的开创性4044为例，其目的是驱动一台小型日本电子计算器。[64] 4044奠定了英特尔在微芯片设计领域长达数十年的领先地位，并催生了第一批个人电脑（20世纪70年代末和80年代初相对昂贵、速度慢且笨重的台式电脑）以及从移动电话（20世纪80年代末的第一批昂贵设计）到笔记本电脑、平板电脑和智能手机等各种便携式电子产品。

The next critical step was taken by Intel in 1969 when it began to design the world’s first microprocessor, emplacing more than 2,000 transistors on a single silicon wafer in order to perform a complete set of prescribed functions: in the case of Intel’s pioneering 4044, it was to run a small Japanese electronic calculator.[64] The 4044 founded Intel’s decades-long prominence in microchip design that led to the first personal computers (the relatively expensive, slow and heavy desktops of the late 1970s and early 1980s) and portable electronics ranging from mobile phones (the first costly designs of the late 1980s) to laptops, tablets, and smartphones.

1950年至1973年间，世界各地几乎都经历了快速的经济增长：全球年均增长率和人均增长率几乎是1850年至1913年上一轮全球化浪潮的2.5倍，出口商品价值占世界经济生产总值的比例从1945年的略高于4%上升到1950年的9.6%，并在1974年达到约14%，与1913年的水平持平，但贸易量却增长了近十倍。[65]经济增长几乎遍及全球（1958年至1961年中国的大饥荒是影响最为深远的例外），但这一经济扩张黄金时代的成果——战后经济复苏，高增长率有助于减少经济不平等——却不成比例地集中在西方：1973年，北美和西欧国家占全球出口的60%以上。[66]随着西欧主要经济体（德国、英国、法国）和日本成为当时最具活力的贸易国，美国在世界贸易中的份额不可避免地逐渐被削弱。

The years between 1950 and 1973 were marked by rapid economic growth in virtually every part of the world: its global annual mean rate and its average per capita gains were nearly 2.5 times greater than during the previous globalization wave of 1850–1913, and the value of exported goods in the world economic product rose from a low of just over 4 percent in 1945 to 9.6 percent in 1950 and about 14 percent in 1974, equaling the 1913 share but with trade volume nearly ten times higher.[65] Economic growth was nearly universal (China’s Great Famine years of 1958–1961 were the most consequential exception) but the benefits of this golden age of economic expansion—the postwar rebound, with high rates of growth helping to decrease economic inequality—were disproportionately concentrated in the West: by 1973, North America and the countries of Western Europe accounted for more than 60 percent of global exports.[66] As the major Western European economies (Germany, UK, France) and Japan became the era’s most dynamic traders, inevitably America’s share in world trade gradually eroded.

尽管贸易不断扩张，西方国家的消费者也更容易获得种类繁多的进口商品，但国际旅行——无论是商务旅行还是休闲旅行——仍然相对有限，国际移民以及出国留学或短期工作的人数也同样如此。德国人不会乘飞机去泰国或夏威夷，而是开车去意大利海滩。美国移民人口的比例在第一次世界大战前曾达到近15%的峰值，但在1970年跌至不足5%的新低。[67]而当时人们普遍认为，受毛泽东领导的动荡局势影响，与世隔绝的中国会向美国大学输送大量学生，这简直是天方夜谭。

While trade was expanding and consumers in Western countries enjoyed greater access to a wider variety of imports, international travel—be it for business or leisure—remained relatively limited, as did international migration and the numbers of people studying or temporarily working abroad. Germans did not fly to Thailand or Hawaii; they drove to Italian beaches. The share of immigrants in the US population, which peaked at nearly 15 percent just before the First World War, reached a new low of less than 5 percent in 1970.[67] And the suggestion that China, cut off from the world by Mao-inspired convulsions, would send masses of students to American universities would have been seen as nothing but an improbable fiction.

然后（原因我在第一章中已阐述，我在那一章中追溯了现代文明对原油的依赖），战后有限但密集的全球化时期似乎已经结束。欧佩克推动的油价上涨导致全球化步履蹒跚、衰弱并逐渐衰退，但这种衰退并未波及所有经济部门——短短几年内，一系列有效的调整为新一轮全球化奠定了基础，而得益于新的政治格局，这轮全球化比以往任何一轮都走得更远。

And then (for reasons explained in the first chapter, where I traced modern civilization’s dependence on crude oil) it seemed that the postwar spell of limited but intensive globalization was over. OPEC-driven oil price increases caused globalization to falter, weaken, and recede, but this retreat did not affect all economic sectors—and in a matter of years a combination of effective adjustments laid foundations for a new round of globalization that, thanks to new political alignments, progressed further than any of the preceding waves.

中国、俄罗斯、印度进入印度市场

Enter China, Russia, India

这一次，扩张——一如既往地由技术因素推动——之所以如此迅猛，是因为在现代历史上，它第一次具备了如此强大的能力。到了20世纪60年代末，技术能力已经为前所未有的全球一体化做好了准备：能源供应充足，投资资金也源源不断，所需要的只是将全球化进程扩展到那些没有参与战后第一轮全球化的国家。最终，随着技术和金融手段的显著增强和强化，这一进程才得以启动。随着中国、俄罗斯和印度成为全球贸易、金融、旅游和人才流动的主要参与者，政治格局发生了根本性的逆转。

This time the expansion—enabled, as always, by technical factors—went so far because, for the first time in modern history, it could go that far. By the late 1960s, technical capabilities were ready for unprecedented global integration: energy supply was plentiful, there was no shortage of money to invest, and all that was needed was to extend the globalization process to the nations that did not participate in the first postwar round. This began, finally, when the technical and financial means became decisively augmented and potentiated by fundamental political reversals, as China, Russia, and India became major participants in global trade, finances, travel, and talent flows.

中国的逐步开放始于1972年尼克松访华，在1978年末（毛泽东逝世两年后）随着邓小平的崛起和期待已久的经济改革（事实上的农业私有化、工业现代化和部分回归私营企业）的启动而迎来决定性转折，并在2001年中国加入世界贸易组织（WTO）后加速发展。1972年，中国与美国没有贸易往来；1984年是美国对华商品贸易顺差的最后一年；2009年，中国成为世界最大的商品出口国；到2018年，中国出口额占全球出口总额的12%以上，对美贸易顺差一度接近4200亿美元，但在2019年由于中美两大经济体之间的紧张关系加剧，顺差下降了约18%。[68]但现在预测贸易会出现长期倒退或经济一体化程度会越来越高还为时过早。

The gradual opening of China began in 1972 with Richard Nixon’s visit to Beijing, took a decisive turn in late 1978 (two years after Mao Zedong’s death) with the rise of Deng Xiaoping and the launching of long-overdue economic reforms (the de facto privatization of farming, modernization of industry, and partial return to private enterprise), and accelerated after China joined the World Trade Organization (WTO) in 2001. In 1972, China had no trade with the US; 1984 was the last year the US had a surplus trading goods with Beijing; in 2009, China became the world’s largest exporter of goods; and by 2018 its exports accounted for more than 12 percent of all global sales, and its trade surplus with the US reached nearly $420 billion before declining by about 18 percent in 2019 due to rising tensions between the two economic superpowers.[68] But it is too early to forecast any long-term retreat in trade or return to ever-tighter economic integration.

经过数十年的冷战，苏联在20世纪80年代末开始解体。其卫星国率先脱离苏联（柏林墙于1989年11月9日倒塌），苏联于1991年12月26日正式解体。[69]历史上首次，所有主要经济体都有可能向外国投资开放（尽管开放程度不一，但在几乎所有情况下都是前所未有的），国际贸易因此而加剧。此前被禁止自由出国旅行的人们也加入了大规模旅游的行列，并利用新的机遇移民、短期工作和留学。贸易扩张是在世界贸易组织（WTO）提供的全球框架内进行的。[70]

After decades of the Cold War, the USSR began to unravel during the late 1980s. Its satellite states detached themselves first (the Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989), and the Soviet state was officially dissolved on December 26, 1991.[69] For the first time in history, it became possible for every major economy to become open (still to varying, but in nearly all cases unprecedented, degrees) to foreign investment, intensifying international trade, and populations previously forbidden to travel freely abroad joined mass-scale tourism and took advantage of new opportunities to emigrate and to temporarily work and study abroad. Trade expansion took place within a globally agreed framework provided by the WTO.[70]

印度由于其混乱的选举制度和多元民族政治，未能复制中国在1990年后凭借一党独大的统治实现的崛起，但其21世纪前二十年的人均GDP增长记录表明，印度已明显摆脱了此前几十年的低迷表现。1970年至1990年间，印度的人均GDP（按不变价格计算）实际上有六年出现下降，并有四年低于4%，而2000年至2019年间，印度的人均GDP……在过去的18年中，年增长率超过4%。[71]此外，自2008年以来，该国商品出口年增长率为5.3%，仅略低于中国的5.7%，而且印度软件工程师在硅谷的影响力（他们是该行业最重要的技术移民群体）远远超过了中国的贡献。[72]

India, with its messy electoral and multiethnic politics, has not been able to replicate China’s post-1990 rise driven by the unchallenged rule of a single party, but the record of its per capita GDP growth during the first two decades of the 21st century indicates a clear departure from the previous decades of poor performance. Between 1970 and 1990, the country’s per capita GDP (in constant monies) had actually declined in six separate years and stayed below 4 percent for four years, while between 2000 and 2019 there was an annual growth above 4 percent for 18 of those years.[71] Moreover, since 2008 the country’s annual growth of merchandise exports has been, at 5.3 percent, only slightly behind China’s 5.7 percent, and the impact of India’s software engineers in Silicon Valley (where they have been the single most important contingent of skilled immigrants in the industry) has been far above Chinese contributions.[72]

印度的崛起与国大党的边缘化不谋而合。国大党在1947年独立后统治印度数十年，而俄罗斯和中国则保留了许多中央集权的经济和社会控制特征。与新兴的民族主义国家俄罗斯不同，中国共产党仍然牢牢掌控着政权，但两国都允许（尽管存在一些明显的压制性例外）自由旅行，这催生了新一波的旅游热潮——俄罗斯人最喜爱的目的地是地中海沿岸国家；中国人则钟情于泰国、日本和欧洲——此外，前往西方，尤其是美国，的中国、印度和韩国留学生人数也空前高涨。

India’s rise has coincided with the marginalization of the Congress party that ruled the country for decades after it gained its independence in 1947, while both Russia and China have retained many attributes of central economic and social control. Unlike in the new, nationalist, Russia, the Communist Party remains in firm command in China, but both countries have allowed (with notable repressive exceptions) freedom of travel that has led to new waves of tourists—with favorite destinations being the Mediterranean countries for the Russians; Thailand, Japan, and Europe for the Chinese—and there has been an unprecedented influx of Chinese, Indian, and South Korean students to the West, above all to the US.

国际贸易占世界经济产出的比重从1973年的约30%上升到2008年的近61%，而贸易总量（按不变价格计算）增长了近六倍，其中大部分增长发生在1999年之后。[73] 2008-2009年的金融危机使贸易总量减少了十分之一，贸易占经济产出的比重在2009年下降了约15%，但到2018年，贸易总量比2008年的峰值高出35%，贸易占世界经济产出的比重回59%以上——2019年这些数据变化不大。外国直接投资（以每年的净流出量衡量）是全球化的另一个明显标志。1973年，全球外国直接投资总额不足300亿美元（约占全球经济产出的0.7%）；二十年后，这一数字增长到2560亿美元；但到 2007 年，这一数字飙升至 3.12 万亿美元（占全球生产总值的近 5.5%），短短 14 年内增长了 12 倍，其中亚洲（尤其是中国）是主要目的地。[74]

International trade’s share in the world economic product rose from about 30 percent in 1973 to nearly 61 percent in 2008, while the total volume of trade (in constant monies) increased almost exactly sixfold, with most of the rise taking place since 1999.[73] The financial crisis of 2008–2009 cut the total volume by a tenth and trade’s share of economic output by about 15 percent in 2009, but by 2018 overall trade was 35 percent above the 2008 peak and trade’s share of the world economic product was back above 59 percent—and the numbers changed little in 2019. Foreign direct investment (measured as net outflows per year) is another obvious marker of globalization. In 1973 its global total was less than $30 billion (about 0.7 percent of the global economic product); two decades later it rose to $256 billion; but by 2007 it soared to $3.12 trillion (nearly 5.5 percent of the global product), a 12-fold increase in just 14 years, with Asia (and above all China) as the main destination.[74]

一个俄罗斯团队通过综合所有关键指标来衡量2000年后全球化的进展——即分析货物贸易、服务贸易和双边外国直接投资存量（对中国尤为重要）的变化，以及移民（在中国不存在，但对美国经济至关重要）。[75]不出所料，结果显示，此前孤立的俄罗斯、其他前欧洲共产主义经济体和中国获益最大，印度、一些非洲国家和巴西也获益颇丰。此外，由于这些转变，到2017年，中国的全球联系度与日本持平；俄罗斯与瑞典不相上下；印度可以与新加坡相媲美。如果您对这些组合有任何疑问，请想想中国作为全球最大的消费品生产国的地位，俄罗斯巨大的能源和矿产出口，以及（前文已提及的）硅谷的印度软件工程师群体。

A Russian team measured the progress of post-2000 globalization by combining all key markers—that is by analyzing changes in the trade in goods, trade in services, and accumulated stocks of bilateral foreign direct investment (particularly important for China), and also migrants (nonexistent in China, but important for the American economy).[75] Not surprisingly, the results show the largest gains for previously isolated Russia, other former European communist economies, and China, and also for India, some African countries, and Brazil. Moreover, as a result of these shifts, by 2017 the global connectedness of China was as high as that of Japan; Russia’s rivaled that of Sweden; and India could be compared with Singapore. If any of these pairings strikes you as questionable, just think of China’s place as the largest manufacturer of consumer goods, of Russia’s enormous exports of energy and minerals, and of the (already noted) contingent of Indian software engineers in Silicon Valley.

全球化倍数

Globalization’s multiples

或许，要真正理解促成这场史无前例的全球化的技术进步，最好的方法就是用容量、评级、效率或性能的倍数来衡量。正如前文所述，这轮令人眼花缭乱的全球化浪潮的技术基础早在1973年之前就已奠定，但自那时起，其规模和强度的提升需要对原动机（交通运输领域的内燃机和电动机）以及关键基础设施（港口、机场、集装箱航运）进行巨额投资。因此，我们不仅拥有了更多此类设备，而且它们的平均容量（功率、体积、吞吐量）也更大，同时它们的典型效率和可靠性也得到了提高。那么，让我们来看看自20世纪70年代初以来，航运、航空、导航、计算机和通信领域取得了哪些进步。

Perhaps the best way to appreciate the technical advances that made this truly unprecedented globalization possible is to express their progress as multiples of their capacities, ratings, efficiencies, or performances. As already explained, the technical foundations for this dizzying round of globalization were laid before 1973, but its extent and intensity since then has demanded enormous investment in prime movers (combustion engines and electric motors in transportation) and in essential infrastructures (ports, airports, containerized shipping). As a result, we have not only more of them, but their average capacities (power, volume, throughput) have become larger, while their typical efficiencies and reliabilities have become better. So let’s look at the advances that have taken place in shipping, flying, navigating, computing, and communicating since the early 1970s.

1973年后的全球化使海上贸易规模增长了两倍多，并使其构成发生了重大变化。[76] 1973年，油轮运输（主要运输原油和成品油）占运输总量的一半以上，而到2018年，货物运输量约占70%。这一转变不仅反映了亚洲（尤其是中国）作为世界主要消费品来源地的崛起，也反映了整体一体化和相互依存程度的提高：德国汽车制造商在阿拉巴马州组装汽车，德克萨斯州生产的化学品（利用天然气开采热潮的优势）为欧盟工业提供原料，智利水果出口到四大洲，索马里骆驼运往沙特阿拉伯。

Post-1973 globalization has more than tripled the mass of seaborne trade and brought major shifts in its composition.[76] While in 1973 tanker traffic (dominated by crude oil and refined products) accounted for more than half of the transported total, in 2018 goods amounted to about 70 percent, a shift reflecting not only the rise of Asia—and, above all, China—as the world’s leading source of consumer goods, but the overall increase in integration and interdependence: German carmakers assemble vehicles in Alabama, Texas-made chemicals (taking advantage of the boom in the extraction of natural gas) provide feedstocks for EU industries, Chilean fruits are exported to four continents, and Somali camels are shipped to Saudi Arabia.

1973年至2019年间，船舶运输量增长了两倍，按载重吨计算，全球商船队的运力几乎增长了四倍。油轮的载重吨增长了三倍多，集装箱船的吨位增长了约4.5倍，全球集装箱船队的规模在45年间增长了近10倍，到2019年达到5152艘。这种数量级的增长伴随着集装箱运输业务向中国的大规模转移：1975年，中国没有集装箱运输业务，美国和日本的港口占据了全球近一半的份额；到2018年，中国（包括香港）的份额达到32%，而美国和日本的总份额不足10%。

This tripling of shipped mass between 1973 and 2019 required (when measured in deadweight tons) a near quadrupling of the global merchant fleet capacity. Deadweight tonnage of oil tankers slightly more than tripled, the tonnage of container ships increased about 4.5 times, and the size of the global container fleet expanded roughly 10-fold in 45 years to 5,152 ships in 2019. This order-of-magnitude increase was accompanied by a massive shift of container activity to China: in 1975, China had no container traffic and US and Japanese ports accounted for nearly half of the global activity; in 2018, China (including Hong Kong) held a 32 percent share, while the combined US and Japanese share was less than 10 percent.

至于船舶最大尺寸，1972年和1973年，马尔科姆·麦克莱恩（Malcolm McLean）建造了他最大的集装箱船，每艘船可装载1968个标准钢制集装箱（几乎是他1957年首批改装船舶的五倍）。1996年，“里贾纳·马士基”（Regina Maersk）号可装载6000个标准集装箱；到2008年，最大装载量达到13800个；2019年，地中海航运公司（Mediterranean Shipping Company）投入运营了六艘巨型船舶，每艘可装载23756个标准集装箱，因此，1973年至2019年间，船舶最大运力增长了12倍。[77]不可避免地，这种大规模的集装箱运输转型需要货运列车和公路运输进行相应的改造，如今，这些多式联运链将货物从中国内陆的某个城市运送到密苏里州沃尔玛的装货码头。

As for maximum ship sizes, in 1972 and 1973 Malcolm McLean launched his largest container vessels, each with a capacity of 1,968 standard steel containers (nearly five times larger than his first converted vessels in 1957). In 1996, Regina Maersk could load 6,000 standard units; by 2008 the maximum was 13,800; and in 2019 the Mediterranean Shipping Company put into service six giant vessels each able to carry 23,756 standard containers, hence a 12-fold increase of maximum vessel capacity between 1973 and 2019.[77] Inevitably, this mass-scale conversion to container shipping required the commensurate conversion of freight trains and truck transportation, and these intermodal chains now bring the goods from a city in China’s interior to the loading dock of a Walmart in Missouri.

当昂贵的食品或鲜花（例如从加拿大东部大西洋沿岸捕捞的新鲜金枪鱼运往东京；从肯尼亚运往伦敦的四季豆；从厄瓜多尔运往纽约的玫瑰）或高价值电子产品需要快速运输时，它们便会选择空运。每架客机的腹舱都用于运输货物，日益壮大的货机队也是如此：因此，1973年至2018年间，全球航空货运量（以吨公里计）增长了约12倍，而定期客运量则从约0.5万亿人公里增长至超过8.3万亿人公里，增长了近17倍。[78]最新统计数据显示，近三分之二（5.3万亿人公里）为国际航班。相当于每年运送近5亿人次往返于纽约和伦敦之间。

And when the shipment of expensive food or flowers (freshly caught tuna from Atlantic Canada to Tokyo; green beans from Kenya to London; roses from Ecuador to New York) or high-value electronics require speed, they go by air. The belly hold of every passenger airplane carries goods, as does the growing fleet of air freighters: as a result, between 1973 and 2018 global airfreight (expressed in ton-kilometers) rose about 12-fold, while scheduled passenger traffic rose from about 0.5 trillion to more than 8.3 trillion passenger-kilometers, nearly a 17-fold gain.[78] Nearly two-thirds (5.3 trillion passenger-kilometers) of the latest total were on international flights—the equivalent of flying nearly half a billion people a year from New York to London and back again.

国际游客在这些航班中所占的比例越来越高。20世纪70年代初，全球国际游客年总数（以美国人和西欧人为主）不足2亿人次；到2018年，这一数字创下14亿人次的新纪录。[79]欧洲仍然是主要的旅游目的地，占总入境人数的一半——其中法国、西班牙和意大利是欧洲大陆游客最多的国家。美国长期以来一直是旅游总支出最高的国家，但在2012年被中国超越，五年后，中国游客的消费额是美国游客的两倍。入境游客数量的突然激增以及他们不成比例地集中在几个主要城市（巴黎、威尼斯、巴塞罗那），引起了当地居民的抱怨，并促使政府开始采取措施限制每日或每年的游客数量。[80]

An increasing share of these flights is being taken by international tourists. In the early 1970s their annual global total (dominated by Americans and Western Europeans) was below 200 million; by 2018 the new record reached 1.4 billion.[79] Europe remains the main tourist destination, accounting for half of the total arrivals—with France, Spain, and Italy being the continent’s most visited countries. For generations the US led overall tourist expenditures, but it was surpassed by China in 2012 and five years later Chinese tourists were spending twice as much as Americans. The rather sudden multiplication of arrivals and their disproportionate concentration in several major cities (Paris, Venice, Barcelona) has led to complaints by their permanent residents and to the first moves to limit the numbers of daily or annual visitors.[80]

摩尔定律的深远影响

The long reach of Moore’s law

物料、产品和人员运输量的增加，以及新兴产业在无需大量库存的情况下及时交付物料或零部件的需求，得益于导航、跟踪、计算和通信技术的进步（并因此变得更加可靠），同时，为了应对海量的国际数据流，也需要大幅扩展的能力。所有这些进步都基于一个根本的技术基础：我们能够在集成电路上集成更多元件。集成电路的发展速度——大约每两年翻一番——迄今为止，与当时仙童半导体公司研究主管戈登·摩尔在1965年做出的预测相符。[81]

Increases in moving materials, products, and people, as well as the necessity of delivering materials or components just in time for new industries working without extensive inventories, were enabled (and made more reliable) by gains in navigation, tracking, computing, and communication, and much-expanded capabilities were also needed to accommodate the new deluge of international data flows. All of these advances have one fundamental technical foundation: our ability to emplace more components on an integrated circuit whose progress—doubling roughly every two years—has been, so far, conforming to the prediction made by Gordon Moore, at that time Fairchild Semiconductor’s director of research, in 1965.[81]

1969年，摩尔成为英特尔的联合创始人，（如前所述）1971年，该公司发布了其首款微处理器（微芯片），包含2300个元件。微处理​​器制造技术最终从大规模集成电路（最多10万个元件）发展到超大规模集成电路（VLSI，最多1000万个元件），再到超大规模集成电路（ULSI，最多10亿个元件）。[82] 10 5 1982 年，晶体管数量达到了 10 万个。1996 年，为了庆祝 ENIAC 诞生 50 周年，宾夕法尼亚大学的一群学生将 174,569 个晶体管安装在一块 7.4 毫米 × 5.3 毫米的硅微芯片上，重新制造了 ENIAC：原版机器的重量是它的 500 多万倍，耗电量是它的 4 万倍，而重新制造的芯片速度是原来的 500 倍。[83]

In 1969, Moore became Intel’s co-founder, and (as already noted) in 1971 the company released its first microprocessor (microchip), with 2,300 components. Microprocessor fabrication had eventually advanced from large-scale integration (up to 100,000 components) to very large-scale integration (VLSI, up to 10 million components), and to ultra large-scale integration (ULSI, up to a billion components).[82] The 105 mark (100,000 transistors) was reached in 1982, and in 1996, to celebrate the machine’s 50th anniversary, a group of students at the University of Pennsylvania recreated ENIAC by putting 174,569 transistors on a 7.4 mm × 5.3 mm silicon microchip: the original machine was more than 5 million times heavier, it required about 40,000 times more electricity, and the recreated chip was 500 times faster.[83]

这一进步仍在继续：2003年突破了10⁸大关，2010年突破了10⁹大关，到2019年底，AMD发布了拥有395亿个晶体管的Epyc CPU。[84]这意味着从1971年到2019年，微处理器的性能提升了七个数量级——确切地说是171亿倍。这些进步足以满足海量数据传输（来自地球观测、间谍和通信卫星，以及金融中心和数据存储之间的数据传输）、即时电子邮件和语音通话以及高精度导航等新需求。

And the progress continued: the 108 mark was surpassed in 2003, 109 in 2010, and by the end of 2019 AMD released its Epyc CPU with 39.5 billion transistors.[84] This means that between 1971 and 2019 microprocessor power increased by seven orders of magnitude—17.1 billion times, to be exact. These advances were more than enough to accommodate new demands for massive data transfers (from Earth observation, spy and communication satellites, and among financial centers and data storages), instant e-mail and voice calls and highly accurate navigation.

最后一项能力得益于雷达探测技术的进步，以及全球定位系统（GPS）的建立、后续扩展和改进：第一个（美国）系统于1993年全面投入运行，随后又有三个系统（俄罗斯的GLONASS、欧盟的伽利略和中国的北斗）相继投入使用。[85]因此，现在任何拥有电脑或手机的人都可以实时查看全球航运和航空活动，只需点击MarineTraffic网站，即可观看货船（绿色图标）汇聚上海和香港，排队等待通过巴厘岛和龙目岛之间的海域，或驶入英吉利海峡；可以看到油轮（红色）从波斯湾驶出，拖船和特种船只（青绿色）为北海的石油和天然气生产钻井平台提供服务，以及渔船（浅棕色）在中太平洋作业（还有许多其他船只未显示在屏幕上，因为它们在非法捕鱼时会关闭应答器）。[86]

That last capability has benefited from advances in radar detection and by the setting up and subsequent expansion and improvement of global positioning systems (GPS): the first (American) system was fully operational in 1993, and three other systems (Russia’s GLONASS, EU’s Galileo, China’s BeiDou) followed.[85] As a result, everybody with a computer or a mobile phone can now see worldwide shipping and aviation activities in real time, just by clicking on the MarineTraffic website and watching cargo vessels (green icons) converging on Shanghai and Hong Kong, lining up to pass between Bali and Lombok, or going up the English Channel; to see tankers (red) debouching from the Persian Gulf, tugs and special craft (turquoise) serving the oil and gas production rigs in the North Sea, and fishing vessels (light brown) roaming the central Pacific (and there are many more ships there and elsewhere that do not show on the screen, because, while fishing illegally, they turn off their transponders).[86]

与之类似且同样引人入胜的是，只需点击一下鼠标即可监控所有商业航班。[87]欧洲清晨，可以看到一长串错落有致的航班在夜间飞越大西洋后，从北美和南美抵达欧洲大陆；北美傍晚，可以看到长长的喷气式客机队伍沿着最佳航线飞往欧洲；跨太平洋航班飞往日本的飞机在东京时间傍晚时分会汇聚于成田机场和羽田机场。此外，航班跟踪技术可以追踪不断变化的航线，这些航线会考虑喷射气流位置的频繁变化。[88]较少见的航线调整则是由大型气旋的移动或火山喷发产生的火山灰云引起的。[89]

Analogical, and no less fascinating, is the click-away opportunity to monitor all commercial flights.[87] Early morning in Europe shows a long arc of staggered flights approaching the continent after crossing the Atlantic during the night from North and South America; evenings in North America show the long streams of jetliners following the optimal flight paths to Europe; transpacific flights to Japan converge on Narita and Haneda during late afternoons and early evenings Tokyo time. Moreover, flight tracking makes it possible to trace changing flight paths that take into account the frequently shifting position of the jet stream.[88] Less frequent flight-path adjustments are caused by the progress of major cyclones, or by ash clouds emitted by volcanic eruptions.[89]

不可避免的挫折、挫折和过度扩张

Inevitability, setbacks, and overreach

全球化的历史揭示了一个不容否认的长期趋势，即国际经济一体化程度不断加深，这体现在能源、物资、人员、思想和信息流动的日益频繁，而技术能力的提升则为其提供了支持。这一进程并非新生事物，但正是得益于1850年以后的诸多创新，它才得以达到如今的强度和范围。然而，正如过去的一些挫折所表明的那样，这些技术进步并不能保证持续发展：最显著的例子是，20世纪上半叶经济全球化进程出​​现了显著的倒退，随之而来的人口国际流动也大幅减少。造成这种倒退的原因显而易见，因为那几十年间发生了一系列前所未有的重大灾难，各国命运也发生了翻天覆地的变化。

The history of globalization reveals an undeniable long-term trend toward greater international economic integration that is manifested by intensified flows of energies, materials, people, ideas, and information, and that is enabled by improving technical capabilities. The process is not new, but only thanks to many post-1850 innovations could it have reached its recent intensity and extent. But, as some past setbacks indicate, these technical advances do not make continued progress inevitable: most notably, the first half of the 20th century saw a significant retreat from economic globalization and hence also from the accompanying international movement of people. The reasons for this retreat are obvious, as the decades were marked by an unprecedented concatenation of large-scale tragedies and reversals of national fortunes.

这份清单仅限于关键事件，包括：清朝灭亡（1912年），中国最后一个封建王朝；第一次世界大战（1914-1918年）；沙皇俄国灭亡，布尔什维克掌权，随后爆发多年内战，最终建立苏联（1917-1921年）；奥斯曼帝国解体（1923年最终解体）；20世纪20年代战后欧洲的政治动荡；1929年10月下旬的股市崩盘；随后持续到20世纪30年代大部分时间的全球经济危机；日本入侵满洲（1931年），另一场大战的真正开端；纳粹德国夺取政权（1933年）；西班牙内战（1936-1939年）；第二次世界大战（1939-1945年）。中国再次爆发内战（1945-1949年）；冷战开始（1947年）；以及毛泽东宣布中华人民共和国成立（1949年）。经济全球化的退步幅度很大。贸易占全球GDP的比重从1913年的约14%下降到1939年的约6%，再到1945年下降到仅4%。[90]

The list, limited to the key events, includes the end of the Qing, China’s last imperial dynasty (1912); the First World War (1914–1918); the end of Czarist Russia, when the Bolsheviks took power and years of civil war followed, ending with the establishment of the USSR (1917–1921); the unraveling of the Ottoman Empire (final dissolution by 1923); the political instability in Europe of the postwar 1920s; the stock market collapse in late October 1929; the subsequent worldwide economic crises that lasted for most of the 1930s; Japan’s invasion of Manchuria (1931), the true beginning of another great war; the Nazi takeover of Germany (1933); the Spanish civil war (1936–1939); the Second World War (1939–1945); the renewed civil war in China (1945–1949); the beginning of the Cold War (1947); and Mao’s proclamation of the People’s Republic of China (1949). The retreat of economic globalization was substantial. The share of trade in global GDP fell from about 14 percent in 1913 to about 6 percent in 1939 and then to only 4 percent in 1945.[90]

1990年后全球化进程的加速并非仅仅依赖于先进的技术手段；如果没有同时发生的重大政治和社会变革，全球化是不可能实现的，其中最显著的是1980年后中国重返国际贸易舞台，以及随后（1989年至1991年间）苏联解体。这意味着，21世纪头二十年所达到的高度全球化并非必然，未来的发展可能会削弱全球化。至于这种削弱的程度（是轻微的还是显著的）以及速度（是由于大国对抗而迅速，还是由于代际因素而逐渐减弱），目前尚无法预测。

And the accelerated post-1990 pace of globalization did not depend on just having superior technical means; it would have been impossible without concurrent major political and social transformations, most notably the post-1980 return of China to international commerce, followed (between 1989 and 1991) by the dismantling of the Soviet Empire. This means that the high degree of globalization reached during the first two decades of the 21st century has not been inevitable, and that it can be weakened by future developments. To what extent (marginally or substantially) and how rapidly (fast due to major power confrontations, gradually as a generational affair) is impossible to foresee.

许多事情似乎已成定局。大量累积的全球化成果，尤其是过去两代人经历的诸多变革，都将长期存在。如今，太多国家依赖食品进口，即使是最大的国家也无法实现所有原材料的自给自足，因为没有哪个国家拥有其经济所需的所有矿产资源。英国和日本的食品进口量超过了其产量，中国高炉所需的铁矿石供应不足，美国进口大量稀土金属（从镧到钇），而印度长期面临原油短缺。[91]大规模生产的固有优势使得企业无法在每个销售手机的城市都进行手机组装。数以百万计的人仍然会在有生之年努力探访那些标志性的遥远景点。[92]此外，立即逆转是不切实际的，而快速的变革也必将付出高昂的代价。例如，如果深圳突然停止作为全球最重要的便携式设备制造中心的功能，全球消费电子产品的供应将遭受巨大损失。

Much seems to be firmly set in place. A great deal of accreted globalization, especially many changes that unfolded during the past two generations, is here to stay. Too many countries now rely on food imports, and self-sufficiency in all raw materials is impossible even for the largest countries because no country possesses sufficient reserves of all minerals needed by its economy. The UK and Japan import more food than they produce, China does not have all the iron ore it needs for its blast furnaces, the US buys many rare earth metals (from lanthanum to yttrium), and India is chronically short of crude oil.[91] The inherent advantages of mass-scale manufacturing preclude companies from assembling mobile phones in every city in which they are purchased. And millions of people will still try to see iconic distant places before they die.[92] Moreover, instant reversals are not practical, and rapid disruptions could come only with high costs attached. For example, the global supply of consumer electronics would suffer enormously if Shenzhen suddenly ceased to function as the world’s most important manufacturing hub of portable devices.

但历史提醒我们，目前的状况不太可能持续数代人。英国和美国的工业在20世纪70年代初还是全球领先者。但如今伯明翰的金属加工厂或巴尔的摩的炼钢炉在哪里？曼彻斯特或南卡罗来纳州的大型棉纺厂又在哪里？1965年，底特律三大汽车制造商仍占据美国汽车市场90%的份额；如今，它们的份额甚至不足45%。1980年之前，深圳还是个小渔村，后来成为中国第一个经济特区，如今已发展成为拥有超过1200万人口的特大城市：到2050年，它又将扮演怎样的角色？大规模、快速地从当前状态倒退是不可能的，但支持全球化的情绪已经减弱了一段时间。

But history reminds us that the recent state of things is unlikely to last for generations. British and American industries were the global leaders as recently as the early 1970s. But where are Birmingham’s metal-working factories or Baltimore’s steel furnaces now? Where are the great cotton mills of Manchester or of South Carolina? By 1965, Detroit’s big three still had 90 percent of the US car market; now they do not have even 45 percent. Until 1980, Shenzhen was a small fishing village, when it became China’s first special economic zone, and now it is a megacity with more than 12 million people: what role will it play in 2050? A mass-scale, rapid retreat from the current state is impossible, but the pro-globalization sentiment has been weakening for some time.

北美、欧洲和日本加速去工业化，以及制造业向亚洲（尤其是中国）的转移，是促成这种重新评估的主要原因。[93]这种制造业转移带来了从荒谬到悲剧的各种变化。前者包括一些令人匪夷所思的交易，例如加拿大——一个拥有比任何其他富裕国家都多的人均森林资源的国家——竟然从中国进口牙签和卫生纸，而中国的木材储量仅占加拿大广袤北方森林遗产的一小部分。[94]但这种转移也造成了一些悲剧，例如美国白人非大学学历男性中年死亡率的上升。毫无疑问，2000 年后美国失去了约 700 万个（以前收入颇丰的）制造业工作岗位——其中大部分损失归因于全球化，因为大部分生产转移到了中国——是造成这些绝望死亡的主要原因，这些死亡大多归因于自杀、药物过量和酒精引起的肝病。[95]

The accelerated deindustrialization of North America, Europe, and Japan, and the shift of manufacturing to Asia in general and to China in particular, has been the leading reason for this reappraisal.[93] This manufacturing switch has brought changes ranging from risible to tragic. In the first category are such grotesque transactions as Canada, the country with per capita forest resources greater than in any other affluent nation, importing toothpicks and toilet paper from China, a country whose wood stocks amount to a small fraction of Canada’s enormous boreal forest patrimony.[94] But the switch has also contributed to tragedies, such as the rising midlife mortality among America’s white non-university-educated men. There can be no doubt that America’s post-2000 loss of some 7 million (formerly well-paying) manufacturing jobs—with most of that loss attributable to globalization, as most of that production moved to China—has been the principal reason of these deaths of despair, largely attributable to suicide, drug overdose, and alcohol-induced liver disease.[95]

现在，我们有了确凿的量化数据证实，全球化在2000年代中期确实迎来了一个转折点。这一发展很快被2008年的全球衰退所掩盖，但麦肯锡对1995年至2017年间43个国家23条行业价值链（从设计到零售，最终交付产品的相互关联的活动）的分析表明，商品生产价值链（尽管绝对增长速度仍然缓慢）的贸易密集度已显著降低，出口占总产出的比例从2007年的28.1%下降到2017年的22.5%。[96]我认为这项研究的第二大重要发现是，与普遍认知相反，目前全球商品贸易中只有约18%是由较低的劳动力成本（劳动力套利）驱动的，而且在许多价值链中，这一比例在整个2010年代都在下降，全球价值链正在发生变化。产业链正变得越来越知识密集，越来越依赖高技能劳动力。同样，经合组织的一项研究表明，全球价值链的扩张在 2011 年停止，此后略有下降：中间产品和服务的贸易量有所减少。[97]

And we now have solid quantitative confirmation that globalization did reach a turning point in the mid-2000s. This development was soon obscured by the Great Recession of 2008, but McKinsey’s analysis of 23 industry value chains (interconnected activities, from design to retail, that deliver final products) spanning 43 countries between 1995 to 2017 shows that goods-producing value chains (still growing slowly in absolute terms) have become significantly less trade-intensive, with exports declining from 28.1 percent of gross output in 2007 to 22.5 percent in 2017.[96] What I see to be the study’s second-most important finding is that, contrary to common perception, only about 18 percent of the global goods trade is now driven by lower labor costs (labor arbitrage), that in many chains this share has been declining throughout the 2010s, and that global value chains are becoming more knowledge-intensive and rely increasingly on highly skilled labor. Similarly, an OECD study shows that the expansion of global value chains stopped in 2011 and since then has slightly declined: there has been less trade in intermediate goods and services.[97]

此外，人们还担忧全球化会对国家主权、文化和语言造成影响（无论这种担忧是合理的还是夸大的，是深思熟虑的还是煽动性的）；担忧商业普适性会稀释珍贵的文化特色（这种担忧涵盖了从美国快餐连锁店的无处不在到社交媒体几乎不受制约的权力等方方面面）；而且，与全球化承诺的益处相反，人们也担忧全球化会加剧经济和社会不平等。即使只是对这些真实存在和人们臆想的负面影响进行较为克制的评估，也足以证实其弊端之多，足以让人质疑未来是否应该进一步加强全球化进程。而2020年的新冠疫情更是强化了这种担忧。

Add to this the (justified or exaggerated, thoughtful or demagogic) fears about globalization’s impact on national sovereignty, culture, and language; about diluting cherished peculiarities in the solvent of commercial universality (with concerns ranging from the ubiquity of American fast-food chains to the essentially unchecked power of social media); and, contrary to promised benefits, worries about globalization’s role in economic and social inequality. Even a restrained appraisal of these real and perceived negatives confirms enough downsides to question any future intensification of the process, and in 2020 COVID-19 reinforced such sentiments.

为了增强韧性并减少意外中断，将多种制造业迁回国内的呼声由来已久。自20世纪90年代以来，全球化进程和跨国公司的行为就一直备受质疑和批评，而近年来，这些情绪在一些国家，尤其是英国和美国，更是成为选举不满情绪的一部分。[98]但随着新冠疫情的蔓延，一系列机构开始发布分析报告，呼吁重组全球供应链。经合组织研究了构建更具韧性的生产网络的政策选项，这些网络将减少对远距离进口的依赖，并能更好地抵御全球贸易中断。联合国贸易和发展会议则考虑将制造业从亚洲迁回北美和欧洲，并转向更短、更集中的价值链——从设计、制造到分销都在同一国家或单一经济体内完成——从而提高附加值的集中度。瑞士再保险公司发布了一份关于降低全球供应链风险（重新平衡供应链以增强其韧性）的报告。布鲁金斯学会则认为，将先进制造业迁回国内是创造优质就业机会的最佳途径。[99]

Arguments for reshoring many kinds of manufacturing in order to gain greater resilience and reduce unexpected disruptions are not new. The progress of globalization and the actions of multinational companies have been questioned and criticized since the 1990s and, more recently, these sentiments became part of electoral discontent in some countries, most notably in the UK and the US.[98] But as the COVID-19 pandemic unfolded, a remarkable lineup of institutions began to publish analyses and appeals for the reorganization of global supply chains. The OECD looked at the policy options to build more resilient production networks that would rely less on imports from distant places and that could better withstand global trade interruptions. The United Nations Conference on Trade and Development considered repatriating manufacturing from Asia to North America and Europe and a shift to shorter, less fragmented value chains—extending from design through manufacturing to distribution within a single country or a single economic unit—that would produce a higher concentration of value added. Swiss Re produced a report about the de-risking of global supply chains (rebalancing them to strengthen resilience). And the Brookings Institution saw the reshoring of advanced manufacturing as the best way to create good jobs.[99]

对全球化的质疑和批判已经超越了狭隘的意识形态争论，而新冠疫情则提供了更多契机。基于对国家在保护公民生命方面所扮演的根本角色的无可辩驳的担忧，还有其他强有力的论点。当全球70%的橡胶手套产自同一家工厂，并且其他个人防护装备，乃至主要药品成分和常用药物（如抗生素、降压药）的类似甚至更高比例的供应都来自中国和印度的少数供应商时，国家就难以履行这一职责。[100]这种依赖或许能满足经济学家以尽可能低的单位成本实现大规模生产的梦想，但当医生和护士不得不面对缺乏足够个人防护装备的疫情，当依赖外国生产的国家为了有限的物资而展开令人沮丧的竞争，当世界各地的患者因为亚洲工厂的减产或关闭而无法续开处方时，这种依赖就构成了极其不负责任——甚至可以说是犯罪——的治理。

Questioning and criticizing globalization has gone beyond narrowly ideological arguments, and the COVID-19 pandemic provided additional powerful arguments based on irrefutable concerns about the state’s fundamental role in protecting the lives of its citizens. That role is hard to play when 70 percent of the world’s rubber gloves are made in a single factory, and when similar or even higher shares of not just other pieces of personal protective equipment but also of principal drug components and common medications (antibiotics, antihypertensive drugs) come from a very small number of suppliers in China and India.[100] Such dependence might fulfill an economist’s dream of mass output at the lowest possible unit cost, but it makes for extremely irresponsible—if not criminal—governance when doctors and nurses have to face a pandemic without adequate PPE, when states dependent on foreign production engage in dismaying competition for limited supplies, and when patients around the world cannot renew their prescriptions because of the slowdowns or closures in Asian factories.

过度全球化带来的安全隐患远不止于医疗保健领域。美国大量进口中国大型变压器引发了人们对备件供应以及未来电网稳定性的担忧，而西方国家禁止华为参与5G网络建设的禁令也无需赘述。[101]不出所料，制造业回流可能是未来的发展趋势，无论是在北美还是欧洲：2020年的一项调查显示，64%的美国制造商表示，疫情过后他们可能会将生产迁回国内。[102]

And security concerns created by excessive globalization go far beyond the health-care sector. Rising US imports of large Chinese transformers create worries about the availability of spare parts and about the potential for future grid destabilization, and there is little need to repeat the arguments about the much-publicized ban on Huawei’s participation in the 5G networks of some Western nations.[101] Not surprisingly, the reshoring of manufacturing could be the wave of the future, both in North America and in Europe: a 2020 survey showed that 64 percent of American manufacturers said that reshoring is likely following the pandemic.[102]

这种趋势会持续吗？我一直强调，我不做预测，因此不会提供任何关于全球化总体水平（包括制造业产能回流）是否会恢复到新冠疫情前水平的具体数字。我只是尝试评估最有可能出现的结果范围。虽然近年来全球化的大多数方面似乎不太可能再创佳绩，但在2020年，这种观点变得完全司空见惯：我们或许已经见证了全球化的顶峰，而它的衰退期可能不仅会持续数年，甚至会持续数十年。

Will this sentiment persist? As I never fail to stress, I do not forecast, and hence I am not offering any specific numbers concerning the retreat or continuation of the pre-COVID levels of globalization in general, or of the reshoring of manufacturing capacities in particular. I just try to appraise the range of the most likely outcomes, and while in recent years it has looked increasingly as if most aspects of globalization will not soar to new highs, in 2020 this notion became entirely unexceptional: we may have seen the peak of globalization, and its ebb may last not just for years but for decades to come.

5. 了解风险

5. Understanding Risks

从病毒到饮食再到太阳耀斑

From Viruses to Diets to Solar Flares

描述现代文明进步的一种简洁概括的方式是，将其视为一系列旨在降低风险的探索。这些风险源于我们作为复杂而脆弱的有机体，在充满危险的世界中艰难求生。前几章已记录了我们在这一探索中取得的成功。更高的作物产量改善了粮食供应，降低了粮食成本，并减少了营养不良、发育迟缓以及由营养不足引起的儿童疾病的风险。尤其值得注意的是，粮食生产的扩大、广泛的粮食贸易以及紧急粮食援助的结合，消除了长期以来反复发生的饥荒的必然性。[1]

One sweeping, simplifying way to describe the advances of modern civilization is to see them as serial quests to reduce the risks that come from us being complex and fragile organisms trying to survive against many odds in a world abounding with dangers. The previous chapters have documented how successful we have been in this quest. Higher crop yields have improved food supply, lowered its costs, and reduced the risks of malnutrition, stunting, and childhood diseases stemming from undernutrition. Most notably, the combination of expanded food production, extensive food trade, and emergency food aid have eliminated the long-standing inevitability of recurrent famines.[1]

更好的住房条件（更大的空间、自来水和热水、中央供暖）、更好的卫生条件（最重要的改进莫过于提供更多肥皂和更频繁地洗手）以及更好的公共卫生措施（从大规模疫苗接种到食品安全监管）提高了家庭舒适度，降低了因饮用水污染而感染的风险，减少了食源性病原体的出现频率，并基本消除了燃木炉一氧化碳中毒的危险。[2]各种工程技术的进步和公共安全措施减少了工业和交通事故。如果没有汽车设计和防护功能的改进（例如防止侧面碰撞的防撞杆、安全带、安全气囊、位于驾驶员视线高度的刹车灯，以及日益普及的自动刹车和车道偏离修正系统），汽车事故（目前每年死亡人数超过120万）的死亡率将会更高，因为这些改进降低了碰撞和严重受伤的风险。[3]

Better housing (more space, running and hot water, central heating), better hygiene (no single improvement being more important than more soap and the more frequent washing of hands), and better public health measures (ranging from mass-scale vaccinations to food safety oversight) have improved domestic comfort, reduced the risks of infections spread from contaminated water, cut the frequency of foodborne pathogens, and largely eliminated the dangers of carbon monoxide poisoning from wood-fired stoves.[2] Various engineering advances and public safety measures reduced industrial and transportation accidents. Car accidents (with fatalities now in excess of 1.2 million a year) would be much more deadly without the improvements in car design and protective features (anti-intrusion bars guarding against side impacts, seat belts, airbags, brake lights at the driver’s eye level, and, increasingly, automatic braking and lane-departure correction) that have cut the risks of collision and serious injury.[3]

国际条约制定了透明的规则，以促进可靠性和安全性（例如降低进口受污染产品的风险）。（例如，追究将儿童绑架到其他国家的父母的责任）以及使令人遗憾的事件受到法律制裁（例如，追究将儿童绑架到其他国家的父母的责任）。[4]尽管媒体报道给人留下了这样的印象，但几十年来，全球暴力冲突的频率及其造成的伤亡总数一直在下降。[5]但考虑到我们身体的复杂性、自然过程的巨大性和不可预测性，以及在设计和操作复杂机器时不可能完全消除人为错误，现代世界风险依然层出不穷也就不足为奇了。

International treaties set down transparent rules that promote reliability and safety (such as reducing the risks of importing contaminated goods) and that make regrettable events subject to legal action (such as pursuing a parent who abducted a child to another country).[4] And despite the impression created by media reporting, the worldwide frequency of violent conflicts and the total number of their casualties have been declining for decades.[5] But given the complexity of our bodies, the enormity and unpredictability of natural processes, and the impossibility of eradicating all human errors made when designing intricate machines and when operating them, it is not at all surprising that risks continue to abound in the modern world.

即使是那些不刻意获取信息的人，也经常接触到媒体报道的人为和自然灾害，以及饮食、疾病和日常活动带来的风险。第一类风险涵盖范围广泛，从令人恐惧的恐怖袭击到各种形式的化学恐惧症（从食物中的农药残留到玩具或地毯中的致癌物），从墙壁和婴儿爽身粉中隐藏的石棉到人为造成的全球变暖对地球的破坏。[6]媒体报道不会错过任何自然灾害的消息——包括飓风、龙卷风、洪水、干旱和蝗灾——与此同时，人们也持续担忧不治之症和难以预测的病毒，最近对SARS-CoV-1和埃博拉病毒的担忧仅仅是COVID-19（SARS-CoV-2）大流行带来的痛苦的轻微预演。[7]

Even people who take no particular steps to be well informed are routinely exposed to media reports of man-made and natural dangers and the risks of diets, diseases, and quotidian activities. The first category ranges from dreaded terrorist attacks to many manifestations of chemophobia (from pesticide residues in food to carcinogens in toys or carpets), and from asbestos hidden in walls and in baby powder to the planet being ruined by anthropogenic global warming.[6] Media reports do not miss any news of natural catastrophes—including hurricanes, tornadoes, floods, droughts, and locusts—and in the background there are lasting worries about incurable cancers and unpredictable viruses, with recent concerns about SARS-CoV-1 and Ebola just mild previews of the anguish brought by the COVID-19 (SARS-CoV-2) pandemic.[7]

这份清单很容易扩展，还可以加上对疯牛病（牛海绵状脑病）、沙门氏菌或大肠杆菌感染、医院微生物感染、手机非电离辐射、网络安全和数据盗窃、人工智能设计或基因工程生物失控、核导弹意外发射以及未被观测到的小行星撞击地球的担忧。列举这些风险，我们很容易得出结论：我们现在面临的风险比以往任何时候都多——或者，相反地，对这些事件或其可能性的不断（且夸大其词的）报道，只是让我们更加意识到它们的存在，而正确的风险认知可以提供一些令人安心的视角。而这正是我将在本章中探讨的内容。没错，世界充满了持续或偶发的风险，但也充斥着错误的认知和非理性的风险评估。造成这些误解和误判的原因有很多，风险分析从业者已经发表了关于这些误解和误判的起源、普遍性和持久性的揭示性研究结果。[8]
