We were unprepared—to a degree even those of us who expected major problems found surprising—for an event whose near-imminent occurrence could have been forecast with 100 percent certainty: in 2008 I did so unequivocally in my book on global catastrophes and trends, getting even the timing right.[72] Although we almost immediately identified the full genetic makeup of this new pathogen, national public policy responses to its spread ranged from largely business as usual (Sweden) to draconian (but belated) countrywide shutdowns (Italy, Spain), and from early dismissals (the US in February 2020) to early successes that turned into later problems (Singapore).[73]

然而，从根本上讲，这是一种自我限制的自然现象，自20世纪50年代末以来，我们已经在全球范围内经历了三次：即使没有任何疫苗，每一次病毒大流行最终都会消退，只要病原体感染了相对大量的人群，或者变异成毒性较弱的毒株。相比之下，全球气候变化是一个极其复杂的发展过程，其最终结果取决于许多自然和人为过程之间远未被完全理解的相互作用。因此，在未来几十年里，我们需要更多的观测、更多的研究以及更完善的气候模型，才能更准确地评估长期趋势和最可能的结果。

And yet, fundamentally, this is a self-limiting natural phenomenon that we have experienced on a global scale three times since the late 1950s: even without any vaccines, every viral pandemic eventually subsides once the pathogen infects relatively large numbers of people or once it mutates into a less virulent form. In contrast, global climate change is an extraordinarily complex development whose eventual outcome depends on far-from-perfectly understood interactions of many natural and anthropogenic processes. As a result, we will need, for decades to come, more observations, more studies, and far better climate models in order to get more accurate appraisals of long-term trends and of the most likely outcomes.

认为我们对这些动态的、多因素现实的理解已经臻于完美，就好比把全球变暖的科学误认为气候变化的宗教。同时，我们也不需要源源不断的新模型来采取有效行动。在建筑、交通、工业和农业领域，我们都有巨大的节能减排机会，而且无论当时是否担忧全球变暖，我们都应该在几十年前就开始实施一些节能减排措施。我们致力于避免不必要的能源消耗，减少空气污染和水污染，提供更舒适的生活条件，应该是长期的当务之急，而不是为了防止灾难而采取的突然的绝望行动。

To believe that our understanding of these dynamic, multifactorial realities has reached the state of perfection is to mistake the science of global warming for the religion of climate change. At the same time, we do not need an endless stream of new models in order to take effective actions. There are enormous opportunities for reducing energy use in buildings, transportation, industry, and agriculture, and we should have initiated some of these energy-saving and emissions-reducing measures decades ago, regardless of any concerns about global warming. Quests to avoid unnecessary energy use, to reduce air pollution and water, and to provide more comfortable living conditions should be perennial imperatives, not sudden desperate actions aimed at preventing a catastrophe.

最令人震惊的是，我们基本上忽略了那些本可以限制气候变化长期影响的措施，而这些措施即便在没有任何全球变暖担忧的情况下也应该采取，因为它们能带来长期的节能效益，并提升生活品质。不仅如此，我们还刻意引入并推广了新的能源转换技术，这反而加剧了化石能源的消耗，从而进一步加剧了二氧化碳排放。这些疏忽和失误的最佳例证，莫过于寒冷气候国家不合理的建筑规范以及SUV在全球范围内的普及。

Most remarkably, we have largely ignored taking steps that could have limited the long-term impacts of climate change and that should have been taken even in the absence of any global warming concerns because they bring long-term savings and provide more comfort. And as if that were not enough, we have deliberately introduced and promoted the diffusion of new energy conversions that have boosted the consumption of fossil energies and hence further intensified CO2 emissions. The best examples of these omissions and commissions are the indefensibly inadequate building codes in cold-climate countries and the worldwide adoption of SUVs.

由于我们的房屋寿命很长（一栋建造精良、维护得当的北美木结构房屋，如果拥有混凝土基础，可以屹立超过100年），因此，如果墙体隔热良好、窗户采用三层玻璃、并配备高效节能的供暖炉，就能为长期节能（从而减少碳排放）提供独特的机会。[74] 1973年，当欧佩克将原油世界价格提高五倍时，欧洲、北美和中国北方的大多数建筑都只有单层玻璃窗；在加拿大，三层玻璃窗要到2030年才会强制安装，而曼尼托巴省在2009年成为加拿大第一个强制要求使用高效（效率>90%）天然气供暖炉的省份，而这种供暖炉早在几十年前就已经商业化了。[75]想知道有多少来自寒冷地区的全球变暖会议代表家中安装了填充惰性气体的三层玻璃窗、超隔热墙和效率高达97%的燃气炉，岂不是很有意思吗？打个比方，在炎热气候地区，有多少人拥有密封良好的房间，以至于他们安装不当、效率低下的窗式空调不会浪费冷气？

Because our houses are around for a long time (a well-built, properly maintained wood-frame North American house with a concrete foundation can last for more than 100 years), with proper wall insulation, triple window panes, and highly efficient heating furnaces they represent a unique opportunity for long-lasting energy (and hence carbon emissions) savings.[74] In 1973, when OPEC quintupled the world price of crude oil, most buildings in Europe, North America, and North China had just single-pane windows; in Canada triple panes will not be mandated before 2030, and Manitoba was the first province to require high-efficiency (>90 percent) natural gas–fired furnaces in 2009, decades after such options became commercially available.[75] Would it not be interesting to know how many delegates to global warming meetings coming from cold climates have triple panes filled with inert gas, super-insulated walls, and 97 percent–efficient gas furnaces? Analogically, how many people in hot climates have properly sealed rooms so that their poorly installed and inefficient window air conditioners don’t waste cool air?

SUV在美国的保有量在20世纪80年代末开始增长，并最终在全球范围内普及。到2020年，SUV平均每年的二氧化碳排放量比普通轿车高出约25% 。 [ 76]将此乘以2020年道路上行驶的2.5亿辆SUV，您就会明白，全球对这些车辆的接受程度已经数倍地抵消了此前缓慢推进的脱碳进程所取得的任何成果。电动汽车的保有量正在不断扩大（2020年仅为1000万辆）。在2010年代，SUV成为二氧化碳排放量上升的第二大原因，仅次于电力生产，高于重工业、卡车运输和航空业。如果公众继续接受SUV，到2040年，超过1亿辆电动汽车上路行驶所带来的碳减排量可能会被SUV的排放量抵消！

SUV ownership began to rise in the US during the late 1980s, it eventually diffused globally, and by 2020 the average SUV emitted annually about 25 percent more CO2 than a standard car.[76] Multiply that by the 250 million SUVs on the road in 2020, and you will see how the worldwide embrace of these machines has wiped out, several times over, any decarbonization gains resulting from the slowly spreading ownership (just 10 million in 2020) of electric vehicles. During the 2010s, SUVs became the second-highest cause of rising CO2 emissions, behind electricity generation and ahead of heavy industry, trucking, and aviation. If their mass public embrace continues, they have the potential to offset any carbon savings from the more than 100 million electric vehicles that might be on the road by 2040!

本书第二章详细阐述了现代食品生产的高能耗，并指出了高得离谱的食物浪费：显然，这为减少二氧化碳排放、水稻种植和反刍动物养殖产生的甲烷排放、氮肥过量施用产生的氧化亚氮排放以及可疑食品贸易产生的排放提供了诸多契机。难道真的有必要在1月份从秘鲁空运蓝莓到加拿大，从肯尼亚空运四季豆到伦敦吗？这些食物所提供的维生素C和膳食纤维可以从许多其他碳足迹更低的来源获得。而且，凭借我们强大的数据处理能力，我们难道不能更合理、更灵活地制定食品价格，从而大幅降低30%至40%的浪费率吗？与其等待更多的模型分析，为什么不立即采取切实可行的措施，既能盈利又能见效呢？

The second chapter of this book detailed the high energy cost of modern food production and noted indefensibly high levels of food waste: clearly, this combination presents many opportunities for reducing not only CO2 emissions but also CH4 emissions from rice cultivation and ruminant livestock and N2O emissions from the excessive application of nitrogen fertilizer—as well as the emissions from questionable food trade. Is it necessary to airlift blueberries from Peru to Canada in January, and green beans from Kenya to London? The vitamin C and roughage these foodstuffs provide can be secured from many other sources with much lower carbon footprints. And could not we, with our immense data-processing capabilities, price food better and more flexibly in order to make a major dent in the 30–40 percent waste rate? Why not do what can be done, profitably and immediately, rather than waiting for more modeling exercises?

我们本可以做却没做的事情还有很多。自全球变暖成为现代话语的主导议题以来的三十年间，我们为了阻止或扭转环境变化的趋势，究竟做了些什么？数据清晰地表明：1989年至2019年间，全球人为温室气体排放量增加了约65%。即使我们分析这一全球平均值，也会发现，像美国、加拿大、日本、澳大利亚和欧盟成员国这样的富裕国家，尽管三十年前人均能源消耗量很高，但它们的排放量确实有所减少，但仅减少了约4%，而印度的排放量却翻了四倍，中国的排放量更是增长了4.5倍。[77]

The list of what we have not—but could have—done is long. And what have we done to avert, or to reverse, the unfolding environmental change in the three decades since global warming became a dominant topic of modern discourse? The data are clear: between 1989 and 2019 we increased global anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions by about 65 percent. Even when we deconstruct this global mean, we see that affluent countries like the US, Canada, Japan, Australia, and those in the EU, whose per capita energy use was very high three decades ago, did reduce their emissions, but only by about 4 percent, while Indian emissions quadrupled and Chinese emissions rose 4.5 times.[77]

我们行动的不作为以及全球变暖挑战的极其艰巨性，最能体现在过去三十年来举办的大规模国际气候会议中。这些措施对全球二氧化碳排放趋势没有任何影响。联合国第一次气候变化大会于1992年召开；此后每年召开一次气候变化大会（1995年在柏林举行），其中包括在京都（1997年，达成了一项完全无效的协议）、马拉喀什（2001年）、巴厘岛（2007年）、坎昆（2010年）、利马（2014年）和巴黎（2015年）举行的多次备受瞩目的会议。[78]显然，与会代表们热衷于前往风景优美的目的地，却几乎没有考虑到这种全球旅行所产生的可怕碳足迹。[79]

The combination of our inaction and of the extraordinarily difficult nature of the global warming challenge is best illustrated by the fact that three decades of large-scale international climate conferences have had no effect on the course of global CO2 emissions. The UN’s first conference on climate change took place in 1992; annual climate change conferences began in 1995 (in Berlin) and included much publicized gatherings in Kyoto (1997, with its completely ineffective agreement), Marrakech (2001), Bali (2007), Cancún (2010), Lima (2014), and Paris (2015).[78] Clearly, the delegates love to travel to scenic destinations with hardly any thought of the dreaded carbon footprint generated by this global jetting.[79]

2015 年，约 5 万人飞往巴黎参加缔约方大会，他们本应在会上达成一项“具有里程碑意义”的协议，而且这项协议“雄心勃勃”且“史无前例”。然而，《巴黎协定》并没有（也不可能）为世界最大排放国制定任何具体的减排目标，而且即使所有自愿的非约束性承诺都得到履行（这完全不可能），到 2050 年，排放量仍将增加50% 。[80]真是个“里程碑”。

In 2015, when about 50,000 people flew to Paris in order to attend yet another conference of the parties at which they were to strike, we were assured, a “landmark”—and also “ambitious” and “unprecedented”—agreement, and yet the Paris accord did not (could not) codify any specific reduction targets by the world’s largest emitters, and it would, even if all voluntary non-binding pledges were honored (something utterly improbable), result in a 50 percent increase of emissions by 2050.[80] Some landmark.

这些会议既无法阻止中国煤炭开采的扩张（1995年至2019年间，中国煤炭开采量增长了两倍多，几乎与世界其他地区的总和相当），也无法阻止前文提到的全球对大型SUV的偏爱，更无法阻止数百万家庭在收入增长到一定程度后立即购买新的空调——这些空调能够在季风气候的亚洲炎热潮湿的夜晚正常工作，因此短期内无法使用太阳能供电。[81]这些需求的综合影响是：1992年至2019年间，全球二氧化碳排放量增加了约65%，甲烷排放量增加了约25%。[82]

These meetings could never have stopped either the expansion of China’s coal extraction (it more than tripled between 1995 and 2019, to nearly as much as the rest of the world combined) or the just-noted worldwide preference for massive SUVs, and they could not have dissuaded millions of families from purchasing—as soon as their rising incomes allowed—new air conditioners that will work through the hot humid nights of monsoonal Asia and hence will not be energized by solar electricity anytime soon.[81] The combined effect of these demands: between 1992 and 2019, the global emissions of CO2 rose by about 65 percent; those of CH4 by about 25 percent.[82]

未来几十年我们能做些什么？首先，我们必须认清一些基本现实。我们过去认为全球平均气温上升2摄氏度是相对可以接受的上限，但2018年政府间气候变化专门委员会（IPCC）将这一上限下调至1.5摄氏度——然而到2020年，我们已经超过了这一上限的三分之二。此外，2017年的一项评估考虑了海洋吸收碳的能力、地球的能量失衡以及大气中细颗粒物的行为，该评估得出结论：已发生的全球变暖（由过去的排放造成，即使所有新的排放立即停止，这一现象仍然会持续存在）已经造成了严重的后果。目前全球气温已累计升高 1.3°C，因此只需再增加 15 年的排放，气温就会超过 1.5°C。[83]对这些综合影响的最新分析得出结论，我们已经注定要面临全球气温升高 2.3°C 的局面。[84]

What can we do during the coming decades? We must start with the recognition of fundamental realities. We used to consider a 2°C increase in average global temperature as a relatively tolerable maximum, but in 2018 the IPCC lowered that to just 1.5°C—but by 2020 we have already added two-thirds of that maximum preferable temperature rise. Moreover, in 2017 an assessment that considered the capacity of the oceans to absorb carbon, the planet’s energy imbalances, and the behavior of fine particles in the atmosphere concluded that the committed global warming (arising from past emissions and becoming a reality even if all new emissions ceased instantly) had already added up to 1.3°C and hence it would require only an additional 15 years of new emissions to surpass 1.5°C.[83] The latest analysis of these combined effects concluded that we are already committed to global warming of 2.3°C.[84]

一如既往，这些结论都存在误差，但全球升温1.5摄氏度的局面似乎已成定局。即便如此，许多机构、组织和政府仍在试图将其控制在既定轨道之内。政府间气候变化专门委员会（IPCC）关于全球升温1.5摄氏度的报告提出了一种情景：如果我们突然且持续地减少对化石燃料的依赖，到2030年全球二氧化碳排放量将减半，到2050年将完全消除[85]。其他情景构建者也正在就如何迅速终结化石燃料时代提出详细建议。计算机使得构建许多快速消除碳排放的情景变得容易——但那些规划通往零碳未来路径的人应该给出切合实际的解释，而不是脱离技术和经济现实、忽略我们能源和物质系统固有特性、庞大规模和巨大复杂性的、或多或少武断且极不可能的假设。最近三个例子很好地说明了这些不受现实世界考虑的天马行空的想象。

As always, these conclusions have their own margins of error, but it seems highly likely that the proverbial horse of 1.5°C warming has already bolted. Even so, many institutions, organizations, and governments are still theorizing about keeping it inside the broken corral. The IPCC report on 1.5°C warming offers a scenario based on such a sudden and persistent reversal of our reliance on fossil fuels that the global emissions of CO2 would be halved by 2030 and eliminated by 2050[85]—and other scenario-builders are now offering detailed suggestions on how to achieve a rapid end to the fossil carbon era. Computers make it easy to construct many scenarios of rapid carbon elimination—but those who chart their preferred paths to a zero-carbon future owe us realistic explanations, not just sets of more or less arbitrary and highly improbable assumptions detached from technical and economic realities and ignoring the embedded nature, massive scale, and enormous complexity of our energy and material systems. Three recent exercises provide excellent illustrations of these flights of fancy unencumbered by real-world considerations.

妄想

Wishful thinking

第一种情景主要由欧盟研究人员制定，假设2050年全球人均能源需求将比2020年下降52%。这样的降幅将使全球气温升幅控制在1.5摄氏度以下变得容易（前提是我们仍然相信这是可能的）。[86]当然——正如我将在最后一章重申的那样——在构建长期情景时，我们可以随意代入任何假设，以达到预设的结果。但是，这种情景的假设与近期历史又如何契合呢？

The first scenario, prepared mostly by EU researchers, assumes that average global per capita energy demand in 2050 will be 52 percent lower than it was in 2020. Such a drop would make it easy to keep the global temperature rise below 1.5°C (that is, if we still believe that such a thing is possible).[86] Of course—and as I will reiterate in the final chapter—when constructing long-range scenarios, we can plug in any arbitrary assumptions in order to meet preconceived outcomes. But how do the assumptions of this scenario align with the recent past?

考虑到过去三十年间人均能源需求的增长，在未来三十年内将人均能源需求减半将是一项惊人的成就。过去30年，全球人均能源需求增长了20%。预测认为，能源需求大幅下降将源于多种因素的综合作用，包括人们不再拥有商品、日常生活数字化以及能源转换和储存技术创新的快速普及。

Cutting per capita energy demand by half in three decades would be an astonishing accomplishment given the fact that over the previous 30 years global per capita energy demand rose by 20 percent. The projection assumes that the much lower demand for energy will arise from a combination of moving away from owning goods, the digitalization of daily life, and a rapid diffusion of technical innovations in converting and storing energies.

认为需求消失的首要驱动因素（拥有量减少）是一种学术观点，缺乏足够的证据支持。因为所有主要的个人消费类别——以年度家庭支出衡量——即使在富裕国家也一直在增长。在市场已经高度饱和、交通拥堵的情况下，欧盟每千人汽车拥有量在2005年至2017年间增长了13%，而过去25年间，德国增长了约25%，法国增长了约20%。[87]需求减少和拥有量逐步下降是可取的，也是可能实现的；但将需求减半则是一个武断且不太可能实现的目标。

The suggested first driver of disappearing demand (owning less) is an academic belief for which there is very little evidence, as all major categories of personal consumption—measured by annual household expenditures—have been rising even in affluent countries. In already highly saturated markets with already congested traffic, the EU’s car ownership per 1,000 people rose by 13 percent between 2005 and 2017, and during the past 25 years it was up about 25 percent in Germany and 20 percent in France.[87] Reduced demand and gradual declines in ownership are desirable and likely; halving the demand is an arbitrary and unlikely target.

更重要的是，这种不切实际的设想的支持者认为，在未来三十年里，他们所谓的“全球南方”（一个常用但极不准确的术语，用来指代低收入国家，主要集中在亚洲和非洲）所有出行方式的普及率仅能翻一番，消费品拥有量仅能增长三倍。然而，在过去一代人的中国，增长规模却截然不同：1999年，中国每百户城镇居民仅拥有0.34辆汽车；到2019年，这一数字超过了40辆。短短二十年间，汽车拥有量就增长了100多倍。[88] 1990年，每300户城镇居民中只有1户拥有窗式空调；到2018年，每百户居民拥有142.2台窗式空调：不到三十年的时间里，空调拥有量增长了400多倍。因此，即使那些目前生活水平与1999年中国水平相当的国家，其经济增长速度仅达到中国近期增速的十分之一，它们的汽车拥有量也将增长10倍，空调拥有量也将增长40倍。为什么那些鼓吹低能源需求情景的人会认为，如今的印度人和尼日利亚人不想缩小与中国物质拥有量之间的差距呢？

More importantly, the proponents of this unrealistic scenario allow merely a factor-of-two increase across all modes of mobility during the next three decades in what they call the Global South (a common but highly inaccurate designation of low-income nations, mostly in Asia and Africa), and a factor-of-three increase in the ownership of consumer goods. But in the China of the past generation, growth has been on an entirely different scale: in 1999 the country had just 0.34 cars per 100 urban households, in 2019 the number surpassed 40. That is a more than 100-fold relative increase in only two decades.[88] In 1990, 1 out of every 300 urban households had an air-conditioning window unit; by 2018 there were 142.2 units per 100 households: a more than 400-fold rise in less than three decades. Consequently, even if those countries whose standard of living is today where China’s was in 1999 were to achieve only a tenth of China’s recent growth, they would experience a 10-fold increase of car ownership and a 40-fold increase in air conditioners. Why do the prescribers of the low-energy-demand scenario think that today’s Indians and Nigerians do not want to narrow the gap that separates them from China’s material ownership?

不出所料，最新的全球生产缺口报告——一份年度出版物，重点关注化石燃料与新能源生产之间的差距——指出，​​化石燃料产量与新能源产量之间存在巨大差异。各国制定的生产计划以及为将全球升温幅度限制在1.5°C或2°C以内所需的全球排放水平，并未显示出任何遏制趋势线的决心；事实上，情况恰恰相反。[89] 2019年，化石能源的主要消费国计划到2030年生产的燃料比将全球升温幅度限制在1.5°C以内所需的产量高出120%，而且无论新冠疫情最终会产生何种影响，由此导致的消费下降都将是暂时的，并且幅度太小，不足以扭转总体趋势。

Not surprisingly, the latest global production gap report—an annual publication highlighting the discrepancy between fossil fuel production planned by individual countries and the global emission levels necessary to limit warming to 1.5°C or 2°C—does not show any commitments to plunging trend lines; just the opposite, in fact.[89] In 2019, the major consumers of fossil energies were aiming to produce 120 percent more fuels by 2030 than would be consistent with limiting global warming to 1.5°C, and whatever the eventual effect of the COVID-19 pandemic, the resulting decline of consumption will be both temporary and too small to reverse the general trend.

在第二个符合2050年实现完全脱碳目标的方案中，普林斯顿大学的一大批能源研究人员绘制了美国所需的转型路线图。[90]普林斯顿大学的方案构建者们认识到，完全消除化石燃料消耗是不可能的，实现净零排放的唯一途径是采用他们所谓的整体战略的“第四支柱”——大规模捕获和储存排放的二氧化碳——他们的计算表明，每年需要移除10亿至17亿吨二氧化碳。按体积当量计算，这将需要创建一个全新的气体捕获、运输和储存产业，该产业每年必须处理相当于美国当前原油产量1.3至2.4倍的二氧化碳量，而美国原油产业的建立耗时超过160年，耗资数万亿美元。

In the second scenario conforming to the goal of complete decarbonization by 2050, a large group of energy researchers at Princeton University have charted the required shifts in the US.[90] The Princeton scenario-builders recognize that it will be impossible to eliminate all fossil fuel consumption and that the only way to achieve net-zero emissions is to resort to what they label the “fourth pillar” of their overall strategy—to mass-scale carbon capture and storage of emitted CO2—and their calculation requires the removal of 1–1.7 gigatons of the gas per year. When compared on a volume equivalent basis, that would necessitate the creation of an entirely new gas-capture-transportation-storage industry that every year would have to handle 1.3–2.4 times the volume of current US crude oil production, an industry that took more than 160 years and trillions of dollars to build.

大部分碳储存将沿德克萨斯州墨西哥湾沿岸进行，这将需要新建约11万公里的二氧化碳管道，这要求在以诉讼成风和“邻避效应”（NIMBY）著称的美国社会中，以前所未有的速度完成如此大规模的管道建设、审批和施工。[91]与此同时，还需要额外资金用于拆除美国油气行业现有的输电基础设施。鉴于以往长期成本超支的惨痛历史，未来三十年的任何支出成本估算，即使就数量级而言，也都不可信。

The majority of this carbon storage is to take place along the Texas Gulf Coast, and this would require building about 110,000 kilometers of new CO2 pipelines, necessitating an utterly unprecedented speed in the planning, permitting, and constructing of such extensive links in a society famous for its litigiousness and NIMBY resistance.[91] At the same time, additional monies would have to be spent on dismantling the existing transmission infrastructure of the US oil and gas industry. Given the rich historical experience with massive long-term cost overruns, any cost estimates for expenditure over the next three decades cannot be trusted even as far as their order of magnitude is concerned.

与第三种情景相比，到2050年实现完全脱碳的目标相对温和。第三种情景将美国绿色新政（2019年在美国国会提出）的目标扩展到143个国家。报告概述了到2030年，全球至少80%的能源供应将实现脱碳，这得益于可再生风能、水能和太阳能（WWS）能源。这些能源的供应将使总体能源需求减少57%，财务成本减少61%，社会（健康和气候）成本减少91%：“因此，100%的WWS能源比现有能源消耗更少、成本更低，并创造更多就业机会。” [92]媒体、名人以及畅销书作家纷纷重复、支持和放大这些观点，毫不奇怪，从《滚石》杂志到《纽约客》，从诺姆·乔姆斯基（他将能源作为其最新专长领域）到杰里米·里夫金，后者认为，如果没有这样的干预措施，我们以化石燃料为生的文明将在2028年崩溃。[93]

Achieving complete decarbonization by 2050 is a tame goal compared to the third scenario, which extends the goals of the US Green New Deal (introduced in the US Congress in 2019) to 143 countries and outlines how at least 80 percent of global energy supply will be decarbonized by 2030 thanks to renewable wind, water, and solar (WWS) energy, the supply of which will reduce overall needs by 57 percent, financial costs by 61 percent, and social (health and climate) costs by 91 percent: “Thus, 100 percent WWS needs less energy, costs less, and creates more jobs than current energy.”[92] There is no shortage of media, celebrities, and bestselling authors repeating, supporting, and amplifying these claims, ranging (no surprise) from Rolling Stone to the New Yorker, and from Noam Chomsky (who adds energy as his latest field of expertise) to Jeremy Rifkin, who believes that without such an intervention our fossil-fueled civilization will collapse by 2028.[93]

如果这些说法属实，它们及其热情拥护者便引出了一个显而易见的问题：我们为什么要担心全球变暖？为什么要害怕地球提前毁灭？为什么要加入“反抗灭绝”运动？谁会反对既廉价又几乎立竿见影的解决方案，这些方案还能创造无数高薪就业机会，并确保子孙后代拥有无忧无虑的未来？让我们一起唱响这些绿色赞歌，让我们遵循完全可再生能源的方案，一个全新的全球天堂将在短短十年内到来——或者，如果情况稍有延迟，则在2035年到来。[94]

If true, these claims and their enthusiastic endorsements raise the obvious question: why should we worry about global warming? Why be frightened by the idea of early planetary demise, why feel compelled to join Extinction Rebellion? Who could be against solutions that are both cheap and nearly instantly effective, that will create countless well-paying jobs and ensure care-free futures for coming generations? Let us all just sing from these green hymnals, let us follow all-renewable prescriptions and a new global nirvana will arrive in just a decade—or, if things get a bit delayed, by 2035.[94]

然而，仔细阅读后会发现，这些神奇的方案既没有解释如何完全利用可再生电力生产现代文明的四大物质支柱（水泥、钢铁、塑料和氨），也没有令人信服地解释如何使航空、航运和卡车运输（我们现代经济全球化的基石）在2030年实现80%的碳中和；它们仅仅是断言有可能实现。细心的读者会记得（参见第一章），在21世纪的前二十年里，德国史无前例的脱碳努力（以风能和太阳能为基础）成功地将风能和太阳能发电的比例提升到40%以上，但仅将化石燃料在该国一次能源消耗中的占比从约84%降低到78%。

Alas, a close reading reveals that these magic prescriptions give no explanation for how the four material pillars of modern civilization (cement, steel, plastic, and ammonia) will be produced solely with renewable electricity, nor do they convincingly explain how flying, shipping, and trucking (to which we owe our modern economic globalization) could become 80 percent carbon-free by 2030; they merely assert that it could be so. Attentive readers will remember (see chapter 1) that during the first two decades of the 21st century Germany’s unprecedented quest for decarbonization (based on wind and solar) succeeded in boosting the shares of wind- and solar-generated electricity to more than 40 percent, but it lowered the share of fossil fuels in the country’s primary energy use only from about 84 percent to 78 percent.

对于目前依赖化石燃料供应90%一次能源的非洲国家来说，未来将有哪些奇迹般的选择？为了在十年内将煤炭依赖度降至20%，同时节省巨额资金？中国和印度（两国仍在扩大煤炭开采和燃煤发电）又如何才能突然摆脱煤炭依赖？但这些针对已发表的快速转型叙事的具体批评其实无关紧要：纠结于本质上等同于学术科幻小说的细节毫无意义。它们从任意设定的目标（2030年或2050年实现零煤炭依赖）出发，反向推导，代入假定的行动方案以达成这些目标，而实际的社会经济需求和技术要求却几乎被忽略。

What miraculous options will be available to African nations now relying on fossil fuels to supply 90 percent of their primary energy, in order to drive their dependence to 20 percent within a decade while also saving enormous sums of monies? And how will China and India (both countries are still expanding their coal extraction and coal-fired generation) suddenly become coal-free? But these specific critiques of published rapid-speed transformation narratives are really beside the point: it makes no sense to argue with the details of what are essentially the academic equivalents of science fiction. They start with arbitrarily set goals (zero by 2030 or by 2050) and work backwards to plug in assumed actions to fit those achievements, with actual socioeconomic needs and technical imperatives being of little, or no, concern.

因此，现实从两方面都对我们构成了压力。碳依赖型活动规模庞大、成本高昂且技术惯性巨大，使得在短短几十年内完全消除这些用途成为不可能。正如我在能源章节中详细阐述的那样，我们无法如此迅速地摆脱这种依赖，所有切合实际的长期预测都印证了这一点：尤其值得注意的是，即使是国际能源署最激进的脱碳方案也预测，到2040年，化石燃料仍将满足全球56%的一次能源需求。同样，巨大的材料和能源需求规模和成本也使得直接空气捕获无法成为快速实现全球脱碳的关键手段。

Reality thus presses in from both ends. The sheer scale, cost, and technical inertia of carbon-dependent activities make it impossible to eliminate all of these uses in just a few decades. As I detailed in the chapter on energy, we cannot sever that dependence so rapidly, and every realistic long-term forecast concurs: most notably, even the IEA’s most aggressive decarbonization scenario has fossil fuels supplying 56 percent of the global primary energy demand by 2040. Similarly, the enormous scale and cost of material and energy demands make it impossible to resort to direct air capture as a decisive component of rapid global decarbonization.

但我们能够做出巨大改变，并非通过假装追求不切实际且武断的目标：显而易见，历史的展开并非像计算机化的学术练习那样，重大成就并非集中在尾数为0或5的年份；它充满了断裂、逆转和不可预测的转变。我们可以快速推进以天然气替代燃煤发电（如果生产和运输过程中甲烷泄漏量不大，其碳排放强度远低于煤炭），并扩大太阳能和风能发电规模。我们可以减少SUV的使用，加速电动汽车的大规模推广，而且我们在建筑、家庭和商业能源利用方面仍然存在大量低效之处，这些低效之处可以通过经济效益显著的方式减少或消除。但是，我们不能仅仅因为……就立即改变一个由超过100亿吨化石碳组成、能量转换速率超过17太瓦的复杂系统的运行轨迹。有人断定，全球消费曲线将突然逆转其几个世纪以来的上升趋势，并立即进入持续且相对快速的下降阶段。

But we can make a great deal of difference, not by pretending to follow unrealistic and arbitrary goals: all too obviously, history does not unfold as a computerized academic exercise with major achievements falling on years ending with zero or five; it is full of discontinuities, reversals, and unpredictable departures. We can proceed fairly fast with the displacement of coal-fired electricity by natural gas (when produced and transported without significant methane leakage, it has a substantially lower carbon intensity than coal) and by expanding solar and wind electricity generation. We can move away from SUVs and accelerate mass-scale deployment of electric cars, and we still have large inefficiencies in construction, household, and commercial energy use that can be profitably reduced or eliminated. But we cannot instantly change the course of a complex system consisting of more than 10 billion tons of fossil carbon and converting energies at a rate of more than 17 terawatts, just because somebody decides that the global consumption curve will suddenly reverse its centuries-long ascent and go immediately into a sustained and relatively fast decline.

模型、疑虑与现实

Models, doubts, and realities

为什么有些科学家不断绘制出如此随意弯曲和急剧下降的曲线，声称能实现近乎瞬间的脱碳？为什么另一些科学家又承诺会很快出现技术上的超级解决方案，从而支撑全人类的高生活水平？为什么这些美好的愿望常常被当作可靠的预测，并被那些从不质疑自身假设的人轻易相信？我将在最后一章对此进行更详细的阐述，但这里先谈谈与当今全球环境变化这一主要问题相关的一些观察。

Why is it that some scientists keep on charting such arbitrarily bending and plunging curves leading to near-instant decarbonization? And why are others promising the early arrival of technical super-fixes that will support high standards of living for all humanity? And why are these wishful offerings taken so often for reliable previsions and are readily believed by people who would never try to question their assumptions? I will have more to say about this in the closing chapter, but here are some observations related to the now-so-dominant concern of global environmental change.

“De omnibus dubitandum”（怀疑一切）绝不仅仅是一句经久不衰的笛卡尔名言；它必须成为科学方法的基石。还记得我在本章开头列出了九项行星边界吗？一旦逾越这些边界，我们的生物圈福祉将岌岌可危。将它们限制在安全范围内似乎是显而易见的结论，因为它们代表了最重要、最持久、最关乎生存的问题——然而，一份四十年前的清单却截然不同。酸雨（或者更准确地说，是酸化降水）很可能位列榜首，因为在20世纪80年代初，人们普遍认为它是首要的环境问题。[95]

De omnibus dubitandum (Doubt everything) must be more than a durable Cartesian quote; it must remain the very foundation of the scientific method. Recall how I opened this chapter with a list of nine planetary boundaries whose transgressions imperil our biospheric wellbeing? Keeping them within safe confines seems to be an obvious conclusion because they identify the most important, perennial, existential concerns—and yet a list prepared 40 years ago would have been very different. Acid rain (or, more correctly, acidifying precipitation) would have been, most likely, its top item, because a broad consensus of the early 1980s saw it as the leading environmental problem.[95]

平流层臭氧损耗不会被列入考虑范围，因为臭名昭著的南极臭氧空洞直到1985年才被发现；而人为气候变化及其相关的海洋酸化，即便被列入考虑范围，也只会排在最后。[96]即使关注土地利用变化（主要表现为森林砍伐）、生物多样性丧失（从标志性的大熊猫和考拉到蜂群和鲨鱼）以及淡水供应等长期存在的问题，我们的担忧也已发生了显著变化，在某些方面变得更加尖锐（我们现在更担心地下水的过度抽取和过度消耗）。营养物质造成沿海死亡区），而其他地区则不那么紧迫（或许最值得注意的是，森林已经大幅恢复，不仅在所有富裕国家，而且在中国也是如此）。[97]

Stratospheric ozone depletion would have been absent because the infamous Antarctic ozone hole was discovered only in 1985; and, if listed at all, anthropogenic climate change and associated ocean acidification would have been near the bottom.[96] And even when focusing on such perennial concerns as land use changes (dominated by deforestation), loss of biodiversity (from iconic pandas and koalas to bee colonies and sharks), and freshwater supply, our concerns have evolved considerably, becoming more acute in some ways (we now worry more about withdrawals of underground water and about excessive nutrients creating coastal dead zones) and less pressing in others (perhaps most notably, forests have made substantial comebacks, not only in all affluent countries but also in China).[97]

展望未来，我们必须重新审视所有探索环境、技术和社会复杂性的模型，并保持批判性的视角。构建此类模型（或者用时髦的说法，构建叙事）没有限制。模型作者可以像近期许多气候模型那样，对未来的能源消耗做出过多的假设，最终导致极高的升温幅度，从而引发关于未来世界惨状的新闻报道。[98]而另一些模型构建者则采取相反的做法，他们可能假设到2050年，热核能或冷聚变将100%实现低成本；或者，他们也可以允许化石燃料燃烧无限扩张，因为他们的模型采用了神奇的技术，不仅能从大气中去除任何量的二氧化碳，还能将其回收利用，作为合成液体燃料的原料——而且所有这一切都将以不断下降的成本实现。

When looking ahead, we must regain a critical perspective when dealing with all models exploring environmental, technical, and social complexities. There are no limits to assembling such models or, as fashionable lingo has it, constructing narratives. Their authors can choose, as so many recent climate models have done recently, excessive assumptions about future energy use, and they can end up with very high rates of warming that generate news headlines about hellish futures.[98] Taking the opposite approach, other modelers can posit 100 percent inexpensive thermonuclear electricity or cold fusion by 2050, or, alternatively, they can allow for the unlimited expansion of fossil fuel combustion, because their model deploys miraculous techniques that will not only remove any volume of CO2 from the atmosphere but recycle it as a feedstock for synthesizing liquid fuel—all at a steadily declining cost.

当然，他们只是随波逐流，盲目地将每一项技术变革都与电子产品，尤其是移动电话的最新发展相提并论。一位绿色能源公司的首席执行官在2020年这样说道：“你还记得我们是如何将电话从固定电话转变为移动电话，将电视从只能观看任何节目转变为可以观看任何我们想看的节目，将购买报纸转变为定制新闻推送的吗？这场由人民主导、技术驱动的能源革命也将如此。” [99]仅仅改变一个设备（从固定电话到移动电话），而这个设备的可靠使用又依赖于一个庞大、复杂且高度可靠的电力系统——包括数千座大型化石燃料、水力和核电站、变压和输电系统（涵盖数十万公里长的国家级乃至洲际级电网），这怎么可能与改变整个底层系统相同呢？

Of course, they just march along with the new tech crowd whose naivete compares every technical change to recent developments in electronics, and above all to mobile phones. Here is how a green energy CEO put it in 2020: “Do you remember how we transformed telephony from fixed-line phones to mobile phones, television from watching whatever was on TV to whatever we fancied, from buying newspapers to customising our news feeds? The people-led, tech-powered energy revolution is going to be just the same.”[99] How could changing a device (landline to mobile) whose reliable use depends on a massive, complex, and highly reliable system of electricity generation (dominated by thousands of large fossil-fueled, hydro, and nuclear power plants), transformation, and transmission (encompassing hundreds of thousands of kilometers of national and even continental-scale grids) be the same as changing the entire underlying system?

这种脱离实际的思考方式大多如预期般呈现出来——从令人恐惧到令人惊叹——我能理解为什么许多人会被这些威胁或不切实际的建议所蒙蔽。只有想象力才能限制这些假设：它们从相当合理到明显妄想，不一而足。这是一个新兴的科学领域，其中充斥着大量的……其中既包含一些美好的愿望，也包含一些确凿的事实。所有这些模型都应该被视为启发式练习，作为思考各种选择和方法的依据，绝不能被误认为是对我们未来的预言。我真希望这条告诫能像它看起来那样显而易见、微不足道、多余！

Much of this unmoored thinking comes out as intended—ranging from scary to wonderful—and I can see why many people are taken in either by these threats or by unrealistic suggestions. Only the imagination limits these assumptions: they range from fairly plausible to patently delusionary. This is a new scientific genre where heavy doses of wishful thinking are commingled with a few solid facts. All of these models should be seen mainly as heuristic exercises, as bases for thinking about options and approaches, never to be mistaken for prescient descriptions of our future. I wish this admonition would be as obvious, as trivial, and as superfluous as it seems!

无论人们感知到（或模型预测到的）全球环境挑战的严重程度如何，对于热带森林砍伐或生物多样性丧失、土壤侵蚀或全球变暖，都不存在快速、普遍适用且经济实惠的解决方案。但全球变暖之所以构成异常严峻的挑战，恰恰在于它是一个真正的全球性现象，而且其最大的人为原因是燃烧构成现代文明巨大能源基础的燃料。因此，只有当我们愿意大幅降低所有富裕国家的生活水平，并且剥夺亚洲和非洲现代化国家集体生活水平提升哪怕是中国自1980年以来所取得成就的一小部分时，非碳能源才有可能在一到三十年内完全取代化石能源。

Regardless of the perceived (or modeled) severity of global environmental challenges, there are no swift, universal, and widely affordable solutions to tropical deforestation or biodiversity loss, to soil erosion or to global warming. But global warming presents an uncommonly difficult challenge precisely because it is a truly global phenomenon, and because its largest anthropogenic cause is the combustion of fuels that constitute the massive energetic foundations of modern civilization. As a result, non-carbon energies could completely displace fossil carbon in a matter of one to three decades ONLY if we were willing to take substantial cuts to the standard of living in all affluent countries and deny the modernizing nations of Asia and Africa improvements in their collective lots by even a fraction of what China has done since 1980.

尽管如此，通过持续提高能源效率、优化系统设计以及控制消费，大幅减少碳排放仍然是可能的，而坚定不移地追求这些目标将有助于限制全球变暖的最终速度。但我们无法预知到2050年我们能取得多大的成功，而展望2100年更是超出了我们的想象。我们可以列举一些极端情况，但短短几十年内，各种可能的结果就会变得难以预测。而且，最终脱碳进程的进展不仅取决于我们采取的积极措施，还取决于国家命运中一些难以预料的变化。

Still, major reductions in carbon emissions—resulting from the combination of continued efficiency gains, better system designs, and moderated consumption—are possible, and a determined pursuit of these goals would limit the eventual rate of global warming. But we cannot know to what extent we will succeed by 2050, and thinking about 2100 is truly beyond our ken. We can outline extreme cases, but in just a few decades the fan of possible outcomes becomes too wide and, in any case, the progress of any eventual decarbonization is contingent not only on our deliberate remedial actions but also on unpredictable intervening changes in national fortunes.

1980年，是否有一位气候模型专家预测到过去30年全球变暖最重要的人为因素：中国的经济崛起？当时，即使是最好的模型——它们都是20世纪60年代全球大气环流模型的直接衍生品——也无法反映国家命运的不可预测的变化，而且它们也忽略了大气圈和生物圈之间的相互作用。但这并不意味着这些模型毫无用处：它们假设了全球经济的持续增长。温室气体排放量，而且总体而言，它们对全球变暖的速度预测得相当准确。[100]

Was there a single climate modeler who predicted in 1980 the most important anthropogenic factor driving global warming over the past 30 years: the economic rise of China? At that time even the best models, all being direct descendants of global atmospheric circulation models developed during the 1960s, had no way of reflecting unpredictable shifts in national fortunes, and they also ignored the interactions between the atmosphere and the biosphere. That did not make these models useless: they assumed the continued global growth of greenhouse gas emissions and, in general, they were fairly accurate in predicting the rate of global warming.[100]

但对总体死亡率的准确估计仅仅是开始。再次以新冠肺炎为例，这好比在2010年做出预测：基于过去三次大流行病的经验，并考虑到更大的人口规模，下一次全球大流行病爆发第一年的全球死亡人数约为200万。[101]这个数字与实际总数非常接近——但是，如果基于诸多先例，正确地假设疫情将从中国开始，那么这个预测是否也会将其中0.24%的死亡人数（绝对值低于希腊或奥地利）归于中国——一个拥有近20%全球人口的国家——而将近20%的死亡人数归于美国——一个远比中国富裕（而且它自己也肯定这么认为）且能力远胜于中国、人口占比不到5%的国家呢？

But a good estimate of the overall rate is only the beginning. To use, once again, the COVID-19 analogy, this is akin to making a forecast in 2010 that—based on the last three pandemics and adjusted for a larger population—global deaths during the first year of the next global pandemic would be about 2 million.[101] That would be very close to the actual total—but would that forecast (correctly assuming, based on many precedents, that the pandemic would start in China) also assign only 0.24 percent of those deaths (in absolute terms, less than in Greece or Austria) to China, a country with nearly 20 percent of the global population—and nearly 20 percent to the US, a far richer and (it certainly believes this about itself) far more competent country with less than 5 percent of the global population?

更令人难以置信的是，它竟然预测到死亡率最高的地区会集中在最富裕的西方经济体，那些以国家提供的先进医疗保健而自豪的国家？2021年3月，随着新冠疫情正式进入第二年（世界卫生组织于2020年3月11日宣布，尽管疫情至少从2019年12月起就已在中国蔓延），累计死亡率最高的10个国家（每百万人超过1500人；或每1000人中有1.5人死于新冠肺炎）全部位于欧洲，其中包括6个欧盟成员国和英国。谁又能预料到美国的死亡率（同样超过1500人）会比中国的每百万人3人高出两个数量级呢？[102]显然，即使是对新冠肺炎总死亡人数的高度准确预测，也无法为制定最佳的国家应对措施提供具体指导。

And, even more incredibly, would it predict that the highest mortalities would be concentrated in the most affluent Western economies, those that boast about their state-delivered advanced health care? In March 2021, as the pandemic entered officially its second year (the WHO proclaimed it on March 11, 2020, although the infection had been spreading in China at least since December 2019), all the top 10 countries with the highest cumulative mortalities (above 1,500 per million; or 1.5 out of every 1,000 people died of COVID-19) were in Europe, including six EU members and the UK. And who could predict that the US rate (also above 1,500) would be two orders of magnitude above China’s 3 deaths per 1 million?[102] Obviously, even a highly accurate forecast of total interim COVID-19 mortality would provide no specific guidance for formulating the best national responses.

类似地，1980 年后中国（以及印度）的崛起改变了应对全球微量气体排放量上升的任何形势。1980 年，毛泽东逝世四年后，中国人均经济产值不到尼日利亚平均水平的四分之一；当时没有私家车；只有居住在中南海（紫禁城内的原皇家园林，现为中共中央总部）的中共最高领导人才拥有空调；中国的二氧化碳排放量仅占全球的 10% 。 [ 103]

Analogically, the post-1980 rise of China (as well as India) has changed the circumstances of any response to rising global trace gas emissions. In 1980, four years after Mao Zedong’s death, China’s per capita economic product was less than one-quarter of the Nigerian mean; there were no private passenger cars; only the top Communist Party leaders living in the seclusion of Zhongnanhai (the former imperial garden within the Forbidden City, now the central headquarters of the Communist Party) had air conditioning; and China produced just 10 percent of global CO2 emissions.[103]

到2019年，中国按购买力平价计算已成为世界最大经济体；其人均GDP是尼日利亚的五倍；中国是世界上最大的汽车生产国；一半的城市家庭拥有两台窗式空调；其高铁网络总长度超过了欧盟所有线路的总和；约有1.5亿中国公民曾出国旅行。中国化石燃料二氧化碳排放量占全球总量的30% 。相比之下，美国和欧盟28国的二氧化碳排放量总和从1980年占全球总量的60%下降到2019年的23%，而且（由于经济增长缓慢、人口老龄化甚至下降以及工业生产大规模外包到亚洲），它们的排放量总和极不可能再次上升。

By 2019 China was, in terms of purchasing power, the world’s largest economy; its per capita GDP was five times the Nigerian mean; the country was the world’s largest producer of cars; half of all urban households had two window-mounted air-conditioning units; the length of its rapid train network surpassed the combined length of all the EU’s links; and about 150 million of its citizens had traveled overseas. The country also emitted 30 percent of the world’s CO2 from fossil fuels. In contrast, the combined emissions of the USA and EU28 fell from 60 percent of the world total in 1980 to 23 percent by 2019 and (because of slow rates of economic growth; aging, even declining, populations; and large-scale offshoring of industrial production to Asia) their combined share is highly unlikely to rise ever again.

展望未来，推动有意义变革的大部分力量将越来越集中在正在现代化的亚洲经济体手中：除高收入且人口增长缓慢或停滞的日本、韩国和台湾地区外，亚洲目前排放的温室气体占全球总量的一半。虽然撒哈拉以南非洲的转型进程较为缓慢，但其约11亿的总人口将在未来30年内增长近一倍，比中国（所有低收入经济体都希望效仿的国家）的人口多出近50%。对非洲电力未来发展的关键评估表明，该地区将面临高碳锁定，化石燃料发电仍将占据主导地位，到2030年，非水力可再生能源的份额仍将低于10%。[104]

Looking ahead, most of the power to enact meaningful change will lie more and more in the modernizing economies of Asia: excluding high-income and low- or no-population growth Japan, South Korea, and Taiwan, the continent is now producing half of all emissions. And while the unfolding transformation of sub-Saharan Africa has been much slower, its combined population of about 1.1 billion will nearly double during the next 30 years, it will contain almost 50 percent more people than China (the country that all low-income economies wish to emulate), and a critical assessment of the continent’s electricity future points to a high-carbon lock-in, with fossil-fueled generation dominant and with the share of non-hydro renewables remaining below 10 percent in 2030.[104]

国家的兴衰并非全球变暖进程和影响方面唯一的不确定因素。近期的好消息是，世界森林一直是巨大的、持续的碳汇（储存的碳大于排放的碳），在1990年至2007年间每年封存约24亿吨碳。2000年至2017年的卫星数据显示，全球三分之一的植被覆盖面积正在变绿（年均绿叶面积显著增加，证实了更多碳被吸收和储存），只有5%的植被正在变褐（叶片大量减少）。[105]这种效应在中国和印度的集约化耕地中尤为显著，在中国，这种效应也体现在不断扩大的森林面积中。

The rise and fall of nations is not the only uncertainty concerning the progress and effects of global warming. Recent good news is that the world’s forests have been a large and persistent carbon sink (storing more than they emit), locking away about 2.4 billion tons of carbon every year between 1990 and 2007, and satellite data for 2000–2017 indicate that one-third of the world’s vegetated area has been greening (showing a significant increase in the average annual green leaf area, confirming that more carbon is now absorbed and stored) and only 5 percent has been browning (showing significant loss of leaves).[105] This effect has been particularly notable in intensively cultivated croplands in China and India, and in China the effect has also been seen in the country’s expanding forests.

但不太好的消息（你肯定早就料到了……）是，1900年至2015年间，由于砍伐，生物圈损失了14%的树木，而且同样重要的是，同期树木死亡率翻了一番，其中老树（以及高大树木）的损失比例更高。世界森林正变得越来越年轻、越来越矮小，因此储存碳的能力也不如以往。[106]生长速度的加快似乎正在缩短几乎所有树种和气候条件下的树木寿命，因此，大量碳汇的存在可能只是暂时的。[107]你听过多少次这样的说法：不可避免地，全球变暖导致的海平面上升，最先遭受冲击的将是地势低洼的沿海地区，尤其是太平洋岛国？[108]然而，最近一项对太平洋环礁国家图瓦卢（位于斐济北部，所罗门群岛东部）全部101个岛屿四十年来海岸线变化的分析表明，该国的陆地面积实际上增加了近3%。[109]应当始终避免先入为主和草率概括的结论。

But the not-so-good news (you knew it was coming . . . ) is that between 1900 and 2015 the biosphere lost 14 percent of its trees due to cutting and, no less significantly, tree mortality doubled during that time, with older (and taller) trees accounting for a larger share of this loss. The world’s forests are getting younger and shorter, and hence are not able to store as much carbon as in the past.[106] Increased growth rates appear to be shortening trees’ lifespans across almost all species and climates, and so the existence of substantial carbon sinks may be only transient.[107] And how many times have you heard that, inevitably, the first places to succumb to rising sea levels caused by global warming will be the low-lying coasts in general and island nations in the Pacific in particular?[108] And yet a recent analysis of four decades of shoreline change in all 101 islands in the Pacific atoll nation of Tuvalu (north of Fiji, east of the Solomon Islands) shows that the nation’s land area has actually increased by nearly 3 percent. [109] Preconceived and rashly generalizing conclusions should always be avoided.

社会演进受人类行为的不可预测性、长期历史轨迹的突然转变、国家的兴衰以及我们实施有效变革的能力的影响。这些现实影响着许多本质上复杂（且远未被充分理解）的生物圈过程。由于它们常常引发相互矛盾的自然反应，例如森林既是碳汇又是碳源，因此我们无法自信地预测到2030年或2050年，我们在化石燃料消耗、脱碳进程或环境后果方面将会处于何种境地。

The evolution of societies is affected by the unpredictability of human behavior, by sudden shifts of long-lasting historical trajectories, by the rise and fall of nations, and is accompanied by our ability to enact meaningful changes. These realities affect many inherently complex (and far from satisfactorily understood) biospheric processes. And because they elicit often contradictory natural responses, such as forests being both sinks and sources of carbon, it is impossible to say with confidence where we will be—in terms of fossil fuel consumption, the pace of decarbonization, or environmental consequences—in 2030 or 2050.

最值得注意的是，我们集体——就此而言是全球——应对至少一些关键挑战的决心仍然存疑。解决方案、调整和适应措施并非遥不可及。富裕国家完全可以大幅降低人均能源消耗，同时仍能保持舒适的生活质量。从强制安装三层玻璃窗到设计更耐用的车辆，这些简单的技术措施若能广泛推广，将产生显著的累积效应。减少一半的食物浪费并改变全球肉类消费结构，既能减少碳排放，又不会降低食品供应质量。值得注意的是，在典型的低碳“革命”愿景描述中，这些措施要么被忽略，要么排名靠后。这些愿景往往依赖于目前尚无法实现的大规模电力存储，或是依赖于不切实际的大规模碳捕获及其永久地下封存的承诺。这些过高的期望并非什么新鲜事。

Most notably, what remains in doubt is our collective—in this case global—resolve to deal effectively with at least some critical challenges. Solutions, adjustments, and adaptations are available. Affluent countries could reduce their average per capita energy use by large margins and still retain a comfortable quality of life. Widespread diffusion of simple technical fixes ranging from mandated triple windows to designs of more durable vehicles would have significant cumulative effects. The halving of food waste and changing the composition of global meat consumption would reduce carbon emissions without degrading the quality of food supply. Remarkably, these measures are absent, or rank low, in typical recitals of coming low-carbon “revolutions” that rely on as-yet-unavailable mass-scale electricity storage or on the promise of unrealistically massive carbon capture and its permanent storage underground. There is nothing new about these exaggerated expectations.

1991年，一位知名的环保人士曾撰文谈到“为了娱乐和利益而减缓全球变暖”。[110]如果这一承诺哪怕有一点点接近现实，三十年后我们就不会面临如今这些气候变暖灾难论者日益加剧的焦虑。同样，我们现在也被承诺会有更多令人震惊的“颠覆性”创新和人工智能驱动的“解决方案”。但现实是，任何真正有效的措施都绝非灵丹妙药，而是需要循序渐进且代价高昂。数千年来，我们一直在以越来越大的规模和越来越强的强度改造环境，并从中获得了诸多益处——但不可避免地，生物圈也因此遭受了损失。虽然有办法减少这些影响，但我们一直缺乏以所需规模实施这些措施的决心。如果我们开始采取足够有效的行动（而这现在需要在全球范围内进行），我们将不得不付出巨大的经济和社会代价。我们最终会出于深思熟虑、具有远见卓识而采取行动吗？还是只会在环境恶化的迫不得已下才采取行动？还是我们将无法采取任何有意义的行动？

In 1991 a well-known environmental activist wrote about “abating global warming for fun and profit.”[110] If this promise would have even remotely resembled reality, we would not be faced, three decades later, with the increasing anguish of today’s warming catastrophists. Similarly, we are now promised even more astonishing “disruptive” innovations and AI-driven “solutions.” The reality is that any sufficiently effective steps will be decidedly non-magical, gradual, and costly. We have been transforming the environment on increasing scales and with rising intensity for millennia, and we have derived many benefits from these changes—but, inevitably, the biosphere has suffered. There are ways to reduce those impacts but the resolve to deploy them at required scales has been lacking, and if we start acting in a sufficiently effective manner (and this now requires doing so on a global scale) we will have to pay a considerable economic and social price. Will we, eventually, do so deliberately, with foresight; will we act only when forced by deteriorating conditions; or will we fail to act in a meaningful way?

7. 了解未来

7. Understanding the Future

末日与奇点之间

Between Apocalypse and Singularity

“启示录”（Apocalypse）一词源于古希腊语ἀποκάλυψις （经由拉丁语） ，字面意思是“揭示”。在基督教语境中，其含义转向预言中基督再临的揭示或启示；而在现代用法中，该词已成为地球生命终结、世界末日，或——用另一个希腊圣经术语来说——哈米吉多顿的代名词。[1]清晰明确，毋庸置疑。

“Apocalypse” comes (via Latin) from the ancient Greek ἀποκάλυψις. Literally, it means “uncovering.” In the Christian context, the meaning shifted toward a prophesied unveiling, or revelation, of the second coming, and in modern usage the term has become synonymous with the end of life on Earth, the doomsday, or—to use another Greek biblical term—Armageddon.[1] Clear and unambiguously definitive.

末日景象——包括各大宗教所描述的各种地狱——被现代末日论者大力复兴，他们将人口快速增长、环境污染，以及如今日益受到关注的全球变暖，视为将我们带入地狱的罪孽。与之相反，顽固的技术乐观主义者则延续着对奇迹和永恒救赎的信仰。我们经常看到这样的论调：人工智能和深度学习系统将带领我们一路走向“奇点”。“奇点”一词源于拉丁语“singularis” ，意为“个体的、独特的、无与伦比的”——但在本章中，它指的是未来学家雷·库兹韦尔提出的奇点概念，即该术语的数学含义：函数值达到无穷大的时间点。[2]他预测，到2045年，机器智能将超越人类智能，他所谓的生物智能和非生物智能将融合，机器智能将以无限的速度遍布宇宙。[3]这是终极的飞升。它将使殖民宇宙其他部分成为一项毫不费力的壮举。

Apocalyptic visions of the future—with assorted hells offered by major religions—have been strongly revived by modern promoters of doom, who have been pointing to rapid population growth, environmental pollution, or now, increasingly, to global warming as the sins that will transport us to the netherworld. In contrast, incorrigible techno-optimists continue the tradition of believing in miracles and the delivery of eternal salvation. It is not uncommon to read how artificial intelligence and deep learning systems will carry us all the way to the “Singularity.” This comes from the Latin singularis, meaning “individual, unique, unmatched”—but in this chapter it refers to futurist Ray Kurzweil’s notion of singularity, i.e. to the mathematical meaning of the term as a point in time at which a function assumes an infinite value.[2] He predicts that, come 2045, machine intelligence will have surpassed human intelligence, what he calls biological and nonbiological intelligence will merge, and machine intelligence will fill the universe at infinite speed.[3] This is the ultimate ascension. It will make colonization of the rest of the universe an inevitably effortless endeavor.

对复杂系统进行长期建模通常依赖于构建一个由各种可能结果构成的扇形图，这些结果受到合理极端情况的约束。世界末日和奇点提供了两个绝对选项：我们的未来必然位于这个包罗万象的范围内。现代对未来的预测之所以如此引人注目，就在于它们如何……尽管现有证据确凿，人们仍然倾向于这两种极端观点之一。过去，这种二元对立的倾向常被描述为灾难论者和乐观主义者之间的冲突，但这些标签似乎过于保守，不足以反映近期情绪的极端两极分化。[4]而这种两极分化还伴随着对过时量化预测的更大偏好。

Long-range modeling of complex systems often relies on producing a fan of possible outcomes constrained by plausible extremes. Apocalypse and singularity offer two absolutes: our future will have to lie somewhere within that all-encompassing range. What has been so remarkable about modern anticipations of the future is how they have gravitated—despite all of the available evidence—toward one of these two extremes. In the past, this tendency toward dichotomy was often described as the clash of catastrophists and cornucopians, but these labels appear to be too timid to reflect the recent extreme polarization of sentiments.[4] And this polarization has been accompanied by a greater propensity for dated quantitative forecasts.

从汽车（到2040年全球电动乘用车销量将达到5600万辆）和碳排放（欧盟将在2050年实现净零碳排放）到全球航空（到2037年全球旅客人数将达到82亿），到处都能看到这类预测。[5]至少我们被告知是这样。但实际上，这些预测大多不过是简单的猜测：任何基于可疑假设的计算机模型得出的2050年数据——或者更糟糕的是，任何出于政治权宜之计而做出的预测——都很快就会过时。我的建议是：如果你想更好地了解未来可能的样子，那就完全避开这些过时的“新时代预言”，或者仅仅将它们视为反映当前普遍预期和偏见的证据。

You see them everywhere, from cars (worldwide sales of electric passenger vehicles will reach 56 million by 2040) and carbon (the EU will have net-zero carbon emissions by 2050) to global flying (there will be 8.2 billion travelers by 2037).[5] Or so we’re told. In reality, most of these forecasts are no better than simple guesses: any number for 2050 obtained by a computer model primed with dubious assumptions—or, even worse, by a politically expedient decision—has a very brief shelf life. My advice: if you would like a better understanding of what the future may look like, avoid these new-age dated prophecies entirely, or use them primarily as evidence of prevailing expectations and biases.

几代以来，企业和政府一直是预测领域最常见的实践者和消费者；从20世纪50年代开始，学术界也大量涌入；而现在，任何人都可以成为预测者——即使没有任何数学技能——只需使用插件软件，或者（像最近流行的那样）做出毫无根据的定性预测。正如许多其他新兴领域（信息流动、大众教育）一样，现代预测的数量与其质量成反比。许多预测只不过是对过去轨迹的最简单延伸；另一些则是复杂交互式模型的结果，这些模型包含大量变量，并且每次运行都使用不同的假设（本质上是叙事情景的数值版本）；还有一些预测几乎没有任何量化成分，仅仅是一厢情愿且极其政治正确的叙事。

For generations, businesses and governments were the most common practitioners and consumers of forecasting, then academics joined the game in large numbers from the 1950s, and now anybody can be a forecaster—even without any mathematical skills—simply by using plug-in software or (as has been in vogue lately) by making baseless qualitative predictions. As in so many other cases of newly expanded endeavors (information flows, mass education), the quantity of modern forecasting has become inversely proportional to its quality. Many forecasts are nothing but the simplest extensions of past trajectories; others are the outcome of complicated interactive models which incorporate large numbers of variables and run using different assumptions each time (essentially the numerical equivalent of narrative scenarios); and some have hardly any quantitative component and are just wishful and exceedingly politically correct narratives.

定量预测大致可分为三类。最小的一类预测涉及的流程运作机制众所周知，其动态变化本质上仅限于相对有限的结果集。第二类，也是规模更大的一类，包括指向正确方向但仍存在诸多不确定性的预测。关于具体结果的不确定性。第三类（我在前一章已经描述过一些近期能源和环境领域的案例）是量化寓言：这类预测练习可能充斥着大量数字，但这些数字是层层叠加（且往往值得商榷）的假设的结果，而这类计算机模拟的“童话故事”所描绘的过程在现实世界中往往会有截然不同的结局。当然，它们的创造者可能会捍卫这类练习的启发式价值，而缺乏经验的用户则可能利用某些结论来强化自身的偏见或否定其他合理的替代方案。

Quantitative forecasts fall into three broad categories. The smallest includes forecasts that deal with processes whose workings are well known and whose dynamics are inherently restricted to a relatively confined set of outcomes. The second, and a much larger category, includes forecasts pointing in the right direction but with substantial uncertainties regarding the specific outcome. And the third category (I already described some of its recent energy and environmental specimens in the previous chapter) is that of quantitative fables: such forecasting exercises may teem with numbers, but the numbers are outcomes of layered (and often questionable) assumptions, and the processes traced by such computerized fairy tales will have very different real-world endings. Of course, their creators may defend the heuristic value of such exercises, while uninitiated users may exploit some of the conclusions to reinforce their own prejudices or to dismiss plausible alternatives.

只有第一类预测（包括预测模型和计算机模型）才能提供可靠的见解和良好的指导，尤其是在展望未来十年左右的情况下。人口预测，特别是生育率预测，是这一有限类别中的最佳范例。以一个国家为例，该国的总和生育率——即女性一生中平均生育的子女数量——已经连续一代人低于人口更替水平（平均每位女性至少需要生育2.1个孩子才能满足人口更替要求），并且在过去十年中从1.8下降到1.5。如此低的生育率不太可能在未来十年内逆转（过去三十年中没有哪个国家做到这一点），从而带来人口的显著增长。[6]最有可能的情况是生育率略有回升（从1.5升至1.7）或进一步下降（至1.3）。虽然即使仅仅十年也无法精确确定具体数值，但预测可以提供一个相对较窄但高度合理的可能结果范围。例如，联合国 2019 年对 2030 年波兰人口的预测显示，波兰的总人口（2020 年为 3790 万）将下降到 3690 万，低值和高值预测值与平均值的偏差仅为 ±2%，而且（除非出现大规模移民，而这在这样一个排斥移民的国家不太可能发生），2030 年的实际人口数量很可能就在这个狭窄的范围内。[7]

Only the forecasts (projections, computer models) in the first category provide solid insights and good guidance, especially when looking only a decade or so ahead. Demographic projections in general, and fertility forecasts in particular, are among the best examples in this limited category. Take a country whose total fertility rate—that is, the number of children the average woman has in her lifetime—has been below the replacement level (an average of at least 2.1 children per woman is needed to replace the parents) for a generation and, moreover, retreated from 1.8 to 1.5 over the past decade. Such very low fertilities are unlikely to be reversed (no country has done so during the past three decades) to bring any substantial population increase within the next 10 years.[6] The most likely prospects are fertility that may recover a bit (from 1.5 to 1.7) or drop further (to 1.3). While it is impossible to pinpoint the value even in just 10 years, a forecast can offer a relatively narrow range of highly plausible outcomes. For example, the UN’s 2019 population forecast for the year 2030 has Poland’s total (37.9 million in 2020) declining to 36.9 million, with the low and high variant departing just ±2 percent from the mean, and (barring mass immigration that is unlikely in such an immigration-averse country) there is a very high probability that the actual 2030 count will be within that narrow range.[7]

相比之下，即使是涉及复杂系统的短期预测——这些预测反映了众多技术、经济和环境因素的相互作用，并且可能受到诸多任意决策的强烈影响，例如出乎意料的慷慨政府补贴、新法律或政策的突然逆转——仍然存在不确定性。高度不确定性，即使是短期展望也可能导致多种多样的结果。对全球电动乘用车普及率的预测就是近期此类情况的一个典型例子。[8]个人电动出行引入过程中遇到的技术难题并非不可克服，但该行业的成熟速度远低于其不加批判的支持者多年前所宣称的水平，而内燃机的效率却在不断提高，并且在未来几年内仍将提供更低的初始成本、几代人的熟悉度以及无处不在的维修服务等优势。[9]

In contrast, even short-term projections involving complex systems—those that reflect interplays of many technical, economic, and environmental factors, and which can be strongly affected by a number of arbitrary decisions such as unexpectedly generous government subsidies or new laws or sudden policy reversals—remain highly uncertain, and even near-term outlooks result in a broad range of possible outcomes. Forecasts for the worldwide adoption of electric passenger cars are an excellent recent example in this category.[8] Technical difficulties accompanying the introduction of personal electromobility have not been insurmountable, but the sector has been maturing much slower than its uncritical proponents began to claim years ago, while combustion engines keep improving their efficiency and will offer for years to come the advantages of lower initial cost, generations-long familiarity, and ubiquitous servicing.[9]

虽然一些国家积极推广电动汽车，提供丰厚的补贴或强制规定未来新车中电动汽车的具体比例，但其他国家提供的帮助却微乎其微，甚至根本没有提供任何帮助。因此，过去对全球道路交通电气化近期发展趋势的预测几乎一致高估了实际比例：2014年至2016年间，预测到2020年电动汽车占比将高达8%至11%，而实际比例仅为2.5%。[10]到2019年，对2030年电动汽车占所有道路车辆比例的预测结果相差一个数量级，而内燃机汽车的实际销量在未来十年内可能仍将超过电动汽车。[11]

And while some countries have been aggressively promoting electric car ownership by offering generous subsidies or by mandating specific shares of new vehicles in the future, others have offered only minor or no help. As a result, past near-term forecasts for the worldwide electrification of road transport have almost uniformly overestimated the actual share: between 2014 and 2016 it was put as high as 8–11 percent by 2020, while the actual share was just 2.5 percent.[10] And by 2019, forecasts for electrics as a share of all vehicles on the road by the year 2030 differed by an order of magnitude, while the actual sales of internal combustion vehicles may outnumber those of the electrics for more than a decade.[11]

第三类定量预测值得我们仔细审视，因为事后看来，其中许多预测不仅未能准确把握数量级，而且其断言和结论与实际情况完全不符。值得注意的是，这种情况不仅适用于从《圣经》到诺查丹玛斯等著名的历史预言。[12]许多现代预言家的表现也好不到哪里去，然而随着计算机技术的普及，他们的队伍不断壮大，而媒体对坏消息的渴求也使得他们的预测和设想获得了前所未有的传播和（日益全球化的）关注。

The third category of quantitative forecasts is the one that merits a closer look, because in retrospect many of them have not only failed to capture at least a proper order of magnitude but their claims and conclusions have turned out to be completely at odds with what actually happened. Remarkably, this is not only true of well-known historical prophecies ranging from the Bible to Nostradamus.[12] Many modern prophets have not done much better, yet with the rise of ubiquitous computing their ranks have swelled, and with the insatiable demand from the media for new bad news, their predictions and scenarios receive unprecedented distribution and (increasingly global) attention.

预测失败

Failed predictions

鉴于失败的预测数量众多，无论是按主题、年代还是地区进行系统性的回顾，都将是件枯燥乏味的事情。读者们……上了年纪的人或许还记得，我们本应早已完全（或至少大部分）依赖核能发电，协和式飞机只是未来超音速洲际航班普及的序幕，而千年虫问题本应在2000年1月1日导致所有计算机瘫痪。然而，通过快速回顾一些众所周知的案例，并简要解释一些鲜为人知的失败案例，我们可以对现实进行有益的检验——而且没有理由认为此类失误会减少。从相对简单的纸笔预测转向复杂的计算机模拟，虽然更容易进行必要的计算并生成不同的情景，但这并不能消除假设带来的必然风险。恰恰相反——更复杂的模型结合了经济、社会、技术和环境因素的相互作用，需要更多的假设，也更容易出现更大的误差。

Given the abundance of failed forecasts, their systematic recounting, be it by subject, decade, or region, would be tedious. Readers of a certain age will recall that by now we should have relied completely (or at least largely) on nuclear electricity, that Concorde was to be just a prelude to ubiquitous supersonic intercontinental flights, and that the Y2K glitch should have shut down all computing on January 1, 2000. But a combination of quick references to some well-known cases and brief explanations of some surprisingly little-appreciated failures provides a useful reality check—and there is no reason to assume that such misses will become less common. Moving from relatively simple pencil-and-paper forecasts to complex computerized scenarios makes it easier to perform the requisite calculations and to produce different scenarios, but it does not eliminate the inevitable perils of making assumptions. Just the opposite—more complex models combining the interactions of economic, social, technical, and environmental factors require more assumptions and open the way for greater errors.

回顾一些如今已成经典的预测失误，一个显而易见的切入点是考察“丰饶论者”和“灾难论者”之间的思想交锋。20世纪60年代人们对人口失控增长将超过现有资源所能承载的担忧，可以追溯到当时创纪录的、且仍在持续上升的全球人口增长率。数千年来，全球人口增长率一直低于百分之一；直到18世纪70年代才超过0.5%，到20世纪20年代中期超过1%，但到了20世纪50年代末，已接近2%，并且仍在加速增长。不可避免地，许多人在专业出版物和大众出版物中都注意到了这一点。1960 年，美国首屈一指的科学期刊《科学》也屈服于对人口无节制增长的担忧，发表了一项荒谬的计算，声称如果继续保持历史增长速度，到 2026 年 11 月 13 日，全球人口将无限快速增长。[13]

An obvious place to start when recounting some of the now-classic forecasting failures is to look at the intellectual duel between cornucopians and catastrophists. Concerns about runaway populations surpassing available means of sustenance voiced during the 1960s could be traced to the record, and at that time still rising, rates of global population growth. For millennia, global population growth was a small fraction of a percent; it rose above 0.5 percent only during the 1770s, above 1 percent by the mid-1920s, but by the late 1950s it was close to 2 percent and still accelerating. Inevitably, many people took notice, in both professional and popular publications, and in 1960 Science, America’s premier science periodical, succumbed to the worries about unrestrained population growth and published an absurd calculation claiming that the continuation of the historic rate of increase would result in infinitely rapid growth of the global population by November 13, 2026.[13]

这种结果——人类以无限的速度增长——需要一些想象力，但许多不那么极端、尽管同样带有灾难论色彩的预测，却帮助创建并推动了现代环境运动的发展。[14]但其实无需担心人口失控：灾难论者忽略了一个简单的事实，即在一个资源有限的星球上，任何形式的快速增长都不可能永远持续下去。“2026年世界末日”的预言显而易见。胡说八道。在 20 世纪 60 年代结束之前，全球人口增长率达到峰值，约为每年 2.1%，之后迅速下降：到 2000 年，全球人口增长率为 1.32%，到 2019 年仅为 1.08%。[15]

This outcome—humanity growing at infinite speed—takes some imagination, but many less extreme, although still catastrophist, predictions helped to create and mobilize the modern environmental movement.[14] But there was no need to fear runaway populations: catastrophists ignored a simple fact that no form of very rapid growth can go on forever on a finite planet. Doomsday 2026 was obvious nonsense. Before the 1960s ended, global population growth reached its peak at about 2.1 percent per year, and that peak was followed by fairly rapid decline: by the year 2000 the global rate was 1.32 percent, and by 2019 it was just 1.08 percent.[15]

50年间相对增长率减半，随后绝对增长率也随之下降（1987年达到峰值约9300万/年，到2020年下降至约8000万/年），这从根本上改变了人口前景，以至于在2020年代初期，世界人口将跨越一个重要的人口里程碑，届时将有一半人口生活在总和生育率低于更替水平的国家。[16]这一新现实立即引发了新的灾难性预测。如果生育率下降的趋势持续下去，全球人口何时停止增长？然后，不可避免地，最后一位智人何时会灭绝？一位年轻的灾难论者或许会再次推测，在2080年代，将有多少人死于饥饿——并非因为人口失控增长，而是因为随着人口老龄化和萎缩，即使经过大规模机器人化，劳动年龄人口也不足以养活全人类。

The halving of the relative growth rate in 50 years, and the subsequent decline of the absolute growth rate (it peaked at about 93 million a year in 1987, declined to about 80 million by 2020), changed the outlook so fundamentally that sometime during the early 2020s the world’s population will cross a significant demographic milestone as half of it will be living in countries whose total fertility rate is below the replacement level.[16] This new reality immediately invites new catastrophic calculations. If this trend of falling fertility were to continue, when will the global population stop growing? And then, inevitably, when will the last Homo sapiens die? And a young catastrophist could speculate again about how many millions of people will die of hunger (during the 2080s?)—not because of runaway growth but because, as populations age and shrink everywhere, there will not be (even after intensive robotization) enough people of working age to feed humanity.

关于资源匮乏的世界末日预言并非仅限于粮食：矿产资源枯竭也是灾难性预言中常见的主题，而原油——20世纪文明最重要的能源——的未来更是反乌托邦预言的热门话题。关于石油开采即将达到峰值的预测可以追溯到20世纪20年代，但在20世纪90年代和21世纪的第一个十年里，这种预测达到了前所未有的恐慌程度。[17]一些石油峰值论的坚定拥护者认为，石油开采量的下降不仅会导致现代经济的崩溃，还会使人类的生活方式倒退回远低于工业化前水平，甚至回到旧石器时代狩猎采集者的生活方式——回到200万年前生活在东非的原始人类的生活方式。[18]

End-of-the-world prophecies concerning resource scarcity have not been limited to food: running out of mineral resources has been another favorite subject of catastrophic visions, and the future of crude oil, the most important energy source of 20th-century civilization, has been a favorite topic of dystopic prophecies. Forecasts of imminent peak oil extraction go back to the 1920s, but they reached new heights of existential fear-mongering during the 1990s and the first decade of the 21st century.[17] Some committed members of the peak oil cult believed that declining oil extraction would not only bring about the collapse of modern economies but that it would return humanity to a lifestyle far below its preindustrial levels, all the way to that of Paleolithic foragers—to hominins who lived in East Africa 2 million years ago.[18]

那么实际情况如何呢？灾难论者一直很难想象人类的智慧能够满足未来对食物、能源和物质的需求——但在过去三代人的时间里，尽管自 1950 年以来全球人口增加了两倍，我们仍然做到了这一点。低收入国家营养不良人口的比例一直在稳步下降，从20世纪60年代的约40%降至2019年的约11%，而非出现大规模死亡。中国作为世界人口最多的国家，其人均每日食物供应量目前比日本高出约15%。[19]氮肥的使用量自1975年以来增长了2.5倍以上，而非出现严重的化肥短缺，全球主要谷物作物的产量也增长了约2.2倍。[20]原油方面，1995年至2019年间其总开采量增长了三分之二，2019年底其新冠疫情前的价格（按不变价格计算）低于2009年的水平。[21]灾难论者一次又一次地错了。

And what has actually happened? Catastrophists have always had a hard time imagining that human ingenuity can meet future food, energy, and material needs—but during the past three generations we have done so despite a tripling of the global population since 1950. Instead of megadeaths, the share of undernourished people in low-income countries has been steadily declining, from about 40 percent during the 1960s to only about 11 percent by 2019, and average daily per capita food supply in China, the world’s most populous nation, is now about 15 percent higher than in Japan.[19] Instead of desperate fertilizer shortfalls, the application of nitrogenous fertilizers has increased more than 2.5 times since 1975, and the global harvest of staple cereal crops is now about 2.2 times larger.[20] As for crude oil, its total extraction rose by two-thirds between 1995 and 2019, and at the end of that year its pre-COVID-19 price (in constant monies) was lower than it was in 2009.[21] Catastrophists are wrong, time after time.

而那些承诺提供无穷无尽、近乎奇迹般解决方案的技术乐观主义者，也必须正视他们同样糟糕的记录。其中最著名（且有充分证据支持，令人尴尬）的失败案例之一，便是对核裂变无所不能的迷信。许多人意识到，核能发电取得的部分成功（2019年核电约占全球发电量的10%，其中美国占比20%，法国则高达72%左右）仅仅是1980年以前人们普遍预期的一小部分。[22]当时，顶尖科学家和大型企业不仅认为核裂变将彻底取代所有其他发电方式，还相信早期的反应堆将被能够（暂时）产生比自身消耗更多能量的快中子增殖反应堆所取代。人们对核能的期望远远超出了发电范畴，一些令人匪夷所思的、极其可疑的想法甚至被投入了巨资进行测试或研究。

And techno-optimists, who promise endless near-miraculous solutions, must reckon with a similarly poor record. One of the best-known (and embarrassingly well-documented) failures has been the belief in the all-encompassing power of nuclear fission. Many people appreciate that the partial success achieved by nuclear generation (it produced about 10 percent of the world’s electricity in 2019, with shares at 20 percent in the US and, exceptionally, about 72 percent in France) is just a fraction of what was widely expected before 1980.[22] At that time, leading scientists and large companies not only thought that nuclear fission would eliminate all other forms of electricity generation, they also believed that the original reactors would be largely displaced by fast breeders able to produce (temporarily) more energy than they consumed. The nuclear promise went far beyond electricity generation, and some astonishingly dubious ideas were tested or expensively investigated.

究竟哪个决定更不理智，从一开始就注定失败：是追求核动力飞行，还是利用核爆炸辅助天然气生产？设计一个能为潜艇提供动力的小型核反应堆是一回事，但要让它轻到可以飞行却成了一项无法克服的挑战——然而，在耗费了数十亿美元之后，这项看似徒劳无功的任务最终在1961年被放弃。[23]虽然没有一架核裂变动力飞机真正起飞，但为了扩大天然气产量，却引爆了数枚核弹。其中一枚29千吨级的原子弹（威力是投掷在广岛原子弹的两倍多）在……被引爆。1967年12月，在新墨西哥州约1.2公里深处进行了一次核试验（代号“汽油车计划”）；1969年9月，在科罗拉多州进行了一次40千吨级核弹的试验；1973年，同样在科罗拉多州进行了三次33千吨级核弹的试验；美国原子能委员会预计未来每年将进行40至50次核弹爆炸。[24]此外，还有利用核爆炸开挖新港口以及利用核反应堆为太空飞行提供动力等计划。

Which decision was more irrational and more doomed from the very start: the pursuit of nuclear-powered flight, or natural gas production assisted by nuclear explosions? Designing a small nuclear reactor that could power submarines was one thing, making it light enough to be airborne turned out to be an insurmountable challenge—but one that was abandoned only in 1961 after spending billions of dollars on this hopeless task.[23] No plane powered by nuclear fission ever took off, but several nuclear bombs were detonated in the quest for expanded natural gas production. A 29-kiloton bomb (more than twice as powerful as the one dropped on Hiroshima) was detonated in December 1967 at a depth of about 1.2 kilometers in New Mexico (code name Project Gasbuggy); in September 1969 came a 40-kiloton bomb in Colorado; in 1973 three 33-kiloton bombs, also in Colorado; and the US Atomic Energy Commission anticipated future detonations of 40–50 bombs a year.[24] There were also plans for such activities as using nuclear explosives to carve out new harbors, and using nuclear reactors to power space flight.

半个世纪过去了，情况几乎没有改变：骇人的预言和完全不切实际的承诺层出不穷。最近一波愈演愈烈的灾难论主要集中在环境恶化问题上，尤其关注全球气候变化。记者和活动家们纷纷撰文预言气候末日即将到来，发出最后的警告。他们认为，未来最适宜人类居住的地区将会缩小，地球上的大片区域很快就会变得不适宜居住，气候移民将重塑美国乃至世界，全球平均收入将大幅下降。一些预言声称，我们可能只剩下大约十年的时间来避免一场全球灾难，而格蕾塔·通贝里在2020年1月甚至明确指出只有八年时间。[25]

Little has changed half a century later: frightening prophecies and utterly unrealistic promises abound. The latest burst of intensified catastrophism has been focused on environmental degradation in general and on concerns about global climate change in particular. Journalists and activists write about climate apocalypse now, issuing final warnings. In the future, areas best suited for human habitation will shrink, large areas of the Earth are to become uninhabitable soon, climate migration will reshape America and the world, average global income will decline substantially, some prophecies claim that we might only have about a decade left to avert a global catastrophe, and in January 2020 Greta Thunberg went as far as to specify just eight years.[25]

仅仅几个月后，联合国大会主席就给了我们11年的时间来避免一场彻底的社会崩溃，届时地球将同时遭受燃烧（持续整个夏季的熊熊烈火）和洪水（海平面迅速上升）的双重威胁。然而，正如古语所说，“太阳之下无新事”：1989年，另一位联合国高级官员表示，“各国政府只有10年的时间来解决温室效应问题，否则它将超出人类的控制范围”，这意味着我们现在恐怕早已超越了“超出”的范畴，我们的存在或许仅仅只是博尔赫斯式想象的一部分。[26]我确信，我们完全可以摆脱这种持续不断的、令人担忧且常常令人恐惧的预测。每天都被告知世界将在2050年甚至2030年终结，这究竟有什么用呢？

Just a few months later, the president of the UN’s General Assembly gave us 11 years to avert a complete social collapse whereupon the planet will be simultaneously burning (suffering unquenchable summer-long fires) and inundated with water (via a rapid sea-level rise). But, nihil novi sub sole: in 1989, another high UN official said that “governments have a 10-year window of opportunity to solve the greenhouse effect before it goes beyond human control,” which means that by now we must be quite beyond the beyond, and that our very existence might be only a matter of Borgesian imagination.[26] I am convinced that we could do without this continuing flood of never-less-than-worrisome and too-often-quite-frightening predictions. How helpful is it to be told every day that the world is coming to an end in 2050 or even 2030?

这种老生常谈的预言（无论其出发点多么良好，表达方式多么热情洋溢）并没有就如何部署最佳技术方案、如何以最有效的方式开展具有法律约束力的全球合作提供任何切实可行的建议。关于如何说服民众接受巨额支出这一艰巨挑战，而这些支出的益处要几十年后才能显现，这无疑是一个难题。当然，在那些认为“可持续的未来触手可及”的人看来，这些支出完全没有必要。他们认为，灾难论者长期以来一直在制造虚假警报，他们的作品标题是《世界末日不会到来！》和《世界末日永不来临》，而且，与文明即将走向终结的说法截然相反，他们甚至（如前所述）认为奇点并不遥远。[27]

Such predictably repetitive prophecies (however well-meant and however passionately presented) do not offer any practical advice about the deployment of the best possible technical solutions, about the most effective ways of legally binding global cooperation, or about tackling the difficult challenge of convincing populations of the need for significant expenditures whose benefits will not be seen for decades to come. And they are, of course, quite unnecessary according to those who argue that a “sustainable future is within our grasp,” that the catastrophists have a long history of raising false alarms, who title their writings Apocalypse Not! and Apocalypse Never, and, in the starkest contradistinction to civilization’s supposedly rapidly approaching final curtain, even go as far (as already noted) as seeing a not-too-distant Singularity.[27]

我们为何还要惧怕任何事物——无论是环境、社会还是经济威胁——因为到2045年，甚至可能到2030年，我们的认知（或者更确切地说，是我们创造的机器所释放的智能）将无限广阔，任何问题都将变得微不足道？与此相比，近期任何其他具体而夸张的断言——从纳米技术拯救世界到创造新的合成生命形式——都显得苍白无力。未来究竟会如何？是迫在眉睫的近乎地狱般的毁灭，还是光速般的神力？

Why should we fear anything—be it environmental, social, or economic threats—when by 2045, or perhaps even by 2030, our understanding (or rather the intelligence unleashed by the machines we will have created) will know no bounds and hence any problem will become immeasurably less than trivial? Compared to this promise, any other recent specific and intemperate claim—from salvation through nanotechnology to fashioning new synthetic forms of life—appears trite. What will happen? An imminent near-infernal perdition, or speed-of-light godlike omnipotence?

根据以往预言的谬误来看，答案是否定的。我们并没有达到20世纪70年代初人们所设想的那种文明——那种星球饥饿日益加剧的文明，或是那种依靠零成本核裂变提供能量的文明——一代人之后，我们既不会走到进化的尽头，也不会经历奇点带来的文明变革。到了2030年代，我们依然会存在，尽管无法享受到光速智能带来的难以想象的益处。我们仍然会尝试去做不可能的事：做出长远预测。这必然会带来更多尴尬和更多荒谬的预测，以及更多由意想不到的事件造成的意外。极端情况比较容易设想；但预测由惯性发展和不可预测的断裂共同作用而产生的现实，仍然是一项难以捉摸的挑战。再多的建模也无法消除这种不确定性，我们的长远预测也将继续出错。[28]

Based on the revealed delusions of past prophecies, neither. We do not have a civilization envisioned in the early 1970s—one of worsening planetary hunger or one energized by cost-free nuclear fission—and a generation from now we will not be either at the end of our evolutionary path or have a civilization transformed by Singularity. We will still be around during the 2030s, albeit without the unimaginable benefits of speed-of-light intelligence. And we will still be trying to do the impossible, to make long-range forecasts. That is bound to bring more embarrassments and more ridiculous predictions, as well as more surprises caused by unanticipated events. Extremes are fairly easy to envisage; anticipating realities that will arise from combinations of inertial developments and unpredictable discontinuities remains an elusive quest. No amount of modeling will eliminate that, and our long-range predictions will continue to err.[28]

这并非自相矛盾，也不是为了否定未来的预测，而是基于复杂系统固有惯性及其内在常数和长期必然性之间不可预见的相互作用，得出的一个极有可能（甚至必然）的结论。一方面，是突如其来的断裂和意外——无论是技术上的（消费电子产品的兴起；储能技术的潜在突破），还是社会上的（苏联解体；另一场更具传染性的疫情）。所有预测之所以更加困难，是因为如今关键的变革必须在巨大的规模上展开。

This is not a contradiction, not a forecast to dismiss future forecasts, just a highly probable, if not inevitable, conclusion based on the unforeseeable interplay of the inherent inertia of complex systems, with their embedded constants and long-term imperatives on one hand, and sudden discontinuities and surprises—be they technical (the rise of consumer electronics; possible breakthroughs in electricity storage) or social (the collapse of the USSR; another, much more virulent pandemic)—on the other. What makes all forecasts even harder is that now the key transformations have to unfold on enormous scales.

惯性、尺度和质量

Inertia, scale, and mass

新的尝试、新的解决方案和新的成就始终伴随着我们：我们是一个求知欲极强的物种，拥有卓越的长期适应能力，近年来更是取得了令人瞩目的成就，使世界大部分人口的生活更加健康、富裕、安全和长寿。然而，一些根本性的制约因素依然存在：我们凭借智慧改变了其中一些，但这种调整也存在局限性。例如，我们无法消除粮食生产对土地、水和养分的需求。正如我们所见，更高的产量降低了对耕地的需求，如果我们能够进一步缩小产量差距（潜在产量与实际产量之间的差异），那么对耕地的需求还可以进一步降低。

New departures, new solutions, and new achievements are always with us: we are a very inquisitive species with a remarkable long-term record of adaptation and with even more remarkable recent accomplishments in making the lives of most of the world’s population healthier, richer, safer, and longer. Still, fundamental constraints also persist: we have changed some of them through our ingenuity, but such adjustments have their own limits. For example, we cannot eliminate the need for land, water, and nutrients in food production. As we have seen, higher yields reduced the demand for farmland and further reductions are possible if we succeed in the further closing of yield gaps (the differences between yield potential and actual harvests).

这些差距依然巨大。即使在实行集约化作物种植（大量使用化肥和灌溉）的国家，美国玉米的产量也能比近期平均水平提高20%至25%，中国水稻的产量也能提高30%至40%——而由于撒哈拉以南非洲地区的平均单产仍然很低，其产量可能达到上述地区的2至4倍。[29]对于高产且已优化的农业而言，减少耕地面积只需相对较少的额外化肥和灌溉需求即可实现。相比之下，非洲则需要大幅增加平均大量营养元素的施用量并扩大灌溉范围。正如在许多其他情况下一样，只要世界人口持续增长，只要人们对更好营养的需求持续存在，未来绩效的相对提升（在生物限度内）就不应被误认为是产出和投入变量的绝对脱钩。

These gaps remain substantial. Even in countries that practice intensive crop cultivation (the high use of fertilizers, irrigation), the yields could go up 20–25 percent above the recent average for US corn, and 30–40 percent for Chinese rice—and, because of its still very low average productivity, they could be two to four times as high in sub-Saharan Africa.[29] In the case of high-yielding and already optimized agricultures, the resulting reduction of cropped land could be achieved with relatively small additional demands for fertilizer and irrigation. In contrast, Africa will demand substantial increases in average macronutrient applications and in the extension of irrigation. As in so many other instances, relative gains in future performance (within biological limits) should not be mistaken for an absolute decoupling of output and input variables, as long as the world’s population continues to grow and as long as it demands better nutrition.

在这方面，媒体关于“无地”都市农业——即高层建筑中的水培种植——的报道尤其缺乏对全球粮食需求的真正理解。这种高投入的种植方式可以生产一些绿叶蔬菜（如生菜、罗勒）和部分蔬菜（如西红柿、辣椒），其营养价值几乎完全体现在维生素C和膳食纤维含量上。[30]可以肯定的是，在持续光照下进行水培种植根本无法生产超过30亿吨的谷物和豆类，而这些谷物和豆类富含碳水化合物，蛋白质和脂肪含量也相对较高，正是养活近80亿（即将达到100亿）人口所必需的。[31]

In this regard, media reports about “land-less” urban agriculture—hydroponic cultivation in high-rises—are particularly devoid of any real understanding of global food demand. Such high-input operations can produce leafy greens (lettuces, basil) and some vegetables (tomatoes, peppers) whose nutritional value is almost solely in their vitamin C content and roughage.[30] Most assuredly, hydroponic cultivation under constant lights could not be deployed to produce more than 3 billion tons of cereal and leguminous grains, whose high carbohydrate content and relatively high protein and lipid supply are required to feed nearly 8 (soon to be 10) billion people.[31]

大型复杂系统的惯性源于其基本的能源和物质需求，以及其运行规模。对能源和物质的需求不断受到提高效率和优化生产工艺的追求的影响，但效率的提升和相对减少物质的使用存在物理极限，新替代方案带来的优势必然伴随着相应的成本。此类现实的例子不胜枚举。再次回到两个基本投入要素，生产钢铁（包括高炉和碱性氧气转炉的需求）所需的理论最低一次能源约为每吨铁水18吉焦耳，而合成氨所需的能量至少约为每吨21吉焦耳。[32]

The inertia of large, complex systems is due to their basic energetic and material demands—as well as the scale of their operations. Demands for energy and materials are constantly affected by the quest for higher efficiencies and for optimized production processes, but efficiency improvements and relative dematerialization have their physical limits, and advantages brought by new alternatives will have offsetting costs. Examples of such realities abound. Turning, once again, to two fundamental inputs, the theoretical minimum of primary energy needed to produce steel (combining blast furnace and basic oxygen furnace demands) is about 18 gigajoules per ton of hot metal, and ammonia cannot be synthesized from its elements with less than about 21 gigajoules per ton.[32]

一种可能的解决方案是用铝代替钢。这可以降低特定设计的重量，但生产原铝所需的能源是原钢的五到六倍，而且在许多需要钢材更高强度的应用中，原铝无法使用。降低能源成本和氮肥对环境影响的最根本方法是减少氮肥的使用量：对于粮食供应​​过剩和浪费严重的富裕国家来说，这是一个可行的选择——但数亿发育迟缓的儿童，主要集中在非洲，需要喝更多的牛奶，吃更多的肉，而这些蛋白质只能通过大幅增加作物中的氮肥用量来获得。为了更清楚地说明这一点，欧盟农田每年平均每公顷施用约160公斤化肥，而埃塞俄比亚不到20公斤，这数量级的差异说明了巨大的差距。发展差距在评估全球需求时常常被忽视。[33]

One possible solution is to replace steel with aluminum. This lowers the mass of a specific design, but primary aluminum requires five to six times more energy to produce than primary steel, and it cannot be used in many applications that require steel’s much greater strength. The most radical way to cut energy costs and the environmental impact of nitrogen fertilizers is to reduce how much is used: that option is available to affluent countries with their excessive food supply and waste—but hundreds of millions of stunted children, mostly in Africa, need to drink more milk and eat more meat, and that protein can come only from substantially increasing the amount of nitrogen they use in cropping. Just to drive this conclusion home, annual applications of fertilizers average about 160 kilograms per hectare of agricultural land in the EU and less than 20 kilograms in Ethiopia, an order-of-magnitude difference illustrating the huge development gap that is so often ignored in appraisals of global needs.[33]
