在一个基本生活必需品生产服务于近80亿人口的文明中，任何对既有做法的偏离都会反复受到规模限制：正如我们已经看到的（在第三章中），如今基本物质需求量以每年数十亿吨甚至数亿吨计。这使得我们既无法用完全不同的商品来替代如此巨大的需求——超过40亿吨的水泥或近20亿吨的钢铁该如何替代？——也无法在短时间内（几年而非几十年）过渡到全新的生产方式来生产这些必需品。

And in a civilization where production of essential commodities now serves nearly 8 billion people, any departure from established practices also runs repeatedly into the constraints of scale: as we have already seen (in chapter 3), fundamental material requirements are now measured in billions and hundreds of millions of tons per year. This makes it impossible either to substitute such masses for entirely different commodities—what would take the place of more than 4 billion tons of cement or nearly 2 billion tons of steel?—or to make a rapid (years rather than decades) transition to entirely new ways of producing these essential inputs.

这种大规模依赖关系的必然惯性最终是可以克服的（回想一下，在1920年之前，我们不得不将美国四分之一的农田用于种植马和骡子的饲料作物），但过去许多快速转变的例子并不能很好地指导我们推算未来任何成就所需的合理时间跨度。过去的转型之所以相对较快，可能是因为其规模相对较小。到1900年，世界一次能源消耗大致分为传统生物质能和以煤炭为主的化石燃料两部分，所有化石燃料的供应量仅相当于约10亿吨煤炭。[34]到2020年，全球化石燃料净供应量比1900年的一次能源总供应量高出一个数量级，尽管我们现在的技术手段在很多方面都更加先进，但新转型（脱碳）的速度却比化石燃料取代传统生物质能的速度要慢。

This inevitable inertia of mass-scale dependencies can eventually be overcome (recall that, before 1920, we had to devote a quarter of American farmland to feed crops for horses and mules), but many past examples of rapid shifts are not good guides for deriving plausible time spans for any future accomplishments. Past transitions may have been relatively fast because the magnitudes involved were comparatively small. By 1900 the world’s primary energy use was roughly split between traditional biomass and fossil fuels dominated by coal, and all fossil fuels supplied an equivalent of only about 1 billion tons of coal.[34] By the year 2020, the net global supply of fossil fuels was an order of magnitude higher than the total primary energy supply in 1900, and although our technical means are now in so many ways superior, the pace of the new transition (decarbonization) has been slower than the pace of displacing traditional biomass by fossil fuels.

尽管21世纪前20年，新型可再生能源（风能、太阳能、新型生物燃料）的供应量出现了令人瞩目的增长，增长了约50倍，但世界对化石燃料的依赖程度仅略有下降，从占总供应量的87%降至85%，而这一相对较小的下降主要归因于水力发电的扩张，而水力发电是一种较为传统的可再生能源。[35]由于1920年的总能源需求比2020年低一个数量级，因此在20世纪初用煤炭替代木材比在21世纪初用新型可再生能源替代化石燃料（即实现脱碳）要容易得多。结果是，即使将近期的脱碳速度提高三倍或四倍，到 2050 年化石碳仍将占据主导地位。

Even though the supply of new renewables (wind, solar, new biofuels) rose impressively, about 50-fold, during the first 20 years of the 21st century, the world’s dependence on fossil carbon declined only marginally, from 87 percent to 85 percent of the total supply, and most of that small relative decline was attributable to expanded hydroelectricity generation, an old form of renewable energy.[35] Because the total energy demand was an order of magnitude lower in 1920 than it was in 2020, it was much easier to displace wood by coal in the early 20th century than it is to displace fossil fuels by new renewables (that is, to decarbonize) in the early 21st century. As a result, even a tripling or quadrupling of the recent pace of decarbonization would still leave fossil carbon dominant by 2050.

范畴错误——即错误地将本应只属于其他范畴的事物所具有的特质或行为赋予某事物——是导致人们常常得出却又大错特错的结论的根源，这种结论认为，在这个全新的、电子化的世界里，一切都可以而且将会运转得更快。[36]信息和连接的确如此，新型个人设备的普及也是如此——但生存必需品并不属于微处理器和手机的范畴。确保充足的水源供应、种植和加工农作物、饲养和屠宰牲畜、生产和转化大量的初级能源，以及提取和加工原材料以满足各种用途，这些活动的规模（满足数十亿消费者的需求）和基础设施（保障这些不可替代需求的生产和分配）都与创建新的社交媒体账号或购买更昂贵的智能手机截然不同。

A category mistake—erroneously assigning to something a quality or action that is properly attributable only to things of another category—is behind the frequent, but deeply mistaken, conclusion that in this new, electronically enabled world everything can, and will, move much faster.[36] Information and connections do so, and so does the adoption of new personal gadgets—but existential im-peratives do not belong to the category of microprocessors and mobile phones. Securing the sufficient delivery of water, growing and processing crops, feeding and slaughtering animals, producing and converting enormous quantities of primary energies, and extracting and altering raw materials to fit a myriad of uses are endeavors whose scales (required to meet the demand of billions of consumers) and infrastructures (that enable the production and distribution of these irreplaceable needs) belong to categories that are quite distinct from making a new social media profile or buying a more expensive smartphone.

此外，许多促成这些新进展的技术其实并不新。有多少人被最新款智能手机的轻薄和强大的信息处理能力所吸引，却不知道许多使智能手机普及成为可能的基础工艺其实由来已久？高纯度硅是所有微处理器的基础，包括驱动所有现代电子设备（从最大的超级计算机到最小的移动电话）的微处理器。早在1915年，扬·乔赫拉尔斯基就发现了单晶硅的生长方法。大量的晶体管被​​集成到硅中，朱利叶斯·埃德加·利连菲尔德于1925年获得了第一个场效应晶体管的专利。而且，正如前文所述，集成电路诞生于1958-1959年，微处理器则诞生于1971年。[37]

Moreover, many techniques that enable these new advances are hardly new. How many people smitten by the thinness of the latest smartphone and by its ability to process information are aware that many fundamental processes that make their mass ownership possible are fairly long in the tooth? Very pure silicon is the basis of all microprocessors, including those that run all modern electronic devices—from the largest supercomputers to the smallest mobile phone—and Jan Czochralski discovered how to grow single silicon crystals in 1915. Large numbers of transistors are built into silicon, and Julius Edgar Lilienfeld patented the first field-effect transistor in 1925. And, as already detailed, integrated circuits were born in 1958–1959, and microprocessors in 1971.[37]

为所有电子设备供电的大部分电力是由蒸汽轮机（查尔斯·A·帕森斯于1884年发明）或燃气轮机（第一台燃气轮机于1938年投入商业应用）产生的。[38]虽然一代人的时间里，用移动电话取代十亿条固定电话线路是可能的，但用光伏发电取代蒸汽轮机和燃气轮机中安装的数太瓦级电力是不可能的。在类似的时间跨度内，电池或风力涡轮机也取得了类似的成就。移动设备虽然复杂，但它们只是庞大电力产业金字塔顶端的小型设备，这个产业涉及电力的生产、转换和传输，而建设、重建和维护都需要大规模的基础设施。

Most of the electricity that energizes all electronic gadgets is generated by steam turbines, machines invented by Charles A. Parsons in 1884, or by gas turbines, with the first one commercially deployed in 1938.[38] While it has been possible to replace a billion landlines by mobile phones within a generation, it will not be possible to replace terawatts of power installed in steam and gas turbines by photovoltaic cells or wind turbines within a similar time span. Mobiles, as complex as they are, are just small devices at the apex of an enormous pyramid of an industry that generates, transforms, and transmits electricity, and that requires mass-scale infrastructure to build, rebuild, and maintain.

这些现实有助于解释，尽管关于各种先进创新层出不穷，从太阳能电池到锂离子电池，从3D打印万物（从微型零件到整栋房屋）到能够合成汽油的细菌，未来20-30年我们生活的基本面不会发生剧烈变化。钢铁、水泥、氨和塑料仍将作为文明的四大支柱；世界交通运输的大部分仍将依赖精炼液体燃料（汽车汽油和柴油、航空煤油以及船舶用柴油和燃料油）；农田仍将由拖拉机牵引犁、耙、播种机和施肥机耕作，并由联合收割机将谷物装入卡车。高层公寓不会由巨型机器现场打印出来，而且如果我们很快再次遭遇疫情，那么备受吹捧的人工智能的作用很可能像在 2020 年 SARS-CoV-2 疫情期间一样令人失望。[39]

These realities help to explain why the fundamentals of our lives will not change drastically in the coming 20–30 years, despite the near-constant flood of claims about superior innovations ranging from solar cells to lithium-ion batteries, from the 3-D printing of everything (from microparts to entire houses) to bacteria able to synthesize gasoline. Steel, cement, ammonia, and plastics will endure as the four material pillars of civilization; a major share of the world’s transportation will be still energized by refined liquid fuels (automotive gasoline and diesel, aviation kerosene, and diesel and fuel oil for shipping); grain fields will be cultivated by tractors pulling plows, harrows, seeders, and fertilizer applicators and harvested by combines spilling the grains into trucks. High-rise apartments will not be printed on site by gargantuan machines, and should we soon have another pandemic then the role of the much-touted artificial intelligence will most likely be as underwhelming as it was during the 2020 SARS-CoV-2 pandemic.[39]

无知、坚持和谦逊

Ignorance, persistence, and humility

新冠疫情以惨痛的代价，完美地提醒我们，我们掌控未来的能力有限，而且在未来一代人的时间里，这种情况也不会（也不可能）发生任何显著改变。这场最新的疫情爆发之前，曾有十年时间，人们对史无前例、所谓真正“颠覆性”的科学技术进步大加赞扬。其中最主要的，是人们期待人工智能和神经网络（可以说是“奇点”的简化版）以及基因组编辑的神奇力量即将投入使用，这将使人们能够随意改造生命体。[40]

COVID-19 has provided a perfect—and costly—global reminder of our limited capacity to chart our futures, and that, too, will not (cannot) change in any dramatic way during the coming generation. The latest pandemic came after a decade that was suffused with adulatory praise of unprecedented and supposedly truly “disruptive” scientific and technical advances. Chief among them have been the anticipation of imminent deployments of the miraculous powers of artificial intelligence and neural-learning networks (Singularity-lite, one might say) and genome editing that will make it possible to engineer life forms at will.[40]

没有什么比这更能概括这些说法的过激性了。尤瓦尔·赫拉利2017年的畅销书《未来简史》（Homo Deus）的书名也与此相关。[41]如果还需要更多证据，那么新冠疫情就暴露了我们所谓拥有神一般的能力来掌控命运的空洞幻想：那些被大肆吹捧的能力在阻止病毒RNA链的出现或控制其传播方面毫无用处。我们所能做的，就像中世纪意大利城镇的居民那样：远离他人，居家隔离40天，也就是所谓的“ quaranta giorni”（隔离40天）。[42]疫苗出现得相对较早，但它们既不能治愈患者，也不能预防下一次大流行。因此，我们只能祈祷下一次疫情（因为总会有下一次！）会在经历了数十年相对平静的季节性病毒流行之后到来，而不是在短短几年内以更具毒性的形式爆发。

Nothing sums up better the excessive nature of these claims than the title of a 2017 bestseller, Yuval Noah Harari’s Homo Deus.[41] And if more evidence is required, then COVID-19 exposed the emptiness of any notions of our supposed godlike capacity to control our fate: none of those much-touted capabilities was of any use in preventing the rise or controlling the diffusion of those viral RNA strands. The best we could do is what the residents of Italian towns did in the Middle Ages: stay away from others, stay inside for 40 days, isolate for quaranta giorni.[42] Vaccines came relatively early, but they do not cure the stricken and they do not prevent the next pandemic. And so we must pray that the next event (because there is always a next one!) will come only after decades of relatively uneventful seasonal viral epidemics, rather than in just a few years and in a much more virulent form.

新冠疫情对富裕国家（尤其是美国）的影响，也凸显了我们一些备受推崇（且耗资巨大）的未来塑造计划是多么的不切实际。其中最突出的包括：重启载人航天计划，特别是科幻小说中才会出现的火星探测任务；试图推进个性化医疗（根据患者的具体风险或疾病反应量身定制诊断和治疗方案），《经济学人》杂志在2020年3月12日就此主题发表了一篇专题报道，而此时新冠疫情正席卷欧洲和北美，导致城市医院人满为患，患者缺氧；以及对更快网络连接的过度追求，以及对5G网络优势的无休止宣传。[43]所有这些任务是多么的无关紧要啊，因为（正如老生常谈的那样）唯一剩下的超级大国都无法为其护士和医生提供足够的简单个人防护装备，包括手套、口罩、帽子和防护服等低技术物品。

COVID-19’s impact in rich countries in general, and in the United States in particular, also illustrates how misplaced some of our highly touted (and very expensive) future-forming endeavors have been. Foremost among these have been the renewed steps toward manned space flight, and particularly the sci-fi-type goal of missions to Mars; trying to move toward personalized medicine (diagnosis and treatment tailored to individual patients based on their specific risk or response to a disease), with The Economist running a special report on this topic on March 12, 2020, just as COVID-19 began to sweep through Europe and North America filling urban hospitals with oxygen-deprived people; and being preoccupied with ever-faster connectivity, with endless hype surrounding the benefits of 5G networks.[43] How irrelevant are all of these quests while (as the cliché goes) the only remaining superpower could not provide its nurses and doctors with enough simple personal protection equipment, including such low-tech items as gloves, masks, caps, and gowns?

因此，美国不得不向中国——这个全球化的杰出缔造者们几乎将所有必需品的生产都集中在的国家——支付高昂的价格，才能获得数量不足的防护装备空运，以防止疫情期间医院关闭。[44]这个每年军费开支超过五千亿美元（超过其所有潜在对手军费开支总和）的国家，对此毫无准备。一场必然发生的事件，却缺乏足够的基本医疗用品：投资数亿美元用于国内生产，本可以大大减少 COVID-19 造成的数万亿美元的经济损失！[45]

Consequently, the US had to pay exorbitant prices to China—the country where the brilliant architects of globalization concentrated nearly all of the manufacturing of these essential items—in order to secure airlifts of inadequate amounts of protective equipment just to prevent hospital closures in the midst of a pandemic.[44] The country that spends more than half a trillion every year on its military (more than all of its potential adversaries put together) was unprepared for an event that was absolutely certain to occur, and it did not have enough basic medical supplies: investment in domestic production worth a few hundred million dollars could have significantly reduced the economic losses of COVID-19, measured in the trillions![45]

欧洲也未能脱颖而出。成员国竞相从中国空运大量防护塑料；曾经引以为傲的“无边界”很快变成了戒备森严的壁垒；日益紧密的联盟未能做出任何全联盟范围内的协调应对；在疫情爆发的头六个月里，欧洲人口最多的五个国家中的四个（英国、法国、意大利和西班牙）以及最富裕的两个国家（瑞士和卢森堡）——它们的医疗体系几十年来一直被誉为典范——却记录了全球最高的疫情死亡率。[46]危机暴露了现实，揭开了掩盖和误导的面纱。富裕世界对新冠疫情的应对，只值得一句讽刺的话：真是“人神同在”！

Nor did Europe distinguish itself. Member states engaged in competition for jumbo airlifts of protective plastic from China; the vaunted absence of borders was quickly transformed into fortress arrangements; the ever-closer union failed to deliver any union-wide coordinated response; and during the first six months of the pandemic, four of the continent’s five most populous nations (UK, France, Italy, and Spain) and two of its richest countries (Switzerland and Luxembourg)—whose health systems were for decades praised as paragons of excellence—recorded some of the world’s highest pandemic mortalities.[46] Crises expose realities and strip away obfuscation and misdirection. The response of the affluent world to COVID-19 deserves a single ironic comment: Homo deus indeed!

与此同时，富裕国家对新冠疫情的反应也暴露出我们长期以来对基本现实缺乏现实感，甚至连创伤性的经历也容易被遗忘。新冠疫情爆发之初，我并不指望人们会从恰当的历史视角来看待这一挑战（在一个被推特主导的社会里，还能指望什么呢？），因此，当人们提及1918-1919年的流感时，我并不感到意外。那场流感造成了现代史上最高的、尽管全球范围内死亡人数仍存在很大不确定性的大流行死亡人数。[47]但是，正如我在关于风险的章节中已经提到的，自那时以来，我们经历了三次引人注目（且更容易理解）的事件，但它们并没有在我们的集体记忆中留下深刻的印记。

At the same time, the rich world’s reaction to COVID-19 illustrates our perennially unrealistic attitude to fundamental realities caused by forgetting even traumatic experiences. As the COVID-19 pandemic began to unfold I did not expect that this challenge would be set within proper historical perspectives (what else is to be expected in a society dominated by tweets?), and I was not surprised by references to the 1918–1919 influenza that caused the highest, albeit globally highly uncertain, number of pandemic deaths in modern history.[47] But, as I already noted in the chapter on risk, since that time we have lived through three notable (and much better understood) episodes and they have not left any deep imprint in our collective memory.

我已经提出了一些解释，但其他解释也合情合理。1957-1958年间超过一百万人的死亡（在大多数国家，死亡在6-9个月内逐渐发生）是否被人们透过二战时期更为惨重的伤亡来看待，而二战的惨痛记忆仍然清晰地留在所有成年人的脑海中？或者，我们的集体认知是否已经发生了如此巨大的变化，以至于我们无法接受暂时的过高死亡率永远是我们无法控制的事实？又或者，这仅仅是因为遗忘是记忆的必要补充，无论是在个人层面还是集体层面，而遗忘本身也终将消逝？我们不会改变，因为我们会一次又一次地对那些本应预料到的事情感到惊讶？

I already suggested some explanations, but others are plausible. Was the toll of more than a million deaths in 1957–1958 (in most countries taking place incrementally over 6–9 months) seen through the prism of much larger Second World War losses that were still clear in the memory of all adults? Or has our collective perception changed to such an extent that we cannot accept the fact that temporary excessive mortality will always be beyond our control? Or is it simply the fact that forgetting is an essential complement of remembering, be it on a personal or collective level, and that this, too, will not change as we will be, again and again, surprised by what should have been expected?

坚持与遗忘同样重要：尽管人们承诺新的开始和大胆的变革，但旧的模式和方法很快就会卷土重来，为新一轮的失败埋下伏笔。我请任何对此表示怀疑的读者回顾一下2007-2008年金融危机期间及之后的舆论，并将其与危机后的经验进行比较。究竟是谁应该为金融秩序的系统性崩溃负责？除了注入巨额资金之外，还采取了哪些根本性的变革来改革有问题的做法或减少经济不平等？[48]

Persistence is as important as forgetting: despite the promises of new beginnings and bold departures, old patterns and old approaches soon resurface to set the stage for another round of failures. I ask any readers who doubt this to check sentiments during and immediately after the great financial crisis of 2007–2008—and compare them with the post-crisis experience. Who has been found responsible for this systemic near collapse of the financial order? What fundamental departures (besides enormous injections of new monies) were taken to reform questionable practices or to reduce economic inequality?[48]

以新冠疫情为例，这种持续存在的模式意味着，没有人会为疫情爆发前就注定应对不力的诸多战略失误承担责任。毫无疑问，一些敷衍了事的听证会和几份智库报告会提出一系列建议，但这些建议很快就会被置之不理，对根深蒂固的习惯也无济于事。在1918-1919年、1958-1959年、1968-1969年和2009年的大流行病之后，世界采取了任何果断的措施吗？各国政府不会确保为未来的大流行病提供充足的物资，他们的应对措施也将一如既往地缺乏一致性，甚至更加混乱。大规模单一来源生产的利润不会被降低到风险更低但成本更高的分散式生产模式所取代。随着人们重返洲际航班和漫无目的的游轮，他们将继续频繁地进行全球性的社交活动。然而，很难想象还有比一艘载有 3000 名船员和 5000 名乘客（其中大部分是老年人，并且患有许多基础疾病）的船只更好的病毒培养皿。[49]

Returning to the COVID-19 example, this pattern of persistence means that nobody will ever be found responsible for any of the many strategic lapses that guaranteed the mismanagement of the pandemic even before it began. Undoubtedly, some desultory hearings and a few think-tank papers will produce a list of recommendations, but those will be promptly ignored and will make no difference to deeply ingrained habits. Did the world take any resolute steps after the pandemics of 1918–1919, 1958–1959, 1968–1969, and 2009? Governments will not ensure adequate provisions of needed supplies for a future pandemic, and their response will be as inconsistent—if not as incoherent—as ever. The profits of mass-scale single-source manufacturing will not be changed for less vulnerable but more expensive decentralized production. And people will resume their constant global mingling as they return to intercontinental flights and cruises to nowhere, although it is hard to imagine a better virus incubator than a ship with 3,000 crew, and 5,000 passengers who are often mostly elderly with many pre-existing health conditions.[49]

这也意味着我们需要一次又一次地重新学习如何接受我们无法掌控的现实。新冠疫情就是一个很好的例证。疫情导致老年人群的超额死亡率最高，而且正如前文所述，这一结果显然与我们成功延长预期寿命的努力密切相关。[50]我出生于1943年，是数千万受益于这一趋势的人之一——但我们不能两者兼得。方法：寿命延长的同时，脆弱性也会增加。不出所料，老年人常见的合并症——从相当常见的高血压和糖尿病到不太常见的癌症和免疫力下降——一直是病毒性死亡人数增加的最佳预测指标。[51]

This also means that we will need, again and again, to relearn how to reconcile ourselves to realities beyond our control. COVID-19 provides a useful reminder. The pandemic has caused the highest excessive mortality among the oldest cohorts and, as already noted, this outcome is obviously linked to our very successful efforts to extend life expectancy.[50] I, born in 1943, have been among the tens of millions of beneficiaries of this trend—but we cannot have it both ways: longer life expectancy will be accompanied by greater vulnerability. Not surprisingly, comorbidities of old age—ranging from fairly common hypertension and diabetes to less common forms of cancer and compromised immunity—have been the best predictors of excess viral mortality.[51]

然而，这并不会阻止我们像1968年或2009年那样，采取更多措施来延长预期寿命——然后又担忧这种追求可能带来的后果（即使在季节性流感流行期间，这种担忧也在一定程度上存在）。只不过下一次，风险将显著增加，因为自然衰老和寿命延长相结合，将大幅提高65岁以上人口的比例。联合国预测，到2050年，这一比例将上升约70%，在较富裕的国家，四分之一的人口将超过这个年龄。[52]到2050年，当一些国家三分之一的人口属于最脆弱群体时，我们该如何应对一场可能比新冠肺炎更具传染性的全球性流行病？

Yet this will not prevent us, as it did not in 1968 or 2009, taking more steps toward prolonging life expectancy—and then fearing the likely consequences of this quest (seen, to a lesser but still substantial extent, even during seasonal influenza epidemics). Except the next time, the risk will be significantly higher because the combination of natural aging and prolongation of life will greatly increase the share of people over 65 years of age. The UN projects that share rising by about 70 percent by 2050, and in better-off countries one person in four will be older than that.[52] How will we cope in 2050 with a pandemic that might be more infectious than COVID-19, when in some countries a third of the population is in the most vulnerable category?

这些现实驳斥了许多技术乐观主义者所宣扬的那种普遍的、自动的、根深蒂固的、不可避免的进步和持续改进的观念。无论是人类的进化还是历史，都不是一条永不停歇的上升之箭。没有可预测的轨迹，也没有确定的目标。我们对知识的不断积累以及对越来越多影响我们生活的变量（从足以养活全世界人口的粮食生产到预防以往危险传染病的高效疫苗接种）的控制能力，降低了整体生存风险，但并没有使许多生存危机变得更可预测或更容易应对。

These realities disprove any general, automatic, embedded, unavoidable idea of progress and constant improvement that has been promoted by many techno-optimists. Neither the evolution nor the history of our species is an ever-rising arrow. There are no predictable trajectories, no definite targets. The steadily accumulating mass of our understanding and the ability to control a growing number of variables that affect our lives (ranging from food production that is sufficient to feed the world’s entire population to highly effective inoculation that prevents previously dangerous infectious diseases) has lowered the overall risk of living, but it has not made many existential perils either more predictable or more manageable.

在一些关键时刻，我们之所以能够取得成功并避免最糟糕的后果，是因为我们具有先见之明、保持警惕并决心找到有效的解决方案。值得一提的例子包括：通过研发有效的疫苗根除脊髓灰质炎；通过制造更可靠的飞机和引入更好的飞行控制措施降低商业飞行的风险；通过适当的食品加工、冷藏和个人卫生等措施减少食源性病原体；以及将儿童白血病的发病率大幅降低。可治愈的疾病（通过化疗和干细胞移植）。[53]在其他情况下，我们无疑是幸运的：几十年来，我们避免了因错误或事故而导致的核对抗（自20世纪50年代以来，我们曾多次经历这两种情况），这不仅是因为内置的安全保障措施，也得益于那些结果可能截然不同的判断。[54]同样，也没有明确的迹象表明我们预防失败的能力一直在稳步提高。

In some critical instances, our successes and our abilities to avoid the worst outcomes have been due to being prescient, vigilant, and determined to find effective fixes. Notable examples range from eliminating polio (by developing effective vaccines) to lowering the risks of commercial flying (by building more reliable airplanes and introducing better flight control measures), from reducing food pathogens (by a combination of proper food processing, refrigeration, and personal hygiene) to making childhood leukemia a largely survivable illness (by chemotherapy and stem cell transplants).[53] In other cases, we have been undoubtedly lucky: for decades we have avoided nuclear confrontation caused by an error or accident (we have experienced both on several occasions since the 1950s), not only because of built-in safeguards but also thanks to judgments that could have gone either way.[54] Again, there are no clear indications that our ability to prevent failures has been uniformly increasing.

不幸的是，福岛核事故和波音737 MAX飞机事故正是此类失败的两个典型例子——两者都造成了大规模且持久的后果。2011年3月11日，地震和海啸袭击福岛第一核电站，东京电力公司为何损失了该核电站的三座反应堆？毕竟，在距离福岛第一核电站仅15公里左右的同一太平洋沿岸，同样遭受海啸袭击的福岛第二核电站却毫发无损。福岛第一核电站事故的后果包括：日本电力供应减少了30%；德国决定在2021年前关闭所有核反应堆；以及，最重要的是，公众对核裂变能源的信任度进一步下降。[55]

Fukushima and the Boeing 737 MAX are, unfortunately, two perfect examples of these failures—both with large-scale and lasting consequences. Why did the Tokyo Power Company lose three reactors at its Fukushima Daiichi plant when an earthquake and tsunami struck on March 11, 2011? After all, just about 15 kilometers south of the plant, on the same Pacific shore hit by the same tsunami, its twin, Fukushima Daini, did not suffer the slightest damage. Repercussions of the Fukushima Daiichi failure have ranged from Japan being deprived of 30 percent of its electricity-generating capacity to Germany’s decision to shut down all reactors by 2021—and, above all, to an even deeper public distrust of fission as a source of energy.[55]

为什么波音公司——这家在1966年孤注一掷研发747，并随后成功推出多款新型喷气式客机（如今已发展到787系列）的公司——却坚持不断扩大1964年推出的737机型，而这一可疑的尝试最终导致了两起灾难性事故？[56]为什么波音公司或美国联邦航空管理局在第一次致命事故发生后没有立即停飞该机型？这些失败的后果同样深远：首先是自2019年3月起整个737 MAX机队暂时停飞，随后是该机型停产并取消新订单。从长远来看，这将影响波音公司推出急需的新机型以取代其老旧的757的能力（而新冠疫情导致的国际航空业崩溃更是加剧了所有这些后果）。

And why has Boeing—the company that risked everything on developing the 747 in 1966, and that went on to introduce successful new families of jetliners (now up to 787s)—insisted on constantly enlarging the 737 (introduced in 1964), a dubious quest that led to two catastrophic accidents?[56] Why was the plane not grounded, either by Boeing or by the Federal Aviation Administration, immediately after the first fatal accident? Again, the consequences of these failures have been profound: first the temporary grounding of the entire 737 MAX fleet starting in March 2019, then the cessation of the plane’s production and cancellation of new orders. In the long run, this will affect Boeing’s ability to introduce a much-needed new design to replace its aging 757 (with all of these consequences magnified by the COVID-induced collapse of international flying).

鉴于新设计、新结构、复杂流程和交互操作的数量之多，福岛核事故和波音737 MAX事件所揭示的失败无法避免，未来几十年还将出现其他（且不可预测的）类似情况。未来是过去的重演——是诸多令人瞩目的进步的结合。以及（无法避免的）挫折。但展望未来，我们看到了一种新的趋势：人们越来越确信（尽管并非一致认同），在我们面临的所有风险中，全球气候变化是最需要紧急有效应对的风险。然而，要实现速度和效率的结合远比人们普遍认为的要困难得多，这其中有两个根本原因。

Given the number of new designs, structures, complex processes, and interactive operations, the failures illustrated by Fukushima and the Boeing 737 MAX cannot be prevented and the coming decades will see other (and unpredictable) manifestations of this reality. The future is a replay of the past—a combination of admirable advances and (un)avoidable setbacks. But there is something new as we look ahead, that unmistakably increasing (albeit not unanimous) conviction that, of all the risks we face, global climate change is the one that needs to be tackled most urgently and effectively. And there are two fundamental reasons why this combination of speed and efficacy will be much harder to realize than is generally assumed.

前所未有的承诺，延迟的回报

Unprecedented commitments, delayed rewards

应对这一挑战，历史上首次需要真正意义上的全球性、实质性和长期性承诺。认为我们能够在短期内有效且大规模地实现脱碳，与以往所有证据相悖。联合国第一次气候大会于1992年召开，此后的几十年里，我们举行了一系列全球会议，进行了无数的评估和研究——但近三十年过去了，仍然没有达成一项具有约束力的国际协议来减缓温室气体的年度排放量，而且短期内也看不到任何通过的希望。

Dealing with this challenge will, for the first time in history, require a truly global, as well as a very substantial and prolonged, commitment. To conclude that we will be able to achieve decarbonization anytime soon, effectively and on the required scales, runs against all past evidence. The UN’s first climate conference took place in 1992, and in the intervening decades we have had a series of global meetings and countless assessments and studies—but nearly three decades later there is still no binding international agreement to moderate the annual emissions of greenhouse gases and no prospect for its early adoption.

为了取得成效，这必须通过一项全球协议来实现。但这并不意味着200个国家必须签字：大约50个小国的排放量总和，甚至比不上对温室气体排放量排名前五大生产国的排放量进行量化时可能出现的误差。除非这五个目前占全球排放量80%的前五大国家至少同意做出明确且具有约束力的承诺，否则任何真正的进展都无法实现。然而，我们距离开展这样一项协调一致的全球行动还遥遥无期。[57]回想一下，备受赞誉的《巴黎协定》并没有为全球最大的排放国设定具体的减排目标，而且其不具约束力的承诺根本无法缓解任何问题——到2050年，这些承诺反而会导致排放量增加50%！

In order to be effective, this would have to entail nothing less than a global accord. This does not mean that 200 nations must sign on dotted lines: the combined emissions of about 50 small nations add up to less than the likely error in quantifying the emissions of just the top five greenhouse gas producers. No real progress can be achieved until at least these top five countries, now responsible for 80 percent of all emissions, agree to clear and binding commitments. But we are nowhere close to embarking on such a concerted global action.[57] Recall that the much-praised Paris accord had no specific emission-reduction targets for the world’s largest emitters, and that its non-binding pledges would not mitigate anything—they would result in 50 percent higher emissions by 2050!

此外，任何有效的承诺都将耗资巨大，至少需要持续两代人的时间才能实现预期目标（大幅减少甚至完全消除温室气体排放），甚至需要采取远超预期的大幅减排措施。可以实际预见的措施，在未来几十年内都不会显示出任何令人信服的好处。[58]这就引出了一个极其棘手的代际公平问题——即我们总是倾向于低估未来。[59]

Moreover, any effective commitments will be expensive, they will have to last for at least two generations in order to bring the desired outcome (of much reduced, if not totally eliminated, greenhouse gas emissions), and even drastic reductions going well beyond anything that could be realistically envisaged will not show any convincing benefits for decades.[58] This raises the extraordinarily difficult problem of intergenerational justice—that is, our never-failing propensity to discount the future.[59]

我们更看重当下而非未来，并据此定价。一位30岁的登山爱好者愿意支付约6万美元，用于购买许可证、装备、聘请夏尔巴人、氧气以及其他费用，以便明年攀登珠穆朗玛峰。但如果他承诺在2050年登顶珠峰，他肯定会要求大幅折扣——这反映了诸多显而易见的不确定因素，例如他的健康状况、尼泊尔未来政府的稳定性、喜马拉雅山脉发生大地震导致探险活动无法进行的可能性，以及登山通道可能关闭等。这种普遍存在的对未来进行折价的倾向，在考虑诸如碳定价以缓解全球气候变化这类复杂且成本高昂的举措时，显得尤为重要，因为对于发起这项昂贵探索的一代人来说，他们无法从中获得任何明显的经济利益。由于温室气体排放后会在大气中停留很长时间（例如二氧化碳，最长可达 200 年），即使采取非常强有力的减缓措施，在几十年内也不会发出明显的成功信号——即全球平均地表温度的首次显著下降。[60]

We value now more than later, and we price it accordingly. An avid 30-year-old mountaineer is willing to pay some $60,000 for permits, gear, Sherpas, oxygen, and other expenses to climb Mount Everest next year. But he would demand a steep discount—reflecting such obvious intervening uncertainties as his health, the stability of future Nepali governments, the probability of major Himalayan earthquakes preventing any expeditions, and the likelihood of shutting down the access—for buying a promise to scale the mountain in 2050. This universal inclination to discount the future matters greatly when contemplating such complex and costly undertakings as pricing carbon in order to mitigate global climate change, because there would no discernible economic benefits for the generation of people that would launch the expensive quest. Because greenhouse gases remain in the atmosphere for long periods of time after they have been emitted (for CO2, up to 200 years), even very strong mitigation efforts would not give a clear signal of success—the first significant decline of global mean surface temperature—for several decades.[60]

显然，如果大规模全球脱碳行动启动后，气温仍持续上升25至35年，这将对实施和推进此类激进措施构成重大挑战。但由于目前尚无任何具有全球约束力的承诺能够在几年内促成此类措施的广泛实施，因此盈亏平衡点和可衡量的气温下降的起始时间都将进一步推迟。一种常用的气候经济模型显示，在2020年代初启动的减缓措施，其盈亏平衡年份（即最优政策开始产生净经济效益的年份）大约在2080年左右。

Obviously, a temperature rise that would continue for 25–35 years after the launching of a massive global decarbonization effort would present a major challenge for enacting and pursuing such drastic measures. But because there are currently no globally binding commitments that could see any widespread adoption of such steps within a few years, both the break-even point and the onset of measurable temperature declines advance even further into the future. A commonly used climate-economy model indicates the break-even year (when the optimal policy would begin to produce net economic benefit) for mitigation efforts launched in the early 2020s would be only around 2080.

如果全球平均预期寿命（2020年约为72岁）保持不变，那么出生于21世纪中叶的一代人将是第一批经历累积经济净收益的一代。气候变化减缓政策的益处。[61]富裕国家的年轻公民是否准备好将这些长远的益处置于眼前的利益之上？即使低收入国家人口不断增长，为了生存而继续扩大对化石燃料的依赖，他们是否愿意在未来半个多世纪里坚持这一方针？而如今四五十岁的人们是否准备好加入他们，去争取他们永远无法看到的回报？

Should average global life expectancy (about 72 years in 2020) remain the same, then the generation born near the middle of the 21st century would be the first to experience cumulative economic net benefit from climate-change mitigation policy.[61] Are the young citizens of affluent countries ready to put these distant benefits ahead of their more immediate gains? Are they willing to sustain this course for more than half a century even as the low-income countries with growing populations continue, as a matter of basic survival, to expand their reliance on fossil carbon? And are the people now in their 40s and 50s ready to join them in order to bring about rewards they will never see?

最近的疫情再次提醒我们，应对日益全球化的挑战，最佳途径之一是制定一套优先事项和基本应对措施。然而，疫情期间各国国内和国际措施缺乏协调性和统一性，也暴露出将这些原则系统化并付诸实施的难度。危机中暴露出的种种失败，以惨痛的代价和令人信服的方式，揭示了我们屡次无法做好基本工作、无法保障根本利益的困境。本书的读者应该已经意识到，这份（简短的）清单必须包括保障基本食品、能源和物资供应的安全，同时尽可能减少对环境的影响，并切实评估我们能够采取哪些措施来最大限度地减少未来全球变暖的程度。这是一个艰巨的挑战，没有人能够确定我们能否成功，也无法确定我们能否失败。

The latest pandemic has served as yet another reminder that one of the best ways to minimize the impact of increasingly global challenges is to have a set of priorities and basic measures for how to deal with them—but the pandemic, with its incoherent and non-uniform inter- and intranational measures, has also shown how difficult it would be to codify such principles and to follow such guidelines. Failures revealed during crises offer costly and convincing illustrations of our recurrent inability to get the basics right, to take care of the fundamentals. By now, readers of this book will appreciate that this (short) list must include the security of basic food, energy, and material supply, all provided with the least possible impact on the environment, and all done while realistically appraising the steps that we can take to minimize the extent of future global warming. That is a daunting prospect, and nobody can be sure that we will succeed—or that we will fail.

对遥远的未来保持不可知论意味着诚实：我们必须承认自身理解的局限性，以谦逊的态度面对所有关乎地球的挑战，并认识到进步、挫折和失败都将继续成为我们进化的一部分，我们无法保证（无论如何定义）最终的成功，也无法抵达任何奇点——但是，只要我们坚定不移地运用已积累的知识，就不会有世界末日的到来。未来将从我们的成就和失败中涌现，虽然我们或许足够聪明（也足够幸运）能够预见到它的某些形态和特征，但即便仅仅展望一代人之后，它的整体面貌仍然难以捉摸。

Being agnostic about the distant future means being honest: we have to admit the limits of our understanding, approach all planetary challenges with humility, and recognize that advances, setbacks, and failures will all continue to be a part of our evolution and that there can be no assurance of (however defined) ultimate success, no arrival at any singularity—but, as long as we use our accumulated understanding with determination and perseverance, there will also not be an early end of days. The future will emerge from our accomplishments and failures, and while we might be clever (and lucky) enough to foresee some of its forms and features, the whole remains elusive even when looking just a generation ahead.

本最后一章的第一稿写于 2020 年 5 月 8 日，即第二次世界大战在欧洲结束 75 周年纪念日。让我们设想这样一个场景：在20世纪中叶的某个春日，一小群掌握了当时所有已知知识的人坐下来讨论并预测2020年的世界状况。他们了解从工程（燃气轮机、核反应堆、电子计算机、火箭）到生命科学（抗生素、杀虫剂、除草剂、疫苗）等各个领域的最新突破，因此能够正确地预见到许多发展趋势，例如大规模汽车普及、价格亲民的洲际飞行、电子计算、作物产量提高以及预期寿命的显著增长。

The first draft of this closing chapter was written on May 8, 2020, the 75th anniversary of the end of the Second World War in Europe. Let’s imagine a scenario in which on that spring day in the mid-20th century a small group of people embodying all extant knowledge of the time sat down to discuss and predict the state of the world in 2020. Being aware of the latest breakthroughs in areas ranging from engineering (gas turbines, nuclear reactors, electronic computers, rockets) to life sciences (antibiotics, pesticides, herbicides, vaccines), they could correctly foresee many rising trajectories, ranging from mass automobilization and affordable intercontinental flight to electronic computing, and from rising crop yields to significant gains in life expectancy.

但他们无法描述我们在过去75年间，通过自身的成就与失败所创造的世界的进步、复杂性和细微差别。为了强调这种不可能，不妨从国家层面来思考。1945年，日本的木结构城市（除京都外）几乎被夷为平地。欧洲战后一片混乱，不久便因冷战而分裂。苏联取得了胜利，但付出了惨重的代价，并且仍然处于斯大林的残酷统治之下。美国崛起成为前所未有的超级大国，创造了世界近一半的经济产出。中国极度贫困，并且再次濒临内战的边缘。谁能预见到它们各自的发展轨迹：日本的兴衰，欧洲的新繁荣、新问题、新的团结和新的分裂，苏联的侵略性自信（“我们将埋葬你们！”）和灭亡，美国的失误、失败、浪费的成就和未实现的可能性，以及中国的苦难、世界上最严重的饥荒、缓慢的复苏和陡峭上升到令人质疑的高度？

But they would not be able to describe the advances, complexities, and nuances of the world that we have created by our accomplishments and failures during the intervening 75 years. To stress this impossibility, just think in national terms. In 1945 Japan’s wooden cities were (save for Kyoto) essentially leveled. Europe was in postwar disarray, shortly to be split by the Cold War. The USSR was victorious but at an enormous cost, and it remained under Stalin’s ruthless rule. The US emerged as an unprecedented superpower, generating about half of the world’s economic product. China was desperately poor and, again, on the brink of civil war. Who could have traced their specific trajectories of rise and fall (Japan), of new prosperity, new problems, new unity, and new disunity (Europe), of aggressive confidence (“We will bury you!”) and demise (USSR), of blunders, defeats, wasted accomplishments, and unrealized possibilities (USA), and of suffering, the world’s worst famine, slow recovery, and steep ascent to questionable heights (China)?

1945年，谁也无法预料到世界人口会新增超过50亿，而且粮食供应也比历史上任何时期都更加充足——即便如此，世界仍然浪费着数量惊人的粮食。同样，谁也无法预料到，许多传染病（最显著的是小儿麻痹症在世界各地肆虐，以及富裕国家结核病的流行）如今已成为历史的注脚，但即便在最富裕的国家，经济不平等现象依然不断加剧；这个世界一方面更加清洁健康，另一方面也面临着新的污染问题（从海洋中的塑料到土壤中的重金属），而且由于生物圈的持续退化，也面临着其他问题。更加岌岌可危；或者说，一个充斥着即时且基本免费信息的世界，其代价是大量传播错误信息、谎言和应受谴责的说法。

Nobody in 1945 could have predicted a world with more than 5 billion additional people that is also better fed than at any time in history—even as it keeps wasting an indefensibly high share of all the food it grows. Nor did anybody foresee a world that relegated a number of infectious diseases (most notably polio everywhere, and tuberculosis in affluent nations) to historical footnotes, but that cannot keep economic inequality from widening even in the richest countries; a world that is at once much cleaner and much healthier yet also more polluted in new ways (from plastic in the ocean to heavy metals in soils) and, due to the ongoing biospheric degradation, also more precarious; or a world suffused in instant and essentially free information that comes at the price of massively disseminated misinformation, lies and reprehensible claims.

时隔多年，我们依然没有理由相信自己更有能力预见未来技术创新的规模（除非你相信奇点即将到来），预见那些将塑造国家命运的事件，以及那些将决定未来75年人类文明命运的决策（或令人遗憾的缺失）。尽管近来人们格外关注全球变暖的最终影响以及快速脱碳的必要性，但在决定我们未来的诸多不确定因素中，很少有比21世纪剩余时间内全球人口发展轨迹更为重要的了。

A lifetime later, there is no reason to believe that we are in a better position to foresee the extent of coming technical innovations (unless, of course, you are a believer in near-imminent Singularity), the events that will shape the fortunes of nations, and the decisions (or their regrettable absence) that will determine the fate of our civilization during the next 75 years. Despite the recent preoccupation with the eventual impacts of global warming and with the need for rapid decarbonization, few uncertain outcomes will be as important in determining our future as the trajectory of the global population during the remainder of the 21st century.

极端预测呈现出截然不同的未来：到2100年，全球人口会超过150亿（几乎是2020年的两倍），还是会减少到48亿，损失超过目前总人口的一半，其中中国的人口将减少48%？[62]正如预期的那样，这些预测的中间值相差不大（分别为88亿和109亿）。然而，20亿人的差距不容忽视，这些比较表明，即使是基本的人口预测，仅仅一代人的时间跨度，就会出现巨大的分歧。显而易见，即使预测仅以富裕国家目前的预期寿命为基准，其极端值的影响也会塑造出两种截然不同的经济、社会和环境发展轨迹。本书的第一稿和第二稿分别写于新冠疫情的第一波和第二波期间，因此，我们有理由质疑，在21世纪剩余的时间里，我们将面临的新一轮疫情（鉴于1900年以来疫情的频繁发生——1918年、1957年、1968年、2009年、2020年——我们可以预期在2100年之前至少还会出现两到三次）会与2020年的疫情类似、强度弱得多，还是毒性更强得多。与这些根本性的不确定性共存，仍然是人类生存的本质——这也限制了我们预见未来的能力。

Extreme forecasts offer very different futures: will the global population surpass 15 billion by 2100 (nearly twice as many as in 2020), or will it shrink to 4.8 billion, losing more than half of today’s total, with China shrinking by 48 percent?[62] As expected, the medium variants of these forecasts are not that far apart (8.8 and 10.9 billion). Still, being 2 billion people apart is not an inconsequential gap, and these comparisons show how even basic population forecasts veer apart after just a single generation. All too obviously, even when forecasts go only as far as today’s life expectancy in affluent countries, the implications of their extreme values shape two very different economic, social, and environmental trajectories. And as the first and second drafts of this book were written during the first and second waves of COVID-19, it is quite realistic to ask if the new pandemics we will face throughout the remainder of the 21st century (given their post-1900 frequency—1918, 1957, 1968, 2009, 2020—we can expect at least two or three such events before 2100) will be similar, much weaker, or far more virulent than the 2020 event. Living with these fundamental uncertainties remains the essence of the human condition—and it limits our ability to act with foresight.

正如我在第一章中提到的，我既不是悲观主义者也不是乐观主义者，我是一名科学家。理解世界的真实运行方式没有任何私心。

As I noted in the opening chapter, I am not a pessimist or an optimist, I am a scientist. There is no agenda in understanding how the world really works.

对我们的过去、现在和不确定的未来有清醒的认识是……这是我们探索面前那浩瀚无垠、不可知的未来的最佳基础。虽然我们无法具体预测，但我们知道，最有可能的情况是进步与挫折交织，看似难以逾越的困难与近乎奇迹般的进步并存。未来一如既往，并非命中注定。它的走向取决于我们的行动。

A realistic grasp of our past, present, and uncertain future is the best foundation for approaching the unknowable expanse of time before us. While we cannot be specific, we know that the most likely prospect is a mixture of progress and setbacks, of seemingly insurmountable difficulties and near-miraculous advances. The future, as ever, is not predetermined. Its outcome depends on our actions.

附录：理解数字

Appendix: Understanding Numbers

数量级

Orders of Magnitude

时光飞逝，生物生长，万物变化。在虚构的世界里，这些不可避免的过程和结果几乎无一例外地都以定性的方式呈现。童话故事总是以“很久很久以前”开头，主人公们要么富有（王子），要么贫穷（灰姑娘），要么美丽（少女），要么丑陋（食人魔），要么勇敢（骑士），要么胆小（老鼠）。数字通常只是作为简单的计数工具出现，服务于情节发展，而且常常以“三”为一组：三兄弟，三个愿望，三只小猪……现代小说中也并无太大改变。海明威笔下的布雷特·阿什利夫人“美得惊人”，但我们始终不知道她的身高；菲茨杰拉德笔下传奇的盖茨比初次登场时只是被描述为“一个和我年纪相仿的人”，我们也不知道他的年龄——或者他的真实财富。只有确切的时间变得更加突出，往往出现在第一句话中。左拉的《金钱》：“交易所刚刚敲响了十一点……”福克纳的《尘埃中的闯入者》：“那是星期天的上午，正好是中午……”索尔仁尼琴的《伊万·杰尼索维奇的一天》：“那天早上五点……”

Time flies, organisms grow, things change. In the world of fiction these inexorable processes and outcomes are, almost without exception, handled in qualitative terms. In fairy tales it has always been once upon a time and the protagonists are rich (princes) and poor (Cinderellas), beautiful (maidens) and ugly (ogres), bold (knights) or timid (mice). Numbers usually enter only as simple counters, as devices serving the plot, often in threes: three brothers, three wishes, three little pigs . . . Not much changes in modern fiction. Hemingway’s Lady Brett Ashley is “damned good-looking” but we never learn her height, and Fitzgerald’s storied Gatsby makes his first appearance just as “a man of about my age” and we never learn his age—or his real wealth. Only exact timing becomes somewhat more prominent, often in the first sentence. Zola’s Money: “Eleven o’clock had just struck at the Bourse . . .” Faulkner’s Intruder in the Dust: “It was just noon that Sunday morning . . .” Solzhenitsyn’s One Day in the Life of Ivan Denisovich: “At five o’clock that morning . . .”

相比之下，当今世界充斥着数字。那些关于不可思议的亿万富翁的新奇故事，无一例外地会提及他们最新的财富数额；新的悲剧，无论是最新的渡轮沉没事件还是又一起大规模凶杀案，总是会伴随着遇难者人数。每日公布的各国和全球死亡人数，已成为2020年新冠疫情不可回避的标志。我们身处一个全新的量化世界，人们用数字衡量自己的“好友”（在Facebook上）、每日步数（通过Fitbit）以及投资业绩（通过跑赢纳斯达克平均指数）。这种量化无处不在，但其质量却常常令人质疑，因为这些数字的来源五花八门，从精确重复的测量到草率的假设和粗略的估计，不一而足。不幸的是，很少有人会质疑这些数字的来源，也很少有人会尝试去评判它们。将它们置于具体的语境中。但即使是最好的现代数字——那些或许能完美衡量复杂现实的数字——也常常难以捉摸，因为它们所代表的数量要么太大，要么太小，超出了任何直觉的理解范围。

In contrast, today’s world is full of numbers. The new fairy tales, the stories about improbable billionaires, unfailingly note the latest sums to their credit; the new tragedies, reports of the latest ferry sinking or of yet another mass homicide, always come with the number of victims. Daily counts of national and global deaths became the inescapable mark of the 2020 pandemic. Ours is a new, quantitative world, where people measure numbers of their “friends” (on Facebook), of their daily steps (by Fitbit), and of their investment prowess (by beating the NASDAQ average). This quantification is pervasive but, all too often, its quality is questionable, as the numbers range from precise and repeated measurements to sloppy assumptions and careless estimates. Unfortunately, few people who see, repeat, and use these numbers question their origins, and very few try to judge them in context. But even the best modern numbers—those that may be perfect measures of complex realities—are often elusive because they represent quantities that are either too large or too small for any intuitive comprehension.

这使得它们很容易被歪曲和滥用。即使是学龄前儿童也拥有对数量级进行心理表征的系统，从而形成一种直觉式的“数感”，而且这种能力会随着学校教育而增强。[1]显然，这种数字系统只是近似的，当数量级达到数千、数百万甚至数十亿时，它就失效了。这时，数量级就派上了用场。你可以简单地把数量级理解为任何整数的首位数字之后的所有数字的总数，或者小数点之前所有数字的总数。7 后面没有数字（3.5 中首位数字和小数点之间也没有其他数字），因此这两个数的数量级都是零。这在以 10 为底（十进制）的对数尺度上表示为 10⁰ 。任何介于 1 和 10 之间的数字都是 10⁰ 的倍数， 10 是 10¹ ， 20 是 2 × 10¹ 。随着数字的增大，这种方法的优势会很快显现出来。10 倍跳跃使我们进入以百为单位计数的项目（10 2），然后是千（10 3），万（10 4），数十万（10 5），以及百万（10 6）。

This makes them easy subjects for misrepresentation and misuse. Even preschoolers have a mental system of magnitude representation that creates an intuitive ‘‘number sense,” and this capability improves with schooling.[1] Obviously, this number system is only approximate, and it fails as the quantities rise to thousands, millions, and billions. This is where orders of magnitude come in handy. Think of them simply as the total number of digits that follow the first digit of any whole number, or the number of digits following the first digit before the decimal point. No digit follows 7 (and no additional digit comes between the first number and the decimal point in 3.5) and hence both of these numbers are of a zero order of magnitude. This is expressed on a base-10 (decadic) logarithmic scale as 100. Any number between 1 and 10 will be a multiple of 100, 10 becomes 101, 20 is 2 × 101. The advantages of this become quickly apparent as the numbers grow bigger. A 10-fold jump brings us to items counted in hundreds (102) and then to thousands (103), tens of thousands (104), hundreds of thousands (105), and millions (106).

除此之外，我们还会进入一些容易犯数量级错误的领域：一些富裕家族（企业创始人、所有者或幸运的继承人）的资产每年增加数千万美元（10⁷ ）甚至数亿美元（10⁸ ）；2020年，全球约有2100位亿万富翁（10⁹美元），其中最富有的亿万富翁的身价超过1000亿美元（10¹¹美元）。[2]就个人净资产而言，与贫困的非洲移民仅有的几美元破旧衣服和磨损的鞋子相比，两者之间的差距高达10个数量级。

Beyond that, we get into realms where it is easy to make order of magnitude mistakes: some rich families (business founders, owners, or lucky inheritors) now add annually to their holdings tens (107) or hundreds (108) of millions of dollars; in 2020 the world had about 2,100 billionaires (109 dollars), and the richest ones are now valued at more than $100 billion or 1011 dollars.[2] In terms of individual net worth, compared with the few dollars’ worth of tattered clothes and the worn-out shoes of a destitute African migrant, the gap is thus 10 orders of magnitude.

这种差异如此之大，以至于我们在区分两大陆生动物类别——鸟类和哺乳动物——的特征中找不到任何可比拟的对应物。最小和最大的哺乳动物（伊特鲁里亚鼩鼱，体重100克；非洲象，体重106克）的体重差异“仅仅”有六个数量级。最小和最大的哺乳动物的翼展差异也同样巨大。体型最大的飞行鸟类（蜂鸟体长3厘米，安第斯神鹰体长320厘米）也只比它小两个数量级。[3]显然，有些人在与同类相区别方面，远远超越了自然进化所能达到的程度。

This difference is so large that we can find no equivalent among the properties separating the two most notable classes of terrestrial animals: birds and mammals. The difference between the body masses of the smallest and the largest mammals (the Etruscan shrew at 100 grams and the African elephant at 106 grams) is “just” six orders of magnitude. The difference between the wingspan of the smallest and the largest flying birds (the bee hummingbird at 3 centimeters and the Andean condor at 320 centimeters) is only two orders of magnitude.[3] Clearly, some humans have gone far further than natural evolution ever could in separating themselves from the crowd.

还有一种比写出完整数值或写成十进制对数的指数更简便的方法来表示数量级。由于这些倍数在科学研究和工程实践中都非常常见，因此它们被赋予了特定的希腊名称，用作前三个数量级的前缀——10¹是 deka（十） ， 10²是 hecto（百），10³是kilo（千）——然后每隔三个数量级就有一个前缀：10⁶是mega（兆），10⁹ 是giga（吉），一直到 yotta（尧），10²⁴ ，现在是命名数量级中最高的。从实际数值到特定名称，所有内容都汇总在下表中：

And there is an even easier way to indicate orders of magnitude than by spelling out full value designations or writing them out as exponents of decadic logarithms. Because these multiples are encountered so frequently in both scientific research and in engineering practice, they were assigned specific Greek names to be used as prefixes for the first three orders of magnitude—101 is deka, 102 is hecto, 103 is kilo—and then for every third order: 106 is mega, 109 giga, all the way to yotta, 1024, now the highest named order of magnitude. Everything—from actual numbers to specific names—is summarized in the following table:

文中使用的国际单位制倍数

缩写

M

106

giga

109

太拉

tera

T

T

10 12

1012

佩塔

peta

P

P

10月15日

1015

考试

exa

E

E

10月18日

1018

泽塔

zetta

Z

Z

10月21日

1021

约塔

yotta

Y

10月24日

1024

另一种展现现代社会运转所需前所未有的速度范围的方法是将其与传统经验的范围进行比较。两个关键例子就足以说明问题。在工业化前的社会，陆地上的出行速度差异仅为两倍，从缓慢步行（4公里/小时）到马车（8公里/小时），后者是为那些有能力付费乘坐（通常没有座椅）的人提供的。相比之下，如今的出行速度跨越了两个数量级，从缓慢步行的4公里/小时到喷气式客机的900公里/小时。

Yet another way to illustrate the unprecedented range of magnitudes that enables the functioning of modern societies is to compare them with the range of traditional experiences. Two key examples will suffice. In preindustrial societies, the extremes of travel speeds on land differed only by a factor of two, from slow walking (4 km/hour) to horse-drawn coaches (8 km/hour) for those who could pay for a seat (often un-upholstered). In contrast, travel speeds now range over two orders of magnitude, from 4 km/hour for slow walking to 900 km/hour for jetliners.

在工业革命前时代，个人通常能够控制的最强大的原动机（提供动能的生物体或机器）是一匹功率为750瓦的骏马。[4]如今，数亿人驾驶的车辆功率在100到300千瓦之间——高达一匹强壮骏马功率的400倍——而宽体喷气式客机的飞行员在巡航模式下操控的功率约为100兆瓦（相当于超过13万匹骏马的功率）。这些进步如此巨大，以至于无法直接或凭直觉理解：要理解现代世界，需要仔细关注数量级的变化。震级！

And the most powerful prime mover (an organism or machine delivering kinetic energy) an individual could commonly control during the preindustrial era was a powerful horse at 750 watts.[4] Now hundreds of millions of people drive vehicles whose power ranges between 100 and 300 kilowatts—up to 400 times the power of a strong horse—and the pilot of a wide-body jetliner commands about 100 megawatts (equivalent to more than 130,000 strong horses) in cruising mode. These gains have been too large to be grasped directly or intuitively: understanding the modern world needs a careful attention to orders of magnitude!

  14. Wrangham argues that cooking was one of the most important evolutionary advances: R. Wrangham, Catching Fire: How Cooking Made Us Human (New York: Basic Books, 2009).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 7

  15. 许多植物物种的驯化在旧世界和新世界的几个地区独立发生，但近东地区产生了最早的群体：M. Zeder，“近东农业的起源”，当代人类学52/增刊 4 (2011)，S221–S235。

  16. The domestication of numerous plant species took place independently in several regions of the Old and the New World, but the Near East produced the earliest cluster: M. Zeder, “The origins of agriculture in the Near East,” Current Anthropology 52/Supplement 4 (2011), S221–S235.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 8

  17. 役畜包括牛、水牛、牦牛、马、骡子、驴、骆驼、羊驼、大象，以及（较少见的）驯鹿、绵羊、山羊和狗。除了马科动物（马、驴、骡子）之外，只有骆驼、牦牛和大象常被用作骑乘动物。

    返回笔记参考9

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 10

    返回笔记参考15

  30. These calculations are highly approximate; even if we knew the exact totals of labor force and draft animals, we would still have to make assumptions about their typical power and aggregate working hours.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 15

  31. 1800 年的实际总量不足 0.5 EJ，到 1900 年上升到近 22 EJ，到 2000 年上升到近 350 EJ，到 2020 年达到 525 EJ。有关全球（以及许多国家）能源转型的详细历史记载，请参阅 V. Smil 的《能源转型：全球和国家视角》（加利福尼亚州圣巴巴拉：Praeger，2017 年）。

    返回笔记参考16

  32. The actual totals were less than 0.5 EJ in 1800, rising to almost 22 EJ by 1900 and to nearly 350 EJ by the year 2000, and going to 525 EJ in 2020. For a detailed historical account of global (and many national) energy transitions, see V. Smil, Energy Transitions: Global and National Perspectives (Santa Barbara, CA: Praeger, 2017).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 16

  33. 历史能源效率的综合平均值取自我在 Smil 的《能源与文明》一书第 297-301 页所做的计算。有关近年来的总体转换效率，请参阅为世界（https://www.iea.org/sankey）或各个国家/地区编制的能源流动桑基图；有关美国，请参阅https://flowcharts.llnl.gov/content/assets/images/energy/us/Energy_US_2019.png。

    返回笔记参考17

  34. Composite averages of historical energy efficiencies are taken from calculations I did for: Smil, Energy and Civilization, pp. 297–301. For overall conversion efficiencies in recent years, see Sankey diagrams of energy flows prepared for the world (https://www.iea.org/sankey) or for individual countries; and for the US, see https://flowcharts.llnl.gov/content/assets/images/energy/us/Energy_US_2019.png.

Schuster, “Boltzmann and evolution: Some basic questions of biology seen with atomistic glasses,” in G. Gallavotti et al., eds., Boltzmann’s Legacy (Zurich: European Mathematical Society, 2008), pp. 1–26.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 25

  51. J. Coopersmith 在其著作《能量：微妙的概念》（牛津：牛津大学出版社，2015 年）中，对能量概念的历史进行了详尽的阐述。

    返回笔记参考26

  52. The history of the concept of energy is covered in revealing detail in J. Coopersmith, Energy: The Subtle Concept (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2015).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 26

  53. RS Westfall，《牛顿物理学中的力：十七世纪的动力学科学》（纽约：爱思唯尔出版社，1971 年）。

    返回笔记参考27

  54. R. S. Westfall, Force in Newton’s Physics: The Science of Dynamics in the Seventeenth Century (New York: Elsevier, 1971).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 27

  55. C. Smith，《能源科学：维多利亚时代英国能源物理学的文化史》（芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1998 年）；DSL Cardwell，《从瓦特到克劳修斯：早期工业时代热力学的兴起》（伦敦：海涅曼教育出版社，1971 年）。

    返回笔记参考28

  56. C. Smith, The Science of Energy: A Cultural History of Energy Physics in Victorian Britain (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1998); D. S. L. Cardwell, From Watt to Clausius: The Rise of Thermodynamics in the Early Industrial Age (London: Heinemann Educational, 1971).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 28

  57. JC Maxwell，《热学理论》（伦敦：Longmans, Green, and Company，1872 年），第 101 页。

    返回笔记参考29

  58. J. C. Maxwell, Theory of Heat (London: Longmans, Green, and Company, 1872), p. 101.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 29

  59. R. 费曼，《费曼物理学讲义》（加利福尼亚州雷德伍德城：Addison-Wesley，1988 年），第 4 卷，第 2 页。

    返回笔记参考30

  60. R. Feynman, The Feynman Lectures on Physics (Redwood City, CA: Addison-Wesley, 1988), vol. 4, p. 2.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 30

  61. 热力学入门书籍不胜枚举，但有一本仍然脱颖而出：K. Sherwin，《热力学导论》（多德雷赫特：荷兰施普林格出版社，1993 年）。

    返回笔记参考31

  62. There is no shortage of introductory books on thermodynamics, but this one still stands out: K. Sherwin, Introduction to Thermodynamics (Dordrecht: Springer Netherlands, 1993).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 31

  63. N. Friedman，《1945 年以来的美国潜艇：图解设计史》（马里兰州安纳波利斯：美国海军学院，2018 年）。

    返回笔记参考32

  64. N. Friedman, U.S. Submarines Since 1945: An Illustrated Design History (Annapolis, MD: US Naval Institute, 2018).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 32

  65. 容量（负荷）系数是指实际发电量与机组最大发电量之比。例如，一台大型 5 兆瓦发电机组风力涡轮机全天不间断运转可产生 120 兆瓦时的电力；如果其实际输出仅为 30 兆瓦时，则其容量系数为 25%。2019 年美国平均年度容量系数（均已四舍五入）分别为：太阳能电池板 21%，风力涡轮机 35%，水电站 39%，核电站 94%：表 6.07.B，“主要使用非化石燃料的公用事业规模发电机的容量系数”，https://www.eia.gov/electricity/monthly/epm_table_grapher.php ?t=epmt_6_07_b。德国太阳能电池容量系数低并不令人意外：柏林和慕尼黑的年日照时数都比西雅图少！

    返回笔记参考33

  66. Capacity (load) factor is the ratio between actual generation and the maximum output a unit is able to produce. For example, a large 5 MW wind turbine working non-stop all day would generate 120 MWh of electricity; if its actual output is only 30 MWh then its capacity factor is 25 percent. Average annual US capacity factors for 2019 were (all rounded): 21 percent for solar panels, 35 percent for wind turbines, 39 percent for hydro stations and 94 percent for nuclear stations: Table 6.07.B, “Capacity Factors for Utility Scale Generators Primarily Using Non-Fossil Fuels,” https://www.eia.gov/electricity/monthly/epm_table_grapher.php?t=epmt_6_07_b. Low German solar cell capacity factor is no surprise: both Berlin and Munich have fewer sunshine hours per year than Seattle!

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 33

  67. 一支重约 50 克的祈祷蜡烛（石蜡的能量密度为 42 kJ/g）含有 2.1 MJ (50 × 42,000) 的化学能，燃烧 15 小时的平均功率约为 40 W（与弱光灯泡的功率相当）。但无论哪种情况，只有一小部分总能量会转化为光能：现代白炽灯的转化率不到 2%，而石蜡蜡烛的转化率仅为 0.02%。有关蜡烛重量和燃烧时间的更多信息，请访问https://www.candlewarehouse.ie/shopcontent.asp?type=burn-times；有关光效的更多信息，请访问https://web.archive.org/web/20120423123823/http://www.ccri.edu/physics/keefe/light.htm。

    返回笔记参考34

  68. A votive candle—weighing about 50 g, with paraffin’s energy density of 42 kJ/g—contains 2.1 MJ (50 × 42,000) of chemical energy, and its average power during a 15-hour burn will be nearly 40 W (much like a weak light bulb). But in both cases only a small portion of the total energy will be converted into light: less than 2 percent for a modern incandescent light, just 0.02 percent for a paraffin candle. For candle weights and burn times, see https://www.candlewarehouse.ie/shopcontent.asp?type=burn-times; for light efficacies, see https://web.archive.org/web/20120423123823/http://www.ccri.edu/physics/keefe/light.htm.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 34

  69. 基础代谢的计算方法见：粮农组织/世卫组织/联合国大学联合专家咨询，《人类能量需求》（罗马：粮农组织，2001 年），第 37 页，http://www.fao.org/3/a-y5686e.pdf。

    返回笔记参考35

  70. Calculations of basal metabolism are at: Joint FAO/WHO/UNU Expert Consultation, Human Energy Requirements (Rome: FAO, 2001), p. 37, http://www.fao.org/3/a-y5686e.pdf.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 35

  71. 工程工具箱，“化石燃料和替代燃料——能量含量”（2020 年），https://www.engineeringtoolbox.com/fossil-fuels-energy-content-d_1298.html。

    返回笔记参考36

    返回笔记参考37

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 42

  85. RF Aguilera 和 M. Radetzki，《石油的价格》（剑桥：剑桥大学出版社，2015 年）；AH Cordesman 和 KR al-Rodhan，《全球石油市场：风险与不确定性》（华盛顿特区：CSIS 出版社，2006 年）。

    返回笔记参考 43

  86. R. F. Aguilera and M. Radetzki, The Price of Oil (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2015); A. H. Cordesman and K. R. al-Rodhan, The Global Oil Market: Risks and Uncertainties (Washington, DC: CSIS Press, 2006).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 43

  87. 20 世纪 30 年代初期，美国汽车的平均油耗约为 16 英里/加仑（15 升/100 公里），此后四十年间持续缓慢下降，到 1973 年仅为 13.4 英里/加仑（17.7 升/100 公里）。新的 CAFE（企业平均燃油经济性）标准使油耗在 1985 年翻了一番，达到 27.5 英里/加仑（8.55 升/100 公里），但随后的低油价意味着直到 2010 年才取得进一步进展。V. Smil，《变革中的二十世纪》（纽约：牛津大学出版社，2006 年），第 203-208 页。

    返回笔记参考 44

  88. Average performance of American cars was about 16 mpg (15 L/100 km) during the early 1930s, and it kept slowly deteriorating for four decades, reaching just 13.4 mpg (17.7 L/100 km) in 1973. The new CAFE (Corporate Average Fuel Economy) standards doubled it to 27.5 mpg (8.55 L/100 km) by 1985, but subsequent low oil prices meant no further progress until 2010. V. Smil, Transforming the Twentieth Century (New York: Oxford University Press, 2006), pp. 203–208.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 44

  89. 联合国《能源统计年鉴》和英国石油公司《世界能源统计评论》提供了有关能源生产和消费的详细统计数据。

    返回笔记参考 45

  90. Detailed statistics on energy production and consumption are available in the United Nations’ Energy Statistics Yearbook and BP’s Statistical Review of World Energy.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 45

  91. SM Ghanem，《欧佩克：一个排他俱乐部的兴衰》（伦敦：Routledge出版社，2016年）；V. Smil，《能源、食品、环境》（牛津：牛津大学出版社，1987年），第37-60页。

    返回笔记参考 46

  92. S. M. Ghanem, OPEC: The Rise and Fall of an Exclusive Club (London: Routledge, 2016); V. Smil, Energy Food Environment (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1987), pp. 37–60.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 46

  93. J. Buchan，《上帝的日子：伊朗革命及其后果》（纽约：西蒙与舒斯特出版社，2013 年）；S. Maloney，《伊朗革命四十周年》（华盛顿特区：布鲁金斯学会出版社，2020 年）。

    返回笔记参考 47

  94. J. Buchan, Days of God: The Revolution in Iran and Its Consequences (New York: Simon & Schuster, 2013); S. Maloney, The Iranian Revolution at Forty (Washington, DC: Brookings Institution Press, 2020).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 47

  95. 能源密集型行业（冶金、化学合成）率先降低了单位能源消耗；美国 CAFE 标准的成功已经得到认可（见注释 44）；以前依赖燃烧原油或燃料油的几乎所有发电都转变为燃烧煤炭或天然气。

    返回笔记参考 48

  96. Energy-intensive industries (metallurgy, chemical syntheses) were the first sectors to lower their specific energy use; success of the US CAFE standards was already noted (see note 44); and nearly all electricity generation that had previously relied on burning crude oil or a fuel oil was converted to coal or natural gas.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 48

  97. 1980 年后原油份额根据英国石油公司《世界能源统计评论》中的消费数据计算得出。

    返回笔记参考 49

  98. Post-1980 crude oil shares calculated from consumption data in British Petroleum, Statistical Review of World Energy.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 49

  99. 费曼，《费曼物理学讲义》，第 1 卷，第 4-6 页。

    返回笔记参考50

  100. Feynman, The Feynman Lectures on Physics, vol. 1, pp. 4–6.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 50

  101. 这些问题现在影响着越来越多的全球人口——自 2007 年以来，超过一半的人口居住在城市，到 2025 年，约有 10% 的人口将居住在特大城市。

    返回笔记参考51

  102. These concerns now affect an increasing share of the global population—since 2007, more than half of all people live in cities, and by 2025 about 10 percent will live in megacities.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 51

  103. B. Bowers，《延长白昼：照明史》（牛津：牛津大学出版社，1988 年）。

    返回笔记参考52

  104. B. Bowers, Lengthening the Day: A History of Lighting (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1988).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 52

  105. V. Smil ，  “发光效率”，IEEE Spectrum（2019 年 4 月），第 22 页。

    返回笔记参考53

  106. V. Smil, “Luminous efficacy,” IEEE Spectrum (April 2019), p. 22.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 53

  107. 小型交流电动机的首次商业应用出现在 19 世纪 80 年代后期的美国，19 世纪 90 年代，一台由 125 瓦电机驱动的小型风扇售出了近 10 万台：LC Hunter 和 L. Bryant，《美国工业动力史，1780-1930 年》，第 3 卷：动力传输（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1991 年），第 202 页。

    返回笔记参考54

  108. First commercial uses of small AC electric motors came in the US during the late 1880s, and during the 1890s a small fan powered by a 125 W motor sold nearly 100,000 units: L. C. Hunter and L. Bryant, A History of Industrial Power in the United States, 1780–1930, vol. 3: The Transmission of Power (Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1991), p. 202.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 54

  109. SH Schurr，“能源利用、技术变革和生产效率”，《能源年鉴》 9（1984），第409-425页。

    返回笔记参考55

  110. S. H. Schurr, “Energy use, technological change, and productive efficiency,” Annual Review of Energy 9 (1984), pp. 409–425.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 55

  111. 两种基本设计分别是偏心旋转质量振动电机和线性振动电机。硬币型电机是目前最薄的电机（厚度仅为 1.8 毫米）（https://www.vibrationmotors.com/vibration-motor-product-guide/cell-phone-vibration-motor [已失效]）。鉴于全球智能手机的销量——2019 年达到 13.7 亿部（https://www.canalys.com/newsroom/canalys-global-smartphone-market-q4-2019）——目前没有任何其他类型的电机能够与之匹敌。

    返回笔记参考56

  112. Two basic designs are eccentric rotating mass vibration motors and linear vibration motors. Coin-type motors are now the thinnest (as little as 1.8 mm) available units (https://www.vibrationmotors.com/vibration-motor-product-guide/cell-phone-vibration-motor [inactive]). Given the global smartphone sales—1.37 billion units in 2019 (https://www.canalys.com/newsroom/canalys-global-smartphone-market-q4-2019)—no other electric motors are now made in comparable quantities.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 56

  113. 法国TGV列车有两节动力车，其电机总功率为8.8-9.6兆瓦。日本N700系列新干线列车16节车厢中有14节是动力车，总功率为17兆瓦：http://www.railway-research.org/IMG/pdf/r.1.3.3.3.pdf。

    返回笔记参考57

  114. French TGV trains have two power cars whose motors have total power of 8.8–9.6 MW. In Japan’s Series N700 Shinkansen, 14 out of 16 cars are motor cars with a total power of 17 MW: http://www.railway-research.org/IMG/pdf/r.1.3.3.3.pdf.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 57

  115. 在豪华车辆中，这些小型电动伺服电机的总质量可能高达 40 公斤：G. Ombach，“电机大批量生产的挑战和要求”，SAE（2017 年），http://www.sae.org/events/training/symposia/emotor/presentations/2011/GrzegorzOmbach.pdf。

    返回笔记参考58

  116. In luxury vehicles, the total mass of these small electric servomotors may be as much as 40 kg: G. Ombach, “Challenges and requirements for high volume production of electric motors,” SAE (2017), http://www.sae.org/events/training/symposia/emotor/presentations/2011/GrzegorzOmbach.pdf.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 58

  117. 有关厨房电器中电动机的更多信息，请参阅 Johnson Electric 的文章“食品加工机的定制电机驱动器”（2020 年），网址为 https://www.johnsonelectric.com/en/features/custom-motor-drives-for-food-processors。

    返回笔记参考59

  118. For more on electric motors in kitchen appliances, see Johnson Electric, “Custom motor drives for food processors” (2020), https://www.johnsonelectric.com/en/features/custom-motor-drives-for-food-processors.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 59

  119. 墨西哥城是这种非凡需求的最佳例证：主要水源库察马拉河的水供应了总需求的约三分之二，而且必须将其提升超过 1 公里；年输送量超过 3 亿立方米，这代表了超过 3 PJ 的潜在能量，相当于近 8 万吨柴油燃料。R. Salazar 等人，“墨西哥城供水相关的能源和环境成本”，《供水》 12（2012），第 768-772 页。

    返回笔记参考 60

  120. Mexico City is the best example of such an extraordinary demand: water from the main source, the Cutzamala River, supplies about two-thirds of the total demand, and it must be lifted more than 1 km; with an annual delivery in excess of 300 million m3 this represents potential energy of more than 3 PJ, equivalent to nearly 80,000 tons of diesel fuel. R. Salazar et al., “Energy and environmental costs related to water supply in Mexico City,” Water Supply 12 (2012), pp. 768–772.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 60

  121. 这些电机功率相当小（0.25-0.5马力；即约190-370瓦），即使是功率较大的鼓风机电机，其功率也比小型食品加工机的电机（400-500瓦）要小。吹风比切碎和揉面要容易得多。

    返回笔记参考 61

  122. These are fairly small (0.25–0.5 hp; that is, about 190–370 W) motors, as even the larger blower motor has less power than the one in a small food processor (400–500 W). Forcing air is a much easier task than chopping and kneading.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 61

  123. L. Figuier，《科学的新征服：电力》（巴黎：弗拉马里翁庄园，1888 年）；A. Gay 和 CH Yeaman，《中央车站电力供应》（伦敦：惠特克公司，1906 年）；M. MacLaren，《十九世纪电气工业的兴起》（普林斯顿，新泽西州：普林斯顿大学出版社，1943 年）；Smil，《创造二十世纪》，第 32-97 页，都记载了电力的早期历史。

    返回笔记参考 62

  124. The early history of electricity is recounted in L. Figuier, Les nouvelles conquêtes de la science: L’électricité (Paris: Manoir Flammarion, 1888); A. Gay and C. H. Yeaman, Central Station Electricity Supply (London: Whittaker & Company, 1906); M. MacLaren, The Rise of the Electrical Industry During the Nineteenth Century (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1943); Smil, Creating the Twentieth Century, pp. 32–97.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 62

  125. 即使在美国，这一比例也只是略高一些。2019 年，美国所有化石燃料（大致分为煤炭和天然气两部分，液体燃料所占比例微乎其微）的 27.5% 用于发电：https://flowcharts.llnl.gov/content/assets/images/energy/us/Energy_US_2019.png。

    返回笔记参考 63

  126. Even in the US it is only slightly higher. In 2019, 27.5 percent of all US fossil fuels (roughly split between coal and natural gas, with liquid fuels accounting for a negligible share) were used to generate electricity: https://flowcharts.llnl.gov/content/assets/images/energy/us/Energy_US_2019.png.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 63

  136. A large collection of nighttime satellite images is available at https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/images/event/79869/earth-at-night.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 68

  137. 电力研究院，《微电网指标：可靠性和电能质量》（加利福尼亚州帕洛阿尔托：EPRI，2016 年），http://integratedgrid.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/4-Key-Microgrid-Reliability-PQ-metrics.pdf。

    返回笔记参考 69

  138. Electric Power Research Institute, Metrics for Micro Grid: Reliability and Power Quality (Palo Alto, CA: EPRI, 2016), http://integratedgrid.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/4-Key-Microgrid-Reliability-PQ-metrics.pdf.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 69

  139. 在新冠肺炎死亡率居高不下的时期，电力供应没有出现问题，但一些城市出现了太平间容量暂时短缺的情况，冷藏车不得不被调派到其他地方。已部署。殡仪馆冷藏是另一个依赖电动机的关键领域：https://www.fiocchetti.it/en/prodotti.asp?id =7 。

    返回笔记参考70

  140. There were no problems with electricity supply during the periods of high COVID-19 mortality, but in some cities there were temporary shortages of mortuary capacity and refrigerated trucks had to be deployed. Mortuary refrigeration is another critical sector dependent on electric motors: https://www.fiocchetti.it/en/prodotti.asp?id=7.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 70

  141. 这一概念承认不可能完全消除人为二氧化碳排放，但对于直接从空气中捕获二氧化碳的规模究竟需要多大，以及是否存在大规模且经济实惠的捕获方法，目前尚无共识。我将在最后一章探讨其中的一些方案。

    返回笔记参考71

  142. The concept recognizes that it will not be possible to eliminate all anthropogenic emissions of CO2, but neither is there any agreement about how substantial the direct capture from the air would have to be nor any large-scale and affordable processes to do so. I will consider some of these options in the closing chapter.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 71

  143. 联合国气候变化框架公约，“净零排放承诺在不到一年的时间内翻了一番”（2020 年 9 月），https://unfccc.int/news/commitments-to-net-zero-double-in-less-than-a-year。另见气候行动追踪器（https://climateactiontracker.org/countries/）。

    返回笔记参考72

  144. United Nations Climate Change, “Commitments to net zero double in less than a year” (September 2020), https://unfccc.int/news/commitments-to-net-zero-double-in-less-than-a-year. See also the Climate Action Tracker (https://climateactiontracker.org/countries/).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 72

  145. 丹麦能源署，年度能源统计（2020 年），https://ens.dk/en/our-services/statistics-data-key-figures-and-energy-maps/annual-and-monthly-statistics。

    返回笔记参考73

  147. 德国装机容量和发电量数据可在以下网址找到：Bundesverband der Energie-und Wasserwirtschaft，Kraftwerkspark in Deutschland (2018)，https://www.bdew.de/energie/kraftwerkspark-deutschland-gesamtfoliensatz/； VGB，Stromerzeugung 2018/2019，https://www.vgb.org/daten_stromerzeugung.html? dfid =93254。

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 74

  149. 计划开发五个大型美国输电项目的清洁能源公司于 2019 年倒闭，而原计划在 2020 年成为美国新电网骨干的平原和东部清洁输电线路（其环境影响报告已于 2014 年完成）也因美国能源部退出该项目而告终；该项目甚至可能到 2030 年都无法建成。

    返回笔记参考75

  150. Clean Line Energy, the company that planned to develop five large US transmission projects, folded in 2019, and the Plains & Eastern Clean Line that was to become the backbone of a new US grid by 2020 (its environmental impact statement was already completed in 2014) ended with the US Department of Energy pulling out of the project; it may not be built even by 2030.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 75

  151. N. Troja 和 S. Law，“让我们灵活起来——抽水蓄能与电力系统的未来”，IHA 网站（2020 年 9 月）。2019 年，佛罗里达电力照明公司 (FPL) 宣布了全球最大的电池储能项目——900 兆瓦时的马纳提项目，该项目将于 2021 年底竣工。但目前全球最大的抽水蓄能电站（位于美国巴斯县）的容量为 24 吉瓦时，是 FPL 未来储能容量的 27 倍。2019 年全球抽水蓄能的容量为 9 太瓦时，而电池储能的容量约为 7 吉瓦时——两者相差近 1300 倍。

    返回笔记参考76

  152. N. Troja and S. Law, “Let’s get flexible—Pumped storage and the future of power systems,” IHA website (September 2020). In 2019, Florida Power and Light announced the world’s largest battery-storage, 900-MWh Manatee project to be completed in late 2021. But the largest pump hydro station (Bath County in the US) has a capacity of 24 GWh, 27 times the future FPL storage, and the global capacity of pumped hydro in 2019 was 9 TWh compared to some 7 GWh in batteries—nearly a 1,300-fold difference.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 76

  153. 为一个拥有 2000 万人口的特大城市提供一天的储能，至少需要 300 GWh，这比佛罗里达州世界上最大的电池储能容量还要大 300 多倍。

    返回笔记参考77

  154. A single-day storage for a megacity of 20 million people would have to provide at least 300 GWh, a total more than 300 times larger than the world’s largest battery storage in Florida.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 77

  155. 欧盟委员会，《到 2050 年实现气候中和》（布鲁塞尔：欧盟委员会，2020 年）。

    返回笔记参考78

  156. European Commission, Going Climate-Neutral by 2050 (Brussels: European Commission, 2020).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 78

  157. 2019 年，最畅销电动汽车中的锂离子电池的能量密度约为 250 Wh/kg：G. Bower，“特斯拉 Model 3 2170 能量密度与 Bolt、Model S1009D 的比较”，InsideEVs（2019 年 2 月），https ://insideevs.com/news/342679/tesla-model-3-2170-energy-density-compared-to-bolt-model-s-p100d/ 。

    返回笔记参考79

  158. In 2019, lithium-ion batteries in the best-selling electric vehicles rated about 250 Wh/kg: G.   159. 2020 年 1 月，最长的定期航班是纽瓦克-新加坡（9,534 公里）、奥克兰-多哈和珀斯-伦敦，其中纽瓦克-新加坡航线大约需要 18 小时：T. Pallini，“2019 年航空公司飞行的 10 条最长航线”，Business Insider（2020 年 4 月），https://www.businessinsider.com/top-10-longest-flight-routes-in-the-world-2020-4。

    返回笔记参考80

For a different perspective, see Energy Transitions Commission, Mission Possible: Reaching Net-Zero Carbon Emissions from Harder-to-Abate Sectors by Mid-Century (2018), http://www.energy-transitions.org/sites/default/files/ETC_MissionPossible_FullReport.pdf.

2. 了解食物生产：食用化石燃料

2. Understanding Food Production: Eating Fossil Fuels

  1. BL Pobiner，“关于人类食腐机会的生态和能量学的新现实数据”，《人类进化杂志》 80（2015），第1-16页；RJ Blumenschine和JA Cavallo，“食腐与人类进化”，《科学美国人》 267/4（1992），第90-95页。

    返回笔记参考 1

  2. B. L. Pobiner, “New actualistic data on the ecology and energetics of hominin scavenging opportunities,” Journal of Human Evolution 80 (2015), pp. 1–16; R. J. Blumenschine and J. A. Cavallo, “Scavenging and human evolution,” Scientific American 267/4 (1992), pp. 90–95.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 1

  3. V. Smil，《能源与文明：一部历史》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，2018 年），第 28-40 页。

    返回笔记参考 2

  4. V. Smil, Energy and Civilization: A History (Cambridge, MA: MIT Press 2018), pp. 28–40.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 2

  5. KW Butzer，《埃及早期水利文明》（芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1976 年）；KW Butzer，“法老时期埃及尼罗河长期洪水变化与政治断裂”，载于 JD Clark 和 SA Brandt 编，《从狩猎者到农民》（伯克利：加州大学出版社，1984 年），第 102-112 页。

    返回笔记参考3

  6. K. W. Butzer, Early Hydraulic Civilization in Egypt (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1976); K. W. Butzer, “Long-term Nile flood variation and political discontinuities in Pharaonic Egypt,” in J. D. Clark and S. A. Brandt, eds., From Hunters to Farmers (Berkeley: University of California Press 1984), pp. 102–112.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 3

  7. 联合国粮农组织，《世界粮食安全和营养状况》（罗马：联合国粮农组织，2020 年），http://www.fao.org/3/ca9692en/CA9692EN.pdf。

    返回笔记参考 4

  8. FAO, The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World (Rome: FAO, 2020), http://www.fao.org/3/ca9692en/CA9692EN.pdf.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 4

  9. 光谱中被大量吸收的波长为：蓝色部分为 450–490 nm，红色部分为 635–700 nm；绿色（520–560 nm）被大量反射，因此植被呈现主要颜色。

    返回笔记参考5

  10. Wavelengths that are largely absorbed are 450–490 nm for the blue and 635–700 nm for the red part of the spectrum; green (520–560 nm) is largely reflected, hence the vegetation’s dominant color.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 5

  11. 陆地（森林、草原、农作物）和海洋（主要是浮游植物）光合作用的总年生产力大致相同，但与陆地植物不同，浮游植物的寿命非常短暂，只能持续几天。

    返回笔记参考 6

  12. Total annual productivity of terrestrial (forests, grasslands, crops) and oceanic (mostly phytoplankton) photosynthesis is roughly the same, but unlike land plants, phytoplankton is very short-lived, persisting for just a few days.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 6

  13. L. Rogin 在其著作《农机引入》 （伯克利：加州大学出版社，1931 年）中详细记载了 19 世纪美国的耕作方式。1800 年的时间预算是基于 1790 年至 1820 年间的耕作方式制定的，详情见第 234 页。

    返回笔记参考7

  14. Detailed accounts of 19th-century American cropping practices are compiled in L. Rogin, The Introduction of Farm Machinery (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1931). The time budget for 1800 is based on practices prevailing between 1790 and 1820, detailed on p. 234.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 7

  15. 根据罗金 (Rogin) 1893 年在北达科他州里奇兰县的小麦种植数据进行计算，第 218 页。

    返回笔记参考 8

  16. Calculations based on Rogin’s data for wheat cultivation in North Dakota’s Richland county in 1893, p. 218.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 8

  17. Smil，《能源与文明》，第 111 页。

    返回笔记参考9

  18. Smil, Energy and Civilization, p. 111.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 9

  19. 有关 1850 年至 1940 年间美国农场的平均规模，请参阅美国农业部，《美国农业普查：1940 年》，第 68 页。有关堪萨斯州农场的规模，请参阅堪萨斯州农业部，《堪萨斯州农场概况》（2019 年），https://agriculture.ks.gov/about-kda/kansas-agriculture。

    返回笔记参考10

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 11

  23. 我的计算基于 2020 年堪萨斯州非灌溉小麦的作物预算和典型的工作效率估算：堪萨斯州立大学，《2020 年非灌溉作物农场管理指南》，https://www.agmanager.info/farm-mgmt-guides/2020-farm-management-guides-non-irrigated-crops；B. Battel 和 D. Stein，《定制机械和工作效率估算》（2018 年）。https://www.canr.msu.edu/field_crops/uploads/files/2018percent20Custompercent20Machinepercent20Workpercent20Rates.pdf [已失效]。

    返回笔记参考 12

  24. My calculations are based on 2020 crop budgets for non-irrigated Kansas wheat and on typical work rate estimates: Kansas State University, 2020 Farm Management Guides for Non-Irrigated Crops, https://www.agmanager.info/farm-mgmt-guides/2020-farm-management-guides-non-irrigated-crops; B. Battel and D. Stein, Custom Machine and Work Rate Estimates (2018), https://www.canr.msu.edu/field_crops/uploads/files/2018percent20Custompercent20Machinepercent20Workpercent20Rates.pdf [inactive].

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 12

  25. 量化这些间接能源利用需要许多不可避免的假设和近似值，因此永远无法像监测直接燃料消耗那样准确。

    返回笔记参考13

  26. Quantification of these indirect energy uses requires many inevitable assumptions and approximations, and hence it can never be as accurate as the monitoring of direct fuel consumption.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 13

  27. 例如，欧洲使用草甘膦（世界上使用最广泛的除草剂）的平均用量仅为每公顷 100-300 克活性成分：C. Antier，“欧洲农业部门草甘膦的使用及其进一步监测框架”，《可持续性》 12 (2020)，第 5682 页。

    返回笔记参考14

  28. For example, European applications of glyphosate, the world’s most widely used herbicide, average just 100–300 g of active ingredient per hectare: C. Antier, “Glyphosate use in the European agricultural sector and a framework for its further monitoring,” Sustainability 12 (2020), p. 5682.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 14

  29. V. Gowariker 等人，《肥料百科全书》（奇切斯特：约翰·威利出版社，2009 年）；HF Reetz，《肥料及其有效利用》（巴黎：国际肥料协会，2016 年）。

    返回笔记参考15

  30. V. Gowariker et al., The Fertilizer Encyclopedia (Chichester: John Wiley, 2009); H. F. Reetz, Fertilizers and Their Efficient Use (Paris: International Fertilizer Association, 2016).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 15

  31. 但迄今为止，施用氮肥最多的作物是日本的绿茶。其干叶含氮量为 5-6%；茶园通常施用超过 500 公斤氮/公顷，甚至高达 1 吨氮/公顷：K. Oh 等人，“日本茶叶种植的环境问题及使用氰胺钙的控制措施”，《土壤圈》 16/6 (2006)，第 770-777 页。

    返回笔记参考16

  32. But the crop that has received by far the highest nitrogen applications is Japan’s green tea. Its dry leaves contain 5–6 percent nitrogen; plantations get commonly more than 500 kg N/ha and as much as 1 t N/ha: K. Oh et al., “Environmental problems from tea cultivation in Japan and a control measure using calcium cyanamide,” Pedosphere 16/6 (2006), pp. 770–777.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 16

  33. GJ Leigh 编，《千年固氮作用》（阿姆斯特丹：Elsevier，2002 年）；T. Ohyama 编，《固氮作用的生物学和生态学进展》（IntechOpen，2014 年），https://www.intechopen.com/books/advances-in-biology-and-ecology-of-nitrogen-fixation [已失效]。

    返回笔记参考22

  44. G. Piringer and L. J. Steinberg, “Reevaluation of energy use in wheat production in the United States,” Journal of Industrial Ecology 10/1–2 (2006), pp. 149–167; C. G. Sørensen et al., “Energy inputs and GHG emissions of tillage systems, Biosystems Engineering 120 (2014), pp. 2–14; W. M. J. Achten and K. van Acker, “EU-average impacts of wheat production: A meta-analysis of life cycle assessments,” Journal of Industrial Ecology 20/1 (2015), pp. 132–144; B. Degerli et al., “Assessment of the energy and exergy efficiencies of farm to fork grain cultivation and bread making processes in Turkey and Germany,” Energy 93 (2015), pp.  421–434.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 22

  45. 柴油燃料被所有大型农用机械（拖拉机、联合收割机、卡车、灌溉水泵）以及农作物的长途散装运输（柴油机车牵引的货运列车、驳船、船舶）所使用。小型拖拉机和皮卡车使用汽油，而丙烷则用于谷物烘干。

    返回笔记参考23

  46. Diesel fuel is used by all large farm machinery (tractors, combines, trucks, irrigation pumps) as well as in long-distance bulk transportation of crops (freight trains pulled by diesel locomotives, barges, ships). Small tractors and pickup trucks run on gasoline, and propane is used for grain drying.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 23

  47. 这比美国用来计量烹饪食材的量杯略小一些：它的容量正好是 236.59 毫升。

    返回笔记参考24

  48. This is just a bit less voluminous than the US cup used to measure cooking ingredients: it is exactly 236.59 mL.

  72. A tomato contains about 20 mg of vitamin C per 100 g; the recommended daily dietary intake of vitamin C is 60 mg for adults.

  75. 阿尔梅里亚的番茄作物每年每公顷施用 1,000-1,500 公斤氮肥，而美国谷物玉米的平均作物每公顷施用 150 公斤氮肥：美国农业部，《肥料使用和价格》（2020 年），表 10，https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/fertilizer-use-and-price.aspx。

  79. 欧洲长途卡车的典型油耗为30升/百公里或11兆焦/公里：国际清洁交通委员会，《燃料》欧盟和美国对牵引车-拖车进行油耗测试（2018 年 5 月）。

    返回笔记参考 40

  80. Typical fuel consumption of European long-distance trucks is 30 L/100 km or 11 MJ/km: International Council of Clean Transportation, Fuel Consumption Testing of Tractor-Trailers in the European Union and the United States (May 2018).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 40

  81. 工业规模的捕捞活动目前已遍及全球超过 55% 的海洋，其面积是全球农业用地面积的四倍多：DA Kroodsma 等人，“追踪渔业的全球足迹”，《科学》 359/6378 (2018)，第 904-908 页。非法捕捞船只关闭了应答器，但数千艘合法作业的渔船（橙色标记）的位置可以在https://www.marinetraffic.com上实时查看。

    返回笔记参考 41

  82. Industrial-scale fishing now takes place in more than 55 percent of the world’s oceans, encompassing an area that is more than four times as large as that dedicated to global agriculture: D. A. Kroodsma et al., “Tracking the global footprint of fisheries,” Science 359/6378 (2018), pp. 904–908. Illegally fishing ships turn off their transponders, but the locations of thousands of legally operating fishing vessels (orange markers) can be seen in real time at https://www.marinetraffic.com.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 41

  83. RWR Parker 和 PH Tyedmers，“全球渔船队的燃料消耗：目前的理解和知识差距”，《渔业》 16/4 (2015)，第 684-696 页。

    返回笔记参考 42

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 42

  85. 在欧洲，用破坏性底拖网捕捞的甲壳类动物（虾和龙虾）的能源成本最高，最高可达每公斤渔获物 17.3 升。

    返回笔记参考 43

  86. The highest energy cost is for crustaceans (shrimps and lobster) caught by destructive bottom trawls in Europe, with maxima up to 17.3 L/kg of catch.

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 43

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 48

  97. 农业整合一直在稳步推进：JM MacDonald 等人，《美国农业三十年的整合》，美国农业部经济信息公报 189（2018 年 3 月）。即使在许多农业大国，食品进口占总消费的比例也在上升。净食品出口国（美国、加拿大、澳大利亚、法国）主要是由于对新鲜水果、蔬菜和海鲜的需求较高。自 2010 年以来，美国人外出就餐的预算比例已经超过了在家用餐的预算比例：MJ Saksena 等人，《美国人的饮食习惯：外出就餐》（华盛顿特区：美国农业部，2018 年）。

    返回笔记参考 49

  98. Farm consolidation has been steadily progressing: J. M. MacDonald et al., “Three Decades of Consolidation in U.S. Agriculture,” USDA Economic Information Bulletin 189 (March 2018). Food imports as a share of total consumption have been rising even in many nations that are large net food exporters (USA, Canada, Australia, France), mainly because of higher demand for fresh fruits, vegetables, and seafood. Since 2010, the share of Americans’ budget for food away from home has been surpassing the share for food at home: M. J. Saksena et al., America’s Eating Habits: Food Away From Home (Washington, DC: USDA, 2018).

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 49

  99. S. Lebergott，“劳动力和就业，1800-1960 年”，载于 DS Brady 编，《1800 年后美国的产出、就业和生产率》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：NBER，1966 年），第 117-204 页。

    BACK TO NOTE REFERENCE 51

  103. 有关多种有机废弃物的氮含量，请参阅 Smil 的《富饶地球》附录 B，第 234-236 页。有关肥料的氮含量，请参阅Yara 2018 年肥料行业手册，https://www.yara.com/siteassets/investors/057-reports-and-presentations/other/2018/fertilizer-industry-handbook-2018-with-notes.pdf/。
